loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth is 63 years old, married, and together they are blessed with four children. She has been earning a monthly income of KES 10,000 from selling materials and clothes for the past eleven years. 

This will be her second loan with KADET LTD of KES. 20,000, which she intends to use to buy an electric sewing machine to ease the work, and also clothing materials. 

She will use the anticipated profit to widen the market scope of the business. Her future hopes and dreams are to have a stable business and happy family.

loans.use: to buy an electric sewing machine and clothing materials.

loans.name: Angel Vinicio

texts.es:
ANGEL VINICIO de 30 años de edad,  es soltero no tiene hijos vive con los padres  en el Recinto Rancho Grande, perteneciente al cantón Ventanas.

La VRC  Bendición de Dios se   encuentra ubicada en el Recinto  Rancho Grande de la parroquia Puerto Pechiche a  45 minutos  de la oficina, está conformada por 11 socios.

ANGEL VINICIO  se dedica a la agricultura, cultivo de maíz y arroz. Solicita el crédito para comprar urea, fertilizantes, insecticidas, abono orgánico así mejorar sus cultivos.

Las compras y ventas las ejecuta en  Ventanas cada 15 dias. El sueño es comprar una finca para poder trabajar.

Los desafíos a los que se enfrentan  son las plagas que se presentan en los cultivos como el ratón y la langosta, En el tiempo libre le gusta trabajar y jugar pelota.
texts.en:
Angel Vinicio is 30 years old, single and doesn't have children. She lives with his parents in Recinto Rancho Grande, which is part of Ventanas canton. The communal bank Bendición de Dios [God's Blessing] is located in Recinto Rancho Grande, in Puerto Pechiche parish, 45 minutes from the program office. It is formed by 11 members. 

Angel Vinicio is a farmer, and grows corn and rice. He is applying for the loan in order to buy urea, fertilizers, insecticides and organic manure to improve his crops.

He does his purchasing and sales in Ventanas every 15 days. His dream is to buy a farm to work there. The challenges he faces are pest infestations that affect the crops, such as mice and locusts. In his free time, he likes to work and play ball.

loans.use: to buy urea, fertilizers, insecticides, and organic manure to improve his crops.

loans.name: 8 De Diciembre Group

texts.es:
El comité "8 de Diciembre" tiene 2 años de formación y trabájo con al Fundación Paraguaya , la mayoría de sus integrantes ya viene realizando una actividad productiva, y es gracias a esa actividad que cada una de ella sale adelante.
La Sra. Nelida es una de las integrantes de éste comité , se unió al comité por la necesidad de tener un mayor ingresos para solventar los diversos gastos del hogar y así dar a su familia todo lo que necesitan. Es vendedora ambulante de remedios naturales y tambien realiza reciclaje de materiales como ser (alumino, plasticos, papel, hierro, etc). Anhela un futuro mejor para sus hijos es por eso que se esfuerza todos los días para darles la oportunidad de estudiar y lograr un futuro mejor.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de remedios naturales para la venta, ya que así podrá seguir trabajando y saliendo adelante por medio de su esfuerzo.
texts.en:
The communal bank 8 de Diciembre was formed and has been working with the Fundación Paraguaya for two years. Most of the members are already working in a productive activity and it is thanks to the activity that each one of them is getting ahead.

Nelida is one of the members of this bank. She joined due to the necessity of having more income to pay the various household expenses and give her family everything they need. She is a traveling salesperson selling natural remedies and she also recycles materials such as aluminum, plastic, paper, iron, etc. She yearns for a better future for her children and this is why she pushes herself every day to give them the opportunity to study and to attain a better future.

She is asking for a loan to buy natural remedies to sell so she can continue working and getting ahead through her struggles.

loans.use: to buy natural remedies to sell in her work as a traveling salesperson.

loans.name: Las Amigas Group

texts.es:
El Comité denomidado Amigas, es de la Ciudad de Caaguazú, actualmente estan en el ciclo 12, es un grupo conformado por señoras humildes muy trabajadoras que luchan dia a dia para sobresalir adelante.
La Presidenta del Grupo es la Sra. Claudelina, ella se dedica al comercio, tiene un almacén bien surtido, en el que trabaja con la ayuda de su marido, ella es una persona muy  trabajadora y por medio de su trabajo quiere seguir saliendo adelante.
Solicita el crédito para la compra de bebidas, gaseosas, lácteos y demás insumos para poder seguir trabajando y saliendo adelante.
texts.en:
The communal bank called "Las Amigas" (The Friends) is from the city of Caaguazú. They are now in their 12th loan cycle. The group consists of humble, very hard-working women who strive every day to achieve.

The president of the group is Señora Claudelina. She works in commerce. She has a well-stocked store, in which she works with the help of her husband. She is a very hard-working person, and through her work she wants to continue advancing.

She is applying for the loan to purchase beverages, soft drinks, dairy products, and other items in order to be able to continue working and advancing.

loans.use: to buy beverages, soft drinks, milk products, and other items for her store.

loans.name: Maria De La Luz

texts.es: Maria de la Luz, es originaria de la ciudad de Monterrey, N.L. Méx., ella proviene de una familia numerosa y de escasos recursos, por lo que desde muy chica se dio a la tarea de buscar la forma de contribuir a los gastos del hogar, una vez que salió de la escuela Primaria buscó trabajo como ayudante en un  taller de costura;  ganaba en ese entonces una cantidad de dinero mínima, dinero íntegro que se lo entregaba a su mamá por semana. Poco a poco fue aprendiendo el arte de diseñar prendas de vestir por lo que años mas tarde tuvo la  confianza de independizarse y compro con mucho sacrificio y en abonos, su primera maquina para coser. Ella es madre soltera por lo que la responsabilidad la obligó a buscar su crecimiento y consiguó comprar 3 maquinas industriales de  costura  y montó un modesto taller en una habitación y contrató a 2 colaboradoras. La Sra. Maria piensa que puede tener más capacidad de producción, por lo que solicitó un crédito para ampliar su negocio y mejorar sus ingresos. Su Hijo Juan Carlos de 16 años cusrsa el segundo semestre de la Escurla Preparatoria por lo que a Maria le interesa sacar a su hijo adelante.
texts.en:
María de la Luz is from the city of Monterrey, Nuevo León, México.  She comes from a large family of limited resources which is why she started at a very young age looking for a way to contribute towards household expenses.  

Once she completed elementary school she looked for work as an assistant in sewing workshops.  At that time she earned minimum wage and she’d give her mother the entire amount she earned each week.  She gradually learned the art of clothing design so years later became confident enough to become independent and with much sacrifice and by paying in installments was able to buy her first sewing machine.

She’s a single mother so the responsibility she carried impelled her to seek growth and she succeeded in buying three industrial sewing machines and set up a modest workshop and hired two workers.  María believes that she can increase her production capacity which is why she’s requested a loan to expand the business and improve her income.  Her sixteen-year-old son, Juan Carlos, is in second semester of high school which is why María is intent on moving him forward.

loans.use: to buy raw materials.

loans.name: Wellington Oswaldo

texts.es:
WELLINGTON OSWALDO, tiene 41 años de edad es casado, tiene 3 hijos,  vive con la esposa y con los hijos  en  el Recinto Rancho Grande, perteneciente al cantón Ventanas.

La VRC  Bendición de Dios se   encuentra ubicada en el Recinto  Rancho Grande de la parroquia Puerto Pechiche a  45 minutos  de la oficina, está conformada por 11 socios.

WELLINGTON OSWALDO se dedica a la agricultura, siembra  maíz, arroz además se dedica ala crianza de gallinas, cerdos y patos. Solicita el crédito para comprar  fertilizantes, abonos orgánicos, lìquidos para la maleza, urea, ranger. Con la yuda del crédito podrá comprar los insecticidas para los cultivos.

Las compras y ventas las ejecuta en  Ventanas de manera  semanal. El sueño es comprarse una finca.  Los desafíos a los que se enfrentan  son las plagas cómo el cogollero y ratón.

En su tiempo lo que le gusta hacer es pescar.
texts.en:
Wellington Oswaldo, 41, is married and has three children. He lives with his wife and children in Rancho Grande precinct in Ventanas canton. Bendición de Dios communal bank has 11 members and is located in Rancho Grande precinct in Puerto Pechiche parish, about 45 minutes from our office. 

Wellington Oswaldo is a farmer who grows corn and rice and also raises chickens, pigs, and ducks. He is applying for a loan to buy fertilizer, manure, weed killer, urea, and Ranger. He will be able to buy pesticides for his crops with the loan. He makes his purchases and sales in Ventanas weekly. He dreams of buying a farm. Fall armyworm and rats are some of the threats to his crops. He likes to fish in his free time.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, manure, weed killer, urea, and Ranger.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is 40 years old and is married with nine children who live at home and attend school. She lives in Airport and her husband is a missionary. Esther had to stop her education at the seventh grade. For the past eight years, she has been selling rice at the local market. Esther started her business with money given to her by her husband and she learned her business from people in the market. She enjoys her business and her everyday experiences.

Esther is requesting a loan to purchase more bags of rice to expand her business. In the future, she hopes to build a shop.

loans.use: to purchase bags of rice to sell

loans.name: Al-Haithm Group

texts.en:
This group is called Al-Haithm and consists of five women who live in Taiz, Yemen. They took out a loan of 210,000 YER from AMB.

Mriam (seated in the middle) is the leader of this group. She is 46 years old, married and has 13 children. She is a house woman and intends to build a second floor for her home. Therefore, she requested a loan of 50000 YER from AMB to buy construction supplies for her house. She hopes to build another home to house her children comfortably.

loans.use: to buy construction supplies for her house.

loans.name: Esperanza Group

texts.es:
Esperanza es un grupo solidario muy responsable y trabajador que lleva con la empresa 5 ciclos y sus juntas las realizan en el municipio de Monterrey.

Lidia es una mujer casada de 43 años de edad, vive en unión libre y tiene una vulcanizadora. Inicio junto con su esposo con ese pequeño negocio y el crédito le ayudara a comprar mas herramientas de trabajo. En un futuro desea ampliar mas la vulcanizadora, ya que el lugar donde esta es muy pequeño y tienen todo muy apretado.
texts.en: Esperanza (Hope) is a very supportive, responsible and hardworking group that’s been with the firm for five cycles; their meetings take place in the city of Monterrey.  Lidia, 43, is married living in a common law relationship.  She has a tire repair shop that she opened with her husband.  The loan will help her buy more work tools.  She hopes in future to expand the tire repair shop because the space it’s in now is very small and everything is crowded together.

loans.use: to buy tools.

loans.name: Omar De Jesús

texts.es:
El señor Omar esta solicitando un préstamo para realizar la mejora a su vivienda ya que le esta haciendo falta, el enjarre y pintura en el exterior.
El señor Omar trabaja en una fabrica e el aria de producción desde hace mas de cinco años y su esposa la señora Gloria lo apoya con las ganancias que obtiene de la venta de ropa que tiene afuera de su vivienda que tiene ya mas de dos años dedicándose. 
Con el sueldo de señor Omar será para pagar el crédito y que con las ganancias del negocio era para los gastos familiares y que solo cuentan con un hijo de 1 año de edad. 
Desean mejorar el patrimonio y proteger a su familia de enfermedades, ya que se presentan la temporada de lluvia y la humedad puede afectarle en la salud a su hijo.
texts.en:
Omar is requesting a loan to do some necessary home improvements; he will plaster and paint the exterior.

Omar has been employed in a factory in the production department for more than five years.  His wife, Gloria, helps him out with profits she earns selling clothes outside their house; she’s been in business for two years already.

The loan will be repaid with Omar’s salary since the profits from the business will be used for family expenses; they only have one son who is a year old.  They want to improve their main asset and protect the family from illnesses that can arise during the rainy season because the dampness can affect their son’s health.

loans.use: to refurbish the exterior of his house.

loans.name: Khaligy(20) Group

texts.en:
This group is called Khaligy(20). It consists of four ladies who live in Hodeidah, Yemen. 

Eyman is 46 years of age. She is a married woman and has six children. Her business is a retail one; she sells perfumes, incense, and clothes. She started her business with a small amount of help from her neighbor. 

She applied for a loan of 50,000 YER from AMB to buy more perfumes, incense, and clothes for her business.

loans.use: to buy more perfumes, incense, and clothes for her business.

loans.name: Miriam

texts.en: Miriam is 58 years old. From Ndunyu Njeru, she is married but has no children. Miriam is a farmer and has been in this business for the past many years. She has applied for her third loan from KADET LTD to enable her to buy fertilizers and seedlings to use on her farm. She hopes to become the top farmer in her neighborhood and be able to make lots of profits from her farm in the near future.

loans.use: To buy seedlings and fertilizers

loans.name: Mohamad Group

texts.en:
Fatima is the featured borrower for the Mohamad Group. She got together with her other group members to take this Al Majmoua loan because they have always been neighbors and friends. Fatima, seated on the right, is a 29-year-old married woman and mother of three children (Husein (m), 7 years; Zeinab, (f), 5 years; and Zahraa (f), 4 years). To help her husband in making their living and to take good care of her children, Fatima opened a nursery in her house five years ago. She does well in her business because most of the working mothers work hard to find a nursery that keeps their children in a safe and caring place. This was very smart because she is always home to respond to her children’s needs. Fatima is also very talented in hairdressing and she sells beauty cosmetics, which provides extra income to her family and covers unexpected expenses.

She applied for a loan from Kiva's partner Al Majmoua in order to improve her hairdressing business through the purchase of necessary creams and tools such as a hair dryer, wax machine and make-up set.

Zeinab, seated in the middle, is a 43-year-old married woman and mother of three children (Hawraa (f), 14 years; Fatima (f), 12 years; and Mohamad (m), 9 years). She sells beauty cosmetics and perfumes and is planning to expand her business by selling Brazilian Gold.

Iman, seated on the left, is a 32-year-old married woman and mother of two children (Abdallah (m), 13 years and Nancy (f), 9 years). She has been working as a hairdresser for the past eight years. She applied for a loan from Kiva's partner in order to pay for her son's tuition fees. She is planning to open a hairdressing shop to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase necessary creams and tools such as a hair dryer, wax machine and make-up set to improve her hairdressing business.

loans.name: Diana

texts.ru: Торговая точка Дианы расположена на центральном рынке. Она торгует женской и мужской одеждой, носками, колготами и штанами. У нее очень удобно расположено торговое  место, рядом стоянка для авто и хорошая проходимость покупателей. Кредит понадобился для очередной закупки носков, колгот, кофт и штанов. Диана - вежливая женщина, всегда вовремя выплачивает свой кредит.
texts.en: Diana's retail outlet is located at the central market.  She sells women's and men's clothing, socks, stockings and pants.  Her retail outlet is very conveniently located near the parking lot and is well-traveled by customers.  She needs this loan to purchase socks, stockings, cardigans and pants.  Diana is polite woman and always repays her loans on time.

loans.use: to purchase socks, stockings, cardigans and pants

loans.name: Mohamad

texts.en:
"My name is Mohamad, I'm the one who took out the loan to help develop my business. I will buy tools. This car needs engine repairs, and it won't run until I complete them."

Mohamad is 28 years old and he is requesting a YOUTH LOAN form Al Majmoua. He is a mechanic in Saida, is taking out a loan to purchase tools for his garage. For example, he will purchase a new car jack as one of his old ones is beyond repair. Mechanical car jacks are particularly important in Lebanon, where electricity is often cut. In fact, virtually all of Mohamad's work is done without any electricity whatsoever. Mohamad has shrewdly located his business directly behind the municipal auto inspection center so that customers will come directly to him if their vehicles fail inspection.

loans.use: to purchase new tools for his auto repair shop.

loans.name: Frances

texts.en:
Frances  is 42 years old and she lives in Airport Community.  She was educated through 9th grade.  She is married and has children between 10  to 22 years old who are living with her and going to school.

For the past ten years, she been selling used clothes in the market.  The problem that she faces is the rainy season.  Frances likes her business because it provides for her needs.  She is requesting a loan to purchase used clothes for her business.  Her plan is to send her children to college and build her house.

loans.use: to purchase used clothes for her business

loans.name: Lango

texts.en:
Lango lives in the Air Port Community. She is 43 years old and married, and her husband is a builder (construction). They have five children between 15 and 27 years old; two of them are in school and live at home. 

For the past seven years, she has been selling drinks in her community. She is requesting a loan to purchase more drinks (alcoholic) for her business. Her plan is to educate her children.

loans.use: to purchase more drinks (alcoholic) for her business.

loans.name: Kumba

texts.en: Kumba is 27 years old and lives in the Airport area. She is married and has three children between the ages of 4 and 9 that are in school and live at home. For the past nine years, she has been selling shortbread. She learned this way of selling from her mother and enjoys the profit she makes from her business. She is requesting a loan to purchase more sugar, flour, wood, etc., for her business. Her plans are to buy a piece of land and build a house.

loans.use: to purchase more sugar, flour, wood, etc., for her business

loans.name: Martin

texts.en:
Martin is 60 years old. He is married to a farmer; they both have three children. He has been a maize farmer for 40 years. He will use the Kiva loan to support labor costs and buy fertilizer during maize production. He needs to buy fertilizer in order to increase his production. 

With profits from his farming, he wishes to invest in his business so that in the future he can acquire machines like tractors that will enhance his farming capacity. He was very happy and excited that the previous season was very helpful for both family needs and business. 

The photo was taken recently at a previous maize farming plantation.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to buy more fertilizers and support labor costs for maize production.

loans.name: Domingo

texts.en: Domingo, 54 years old, is married and has six children. He lives in a village where he has managed his hog-raising business for five years. He usually receives an income of PHP 7,000 per pig sold. Domingo is asking for a loan of PHP 10,000 to buy feed, vaccine and an additional hog to raise. He hopes that he can get the amount requested to further develop his business.

loans.use: to buy feed, vaccine and an additional hog to raise

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
Daniel is a dairy farmer who used his previous loan to buy a heifer, which he later sold.  He was able to use the profits from the sale to buy animal feed for his dairy cows.  This increased the milk production on his farm.  

Daniel has requested another loan of KES 100,000 to buy a dairy cow.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Yvonne

texts.en:
Yvonne is 35 years old. She is married to a farmer. She has been a maize farmer for 10 years. She will use the Kiva loan to support labor costs and fertilizer during maize production.   She needs to buy fertilizer to increase her production. With profits from her farming, she wishes to invest in her business, so that in the future she can acquire machines like tractors that will enhance her farming capacity.

The photo was taken recently at  another maize plantation.  Yvonne was very happy and excited that previous season was very helpful for both family needs and business. 

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product; generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizer and pay labor costs in maize production.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Grace is 38 years old and lives in Airport, Liberia. She is married and has two children ages 17 and 19 years old, they live at home and attend school. For the past ten years she has been selling bread in her community, she enjoys her business because it keeps her busy, and for the exchange of money. She is requesting a loan to purchase more bread for her business. She plans to build her house.

loans.use: to purchase more bread for her business.

loans.name: Lorpu

texts.en: Lorpu lives in the Airport community. She is 33 years old, married and has two children, ages 3 and 15 years old. They are in school and live at home. For the past ten years, she has been selling palm oil. A problem she faces is the rainy season. She is requesting a loan to purchase palm oil for her business. Her plan is to become an international businesswoman and build a house.

loans.use: to purchase palm oil for her business

loans.name: Próspero

texts.es:
Próspero es un señor de 68  años de edad, vecino de una comunidad rural de Costa Rica situada 45 kilómetros al sur de San José llamada San Cristóbal . San Cristóbal es una zona ligeramente montañosa donde se desarrollan actividades como el comercio, agricultura de hortalizas, café, artesanía, ganadería entre otras. 
Desde hace varios años  don Próspero se dedica a la agricultura, específicamente a siembra y cosecha de café una de las mayores actividades de la zona, es un hombre muy trabajador y emprendedor. Vive con su esposa y sus dos hijos quienes le son de mucha ayuda en las labores diarias . Actualmente está solicitando un crédito de quinientos mil colones (¢500.000) para comprar insumos agrícolas como plaguicidas, herbicidas, abonos y otros. Con este crédito dará mantenimiento a su cafeto, obtendrá café de buena calidad y económicamente saldrá adelante y mejorará su calidad de vida.
Don Próspero es socio de la Empresa de Crédito Comunal San Cristóbal Norte (SACRIN), una de las 150 organizaciones socias de EDESA en Costa Rica
texts.en:
Próspero, 68, is from a rural community in Costa Rica called San Cristóbal located 45 kilometers south of San José.  San Cristóbal is a slightly mountainous region where activities like commerce, vegetable farming, coffee growing, crafts and animal husbandry, among others take place.

Próspero has worked in agriculture for many years, specifically growing and harvesting coffee one of the zone’s most widespread activities.  He’s a very hardworking, enterprising man.  He lives with his wife and two children who are of great help to him in his daily chores.  

He’s currently requesting a five-hundred-thousand (¢500.000) colon loan to buy farm supplies like insecticide, herbicide, manure and others.  With this loan he’ll be able to care for his coffee plants and will obtain good quality coffee which will lead to economic profits and improved quality of life.  Próspero is a member of the “San Cristóbal Norte (SACRIN) communal bank one of Edesa’s 150 member organizations in Costa Rica.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies.

loans.name: Yvani

texts.en:
Yvani is 50 years old. He is married to a farmer. He has been a maize farmer for 18 years. He will use the Kiva loan to support labor costs and fertilizer during maize production.  He needs to buy fertilizer to increase his production. With profits from his farming, he wishes to invest in his business, so that in the future he can acquire machines like tractors that will enhance his farming capacity.

The photo was taken recently at another maize plantation.  Yvani was very happy and excited that previous season was very helpful for both family needs and business. 

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product; generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy fertiliser and pay labor costs in maize production.

loans.name: Ma Alejandrina

texts.es:
Alejandrina, tiene 51 años de edad, es madre soltera, tiene un hijo, vive en el municipio de Tela, Atlántida junto a su hijo y su nuera. Doña Alejandrina, tiene 15 años de realizar varias actividades de negocio, ella  vende mercadería como ropa, bolsos, carteras y cosméticos por encargos. La venta la realiza de manera ambulante. Además obtiene otros ingresos de la venta de pescado, compra y vende cerdos también por encargos. Tiene 6 años de ser cliente de ODEF, el préstamo actual es por 15,000 Lempiras y es el cuarto ciclo. Este préstamo lo invertirá en surtir el negocio de ropa para cumplir con los pedidos, compra de pescado fresco para la venta y  compra de alimento para el engorde de cerdos que tiene para luego venderlos.
Su objetivo es tener varias actividades de negocio de donde obtiene sus propios ingresos. Tiene como meta hacer grande su negocio para poder seguir mejorando su vivienda y tener una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Alejandrina, 51, is a single mother; she has a son.  She lives in the town of Tela, Atlántida with her son and daughter-in-law.  Alejandrina has been doing various business activities for 15 years.  She sells merchandise like clothes, purses and cosmetics on order from place to place.  She also earns extra income selling fish and she’s also a pig merchant to order.  She’s been an ODEF client for six years.  The current, 15,000 Lempira, loan the fourth cycle.  She will use this loan to stock her clothing business to fill pending orders and will buy fresh fish to sell as well as feed to fatten up the pigs she has to subsequently sell them.  Her goal is to have various business activities earning her own income.  Her goal is to enlarge the business so that she can continue making improvements to her home and have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy merchandise, fish and pig feed.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.es: Gloria es socia del Banco Comunal Palmeras desde hace 3 años. Es soltera y tiene 21 años. Gloria tiene su propio salón de belleza. Le gusta ser parte de Banco Comunal ya que en ella aprende bastante, gracias a las capacitaciones que ofrecen,ha aprendido a ahorrar. Esta agradecida con la institución por brindar facilidades de préstamos a jóvenes emprendedores. Gloria con el nuevo préstamo que solicita lo va invertir en la compra de tintes, cosméticos, entre  otros productos de belleza. Su sueño es tener un Spa ya mas equipado.
texts.en: Gloria has been a member of the “Palmeras” (Palm Trees) communal bank for three years.  She’s single and 21-years-old.  Gloria owns a beauty salon.  She likes being part of the communal bank because she learns quite a bit there thanks to the training they offer; she’s learned how to save.  She’s grateful to the institution for providing easy credit to young entrepreneurs.  Gloria will use the new loan she’s requesting to buy hair color and cosmetics among other beauty products. Her dream is to have a better equipped spa.

loans.use: to buy supplies for her beauty salon.

loans.name: Felicitas

texts.es: Felicitas es socia del Banco comunal Poder desde hace dos años. Tiene 35 años y es madres de 6 hijos. Se dedica a la venta de plantillas para zapato y zapatillas. Por otro lado también vende ropas para niños, damas y caballeros en las diferentes ferias. Le gusta ser parte de la institución ya que aprendió a ahorrar. Sobre las capacitaciones comenta que son muy interesantes y que tienen mucha enseñanza. Felicitas con el nuevo préstamo que solicita lo va invertir exclusivamente en la compra de ropa al por mayor, tanto así como para las plantillas. El sueño de felicitas es construir su propia casa.
texts.en: Felicitas has been a member of the “Poder” (Power) communal bank for two years.  She’s 35-years-old and the mother of six children.  She sells sole inserts for shoes and slippers.  She also sells children’s, women’s and men’s clothing in various street markets.  She likes being part of the institution because she’s learned how to save.  She comments that the training sessions are very interesting and they teach much.  Felicitas will use the new loan she’s requesting exclusively to buy clothes at wholesale as well as for the shoe inserts.  Her dream is to build a house of her own.

loans.use: to buy clothes at wholesale.

loans.name: Marisol

texts.en:
Marisol works hard to support her two children. She is married and has a general store business in the Philippines.

Marisol requested a PHP 6,500 loan through NWTF to buy a solar lamp.

She is getting the solar lamp because she wants to save money by minimizing her kerosene expenses.

Marisol is aware that by using the solar lamp, she is not only saving money, she is also helping the environment and reducing health and hazard risks to her family.

loans.use: To buy a solar lamp

loans.name: Anamie

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Anamie works hard to support her family.

She has a fish vending business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from a general store. Anamie is borrowing PHP 29,500 through NWTF to buy additional fish to sell for her fish vending business.

Anamie has been sustaining her business activities through her past 17 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy additional fish to sell

loans.name: Jelica

texts.en:
Jelica is a 47-year-old married woman. She has three children with ages ranging from 5 years to 23 years. She describes herself to be a polite woman.

 She operates a food stall where she sells porridge. Her business is located at a residential area and her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge to be the high price of flour. 

She will use the Kes 5,000 loan to buy flour for making porridge for selling. Her business goal is to run a hotel within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will be a successful businesswoman. 

This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy flour for making porridge for selling.

loans.name: Michael

texts.en:
Michael has a charcoal sales business. He has been in this business for the past four years, with good income. He is applying for his second loan from KADET LTD after paying the previous loan successfully. 

The loan will enable him to buy more sacks of charcoal to add to his stock for sale. 

He hopes to distribute charcoal to hotels and schools in the near future.

loans.use: to buy more sacks of charcoal to add to his stock.

loans.name: Katooke Kwekamba Group

texts.en:
Teopista, a 42-year-old married mother of four living in Kyenjojo, Uganda, has operated a stationery shop for 13 years. She started with 600,000 shillings from her own savings and now has capital of 3,000,000 shillings. Customers not paying on time, high taxes and inefficient power supply are her main challenges.

A member of Katooke Kwekamba Group, whose participants guarantee each other's loans, Teopista is requesting a loan to buy stationery to sell. She has a personal goal of building a permanent house and a business goal of diversifying business to include a restaurant.

loans.use: to buy stationery to sell.

loans.name: Bilha

texts.en:
Bilha has practiced farming in Nyahururu for the last 23 years. She is a farmer. She has applied for her second loan from KADET LTD to enable her to buy fertilizers and seeds to be used in her farm.

Bilha is optimistic that her livelihood will improve from the profits made from her farming business. In future, Bilha hopes to become one of the leading farmers in Nyahururu.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and seeds for her farm.

loans.name: Maria Guadalupe

texts.es: La señora  Maria Guadalupe, es casada tiene un hijo menor de edad; ambos  viven en la  casa de su padre; pues su esposo Lazaro que fabrica muebles y accesorios de madera decidio venderlos fuera de la Ciudad de Monterrey pues son mas faciles de vender en ciudades mas pequeñas;  Maria Guadalupe entonces emprendio un negocio propio para apoyar en la economia familiar, inicio vendiendo ropa,  con el paso del tiempo agrego articulos a su inventario de venta tales como, ropa de cama y manualidades diversas, Maria Guadalupe solicita apoyo para  acondicionar un espacio en casa exclusivo para su negocio y asi poder seguir creciendolo; su sueño y objetivo es que su hijo crezca con una buena educacion y que conjuntamente con su esposo Lazaro, tengan un negocio unico en la Ciudad de Monterrey sin la necesidad de que su esposo deba estar fuera de la ciudad y convivir ambos con su hijo.
texts.en:
María Guadalupe is married and has one minor son; they live in her father’s house because her husband, Lázaro, who works manufacturing furniture and wood accessories, decided to sell them outside Monterrey because it’s easier to sell them in smaller cities.  

Therefore, María Guadalupe started her own business to help with family economy.  She started out selling clothes and as time passed added other items to her inventory like bed linens and various crafts. 

María Guadalupe is requesting help to set up space at home to use exclusively for her business and continue growing this way.  Her dream and her objective is that her son develops with a good education and to have a unique business in the city of Monterrey with her husband, Lázaro, so that her husband will no longer have to be outside the city and they can both live together with their son.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is 65 years old and from Olkalou.  She is married with grown-up children and she even has grandchildren.

Mary is a farmer and has been in this business for many years. She has applied for her sixth loan from KADET LTD to enable her buy fertilizers and seedlings to be used in her farm.

She hopes to own a cereals store in the near future and see her grandchildren have a good life.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and seedlings.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more fertilizers and pay for labor.

loans.name: Rommel

texts.en: Rommel, 37, is engaged in catching and selling fish as a source of income. He has had this business for two years and earns about 200PHP per business day. His ambition in life is to improve the standard of living for his family and to give his four children the best education they need. Sometimes, there are problems they encounter, but, through their strong fortitude, they can endure. Right now, Rommel is requesting a loan amount of 7,000PHP to buy different kinds of fishes to sell and icebox to be used in the business.

loans.use: to buy different kinds of fishes to sell and icebox to be used in the business.

loans.name: Bayarkhuu

texts.en:
Bayarkhuu, 47, is a librarian and she has been working for 16 years nonstop in the college library in Darkhan, the second largest city in Mongolia. She is a widow and lives with her daughter in her studio apartment. Byarkhuu uses a furnace which uses coal to stay warm at home. Her daughter always has the flu due to feeling cold. So, Bayarkhuu wants to make repairs to her apartment. She is planning to put insulation in the windows and the wall corners. She will recover some broken and bad parts of the walls with cement and foam. This will reduce heat loss and Bayarkhuu will pay less for coal. Using coal is very harmful for her family's health and the environment, as she knows.

Although Mongolia has the lowest population density in the world, it is one of the most polluted countries in the world.  This is due to the long and cold winters where temperatures frequently go below -40C (-40F) even in the cities.  Also, in winter, many parts of the country are extremely cold and are known to have snow storms.  Both homes and nomadic tents burn a lot of fuel and emit huge amounts of pollution every night from families just trying to stay warm.  In addition, the extremely toxic smoke from cars is one of main reasons for Mongolia's air pollution. In response to this, Credit Mongol offers Green Loans to their clients to make home improvements that reduce heat loss and improve heating systems and to buy cars that run on natural gas.  The loan Bayarkhuu is taking will be dedicated to buying some building and insulation materials for her home repair.

loans.use: To buy some building and insulation materials for her home repair.

loans.name: Blanca Estela

texts.es: Blanca tiene 31 años de edad, casada tiene dos hijos, vive en el municipio de Tela, Atlántida con su familia. Ella tiene su propio negocio en su casa desde hace 6 años, donde vende desayunos, almuerzos y cenas. Además obtiene otros ingresos de la venta de ropa por encargos y compra y vende cerdos. Es muy emprendedora además de la venta de comida realiza otras actividades de negocio. El préstamo que solicita es el cuarto ciclo y es por 15,000 lempiras el cual lo invertirá en la compra de granos básicos, insumos para elaborar la comida, utensilios de cocina y comprara ropa para generar otros ingresos. Su plan es mejorar los ingresos para darles educación a sus hijos y mejorar su vivienda.
texts.en:
Blanca, 31, is married and has two children.  She lives in Tela, Atlántida with her family.  She has had her own, home-based business for six years.  She sells breakfast, lunch and dinner.  She also earns extra income selling clothes via catalogue and she also buys and sells pigs.  She is very enterprising; besides the food sales she does other business activities.

This 15,000 Lempira loan is her fourth cycle and she will use it to buy basic grains, ingredients for food preparation, kitchen utensils and clothes to generate additional income.  Her plan is to improve her income to provide schooling for her children and to do some home improvements.

loans.use: to buy ingredients, clothes and kitchen utensils.

loans.name: Naneth

texts.en:
Naneth is a 443 year old woman from the town of Trinidad, Bohol. She has four children ages 10-23. For 2 years now, Naneth relies in her Sari-sari store business for an income. She sell basic household items like toiletries, seasoning, canned goods, chips and other snack food. She is asking for a loan to buy coffee, sugar and soft drinks. The loan will help sustain her business so she can continue to operate while making improvements.  

In the future,  hopes to have a bigger store that will sell more variety of products that will cater to her customer and further improve her family's way of life.

loans.use: to buy coffee, sugar and soft drinks

loans.name: Kheam's Group

texts.en:
Kheam, 48 years old, lives in a rural area in the Sampov Meas district of Pursat province. She is the mother of seven children, three of whom are dependent on her and work in the local area to help the family generate income. Rice farming has been the family's main source of income for almost thirty years. Kheam’s husband also complements the family's income by working as a paid worker. 

Kheam is the leader of a loan group of four members who live in the same village. This will be Kheam's third loan with VisionFund; her past loan has helped her better support her children’s education. Kheam will use her portion of this loan to buy fertilizer for her farmland and will also use a portion of it for water pumping. She hopes this loan will enable her to increase her income to make living better and to keep her children in school.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for her farmland

loans.name: Abelino

texts.es:
Don Abelino tiene 45 años de edad, es casado, tiene dos hijos, vive con su familia en el municipio de la Masica, Atlántida.
Hace 6 años que don Abelino se dedica a la venta de mercadería. El se moviliza de una comunidad a otra en su vehículo ofreciendo variedad de confites, chicles, galletas, sombrillas y repuestos para bicicletas, ya que en las comunidades utilizan mucho la bicicleta como medio de transporte. Con el préstamo que solicita que es por 6,000 Lempiras va surtir de productos para salir a vender y aumentar las ventas y sus ingresos. Su objetivo es mantener en crecimiento el negocio para darle bienestar a su familia.
texts.en: Abelino, 45, is married and has two children; he lives with his family in the town of Masica, Atlántida.  He’s been selling merchandise for six years.  He goes from one community to another in his car selling a variety of snacks, gum, cookies, umbrellas and bicycle spare parts because in the communities bicycles are a common mode of transportation.  He is asking for a 6,000 Lempira loan to stock up on merchandise to resell and increase sales and income.  His goal is to keep the business growing to provide wellbeing for his family.

loans.use: to buy assorted merchandise to sell.

loans.name: Kharitina

texts.ru: Харитина торгует на центральном рынке в цветочном повильоне живыми цветами и домашними растениями. Точка у клиента очень хорошо расположена, большая проходимость людей. Харитина работает и в ночное время суток.  Кредит понадобился для закупки большой партии роз по оптовой цене от поставщиков из Харькова.  Клиент порядочная, добрая.
texts.en: Kharitina sells live flowers and house plants at the flower pavilion of the central market.  Her retail outlet is located well, in a high traffic area.  Kharitina also works at night.  She needs this loan to purchase a large inventory of roses at a wholesale price from distributors from Kharkov.  Kharitina is decent and kind.

loans.use: to purchase a large inventory of roses

loans.name: Mirian Jahaira

texts.es:
MIRIAN JAHAIRA tiene 19 años de edad es soltera no tiene hijos, vive con los padres en la ciudad de ventanas provincia de los Ríos.

Es integrante de la  Ventanilla Bendición de Dios se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto Rancho Grande de la parroquia Puerto Pechiche, se dedican a labores Agrícolas y Pecuarias.

MIRIAN JAHAIRA se dedica la siembra de maíz, arroz, además se dedica a la crianza de pollos, cerdos. Solicita el crédito para comprar urea, fertilizantes, insecticidas, líquido para la maleza. Con la yuda del crédito podrá comprar lo necesario par poder sembrar y obtener buenos productos.

 Las compras las realizará en la ciudad de ventanas cada 8 días. El sueño es poder comprar una finca .

Los desafíos a los que se enfrenta son las plagas en los cultivos el cogollero, ratón. En el tiempo libre le gusta trabajar e investigar sobre las siembras.
texts.en:
Marian Jahaira, 19, is single and has no children; she lives with her parents in the city of Ventanas, Los Ríos Province.  He’s a member of the “Bendición de Dios” (God’s Blessing) communal bank located in Recinto Rancho Grande in Puerto Pechinche Parish; they work in agriculture and animal husbandry.

Marian Jahaira grows corn and rice and also raises chickens and pigs.  She is requesting the loan to buy urea, fertilizer, insecticide and weed killer.  With help from the loan she will be able to buy what’s necessary to be able to plant and get good crop yields.  

She does her purchases and her sales in Ventanas every 8 days.  Her dream is to be able to buy a farm.  The challenge she faces is crop diseases like “cogollero” and “ratón.”  In her free time she likes to work on and do research about crops.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies.

loans.name: Tatyana

texts.ru: Татьяна торгует на центральном крытом рынке специями, чаями, майонезами, приправами, салфетками,  консервами. Татьяну всегда можно найти на торговой точке в любое время. Она добропорядочная, вежливая, трудолюбивая и спокойная. В этот раз кредит понадобился Татьяне для зукупки  приправ и разных видов специй, а также разных соусов. Точка расположена на видном месте в ряду где никто не торгует таким видом товара.
texts.en: Tatyana sells spices, tea, mayonnaise, seasonings, napkins and canned food at the central covered market.  She can always be found at her retail outlet, at any time.  She is decent, polite, hardworking and calm.  This time, Tatyana needed the loan to purchase spices and various types of seasonings and also different sauces.  Her retail outlet is located in a visible place, in a row, where no one sells this type of merchandise.

loans.use: to purchase spices and various types of seasonings and also different sauces.

loans.name: Alexander

texts.ru: Александр торгует в торговом комплексе «1000 Мелочей», продает сантехнику, замки, раковины, шланги, сифоны. У Александра большой ассортимент и выбор товара. Этот кредит он взял для закупки унитазов, раковин, шлангов для ванн, смесителей. Александр очень вежливый и рассудительный. Он вовремя выплачивает свои кредиты.
texts.en: Alexander sells plumbing supplies, locks, sinks, hoses and pumps at the "1000 Melochey" shopping center.  He has a wide selection and choice of merchandise.  He obtained this loan to purchase toilets, sinks, hoses for bathtubs and faucet mixers.  Alexander is very polite and reasonable.  He repays his loans on time.

loans.use: to purchase toilets, sinks, hoses for bathtubs and faucet mixers

loans.name: Leofao

texts.en: Leofao is a 24 years old married woman with 2 children. She has a small plantation and grows taro plants and banana trees to earn a living. She has been doing this for 2 years. Leofao has requested a loan to buy chemicals, weed killers, spades and sprayers for her own business. She has been a member of SPBD since 2011. With her profits, Leofao hopes to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy chemicals, weed killers, spades and sprayers

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en: Imelda is 29 years old. To generate an income, she has established a hog-raising business. Imelda works on her business every day to see to it that her hogs are nourished. To secure their health, she is asking for a loan of 10,000 Philippine pesos to buy vaccines, vitamins and feeds. In the future, Imelda wants to expand her business and build a larger shelter for her hogs.

loans.use: to buy vaccines, vitamins and feeds.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is a mother of three children and has been in farming for over thirty years. Her current products include tea and milk which are both sold locally.  Her the income goes toward meeting her family's basic needs. She runs her farm with the help of one farmhand.

Grace has requested a loan of 50,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to buy a chaff cutter. She says this will ease the feeding of her growing number of dairy cows and allow her to engage in other farming activities. She hopes to be able to build a modern dairy unit in the near future.

She says a shortage of feed, which makes the feed extremely costly during dry season, remains a major challenge.

loans.use: To buy a chaff cutter

loans.name: Bat-Erdene

texts.en:
Mr. Bat-Erdene, 28, has been a crane driver for a transportation company since 2009. Every day he loads and transports a lot of freight to the trucks or vans. He lives with his wife and his two sons in a poorly equipped house in Ger district, an area of Erdenet, the third largest city in Mongolia, with no running water, minimal roads and spotty electricity. Currently his wife is unemployed and looks after the babies at home. Bat-Erdene will use his loan to replace the dated wooden floor and windows in his home, improving its insulation (due to the heat loss through the existing windows). In winter he uses a water-heated furnace to keep his home warm. It is expensive and very wasteful of water. Bat-Erdene says if he can make his planned repairs, his heating costs will be cut notably and it will allow him to make a contribution to the environment.  

Although Mongolia has the lowest population density in the world, it is one of the most polluted countries in the world.  This is due to the long and cold winters where temperatures frequently go below -40C (-40F) even in the cities.  In winter, many parts of the country are extremely cold and are known to have snow storms.  Both homes and nomadic tents burn a lot of fuel and emit huge amounts of pollution every night from families just trying to stay warm.  Furthermore, the extremely toxic smoke from the cars is a main source of Mongolia's air pollution. In response to this, Credit Mongol offers Green Loans to their clients to make home improvements that reduce heat loss, improve heating systems, and buy cars which run on natural gas.  We believe that together we can decrease pollution and the harmful effects it has on the environment and Mongolians' health. The loan Bat-Erdene is taking will be used to buy building materials for his home repair.

loans.use: to buy some building materials for his home repair.

loans.name: Jennifer Soledad

texts.es:
Jennifer es una chica estudiante y muy trabajadora que le gusta salir adelante por sus propios medios y quiere que su vida sea de muchos éxitos laborales. Jennifer vive con sus padres en Ibarra.

Jennifer tiene un local de servicio de cabinas telefónicas, servicios computacionales e internet y venta de celulares este negocio ayuda a Jennifer a cubrir los gastos de sus estudios y ayudar con los gastos de su hogar. Actualmente Jennifer necesita dar un mejor servicio a sus clientes es por eso que solicita un crédito a Fodemi, el mismo que va a ser invertido en la compra de webcams, audífonos, accesorios para celulares, celulares, suministros de oficina e impresoras para dar un buen servicio al cliente, lo que permitirá tener mas clientes y mejores ingresos.

El sueño de Jennifer es poder ser profesional y que su negocio crezca constantemente.
texts.en:
Jennifer is a very hard-working young student who wishes to get ahead through her own efforts and wants her working life to be much more successful. Jennifer lives with her parents in Ibarra.

Jennifer has a business offering telephone booths, computer and internet services, and sales of cell phones. This business helps Jennifer cover the costs of her studies and it also helps with household expenses. 

At present, Jennifer needs to offer her customers better services. For that reason, she is requesting a loan through FODEMI, to invest in the purchase of webcams, audiophones, cellular accessories, cell phones, office supplies and printers, if she is to offer better customer service. This will help her gain more customers and improved income.

Jennifer's dream is to become a professional and to have her business constantly growing.

loans.use: buy webcams, audiophones, accessories for cellular phones, cell phones, office supplies and printers, to provide better customer suervice.

loans.name: 74-Las Positivas Group

texts.es: El Banco de Emprendimiento las 74 – POSITIVAS está compuesta por diez integrantes de los cuales nueve son mujeres y un varón que se dedican a distintas actividades, la presidenta del banco es la Sra. Felipa ella tiene 57 años tiene siete hijos ya todos independientes,  se dedica  al venta de comida muy tradicional de Bolivia,  la solicitante vive en casa familiar,  Esta solicitando el crédito para la compra artefactos de cocina y utensilios, la Sra. Felipa se siente feliz y agradecido con la institución por el apoyo brindado, ya que con el anterior credito les fue bien pero siguen necesitando mas capital para sus actividades.
texts.en: The “Las 74 Positivas” (The 74 Positive Ones) communal bank has ten members, nine women and one man, who carry out a variety of activities.  The bank president is Felipa, 57.  She has seven children who are all independent now.  She sells traditional Bolivian food.  She lives in the family home and is asking for the loan to buy kitchen appliances and utensils.  Felipa feels happy and grateful to the institution for the support provided because they did well with the previous loan but she continues needing more capital for her activities.

loans.use: to buy kitchen appliances and utensils.

loans.name: Ernesto

texts.en:
Ernesto is a hog raiser and at the same time a proud farmer within the village where he lives. He is married and has three children. According to him, two of his children work already while the other one is in his third year of high school.

Ernesto has run his hog raising business for four years. His wife has been his helper in raising the hogs. His main goal for now is to obtain a higher income so that he can educate his youngest child and have a better standard of living. One of the strategies he has to raise his hogs is providing them with necessary vitamins and hog feed. But due to the high cost of livestock supplies, he has requested a loan of PHP 25,000. This amount would really be a big help to make his business grow and become more profitable.

loans.use: to buy stock of hog feed and necessary vitamins for his hogs

loans.name: Surayya

texts.en:
Surayya a 56-years-old energetic woman, who has been handling a general store near her home for the past ten years. She sells items like biscuits, tea, cleaning products, and different kind of sweets for children. She has a large, regular clientele that prefers her because she always has what they demand at reasonable prices. She has three daughters and two sons. Two of her daughters are in school and one of her sons works as a salesperson in a garment shop. Surayya's husband operates a fruit cart that has bananas and apples. His income is not sufficient to fulfill the needs of his wife and five children alone. Surayya contributes a lot to the family's income. 

She has taken several loans from Kashf Foundation and her repayment history is satisfactory. Now, she has requested a loan of PKR 25,000 to buy additional items like beverages, packs of biscuits, and detergents. In this way she will be able to cater to more customers and fulfill their needs time after time. Surayya wants to send her other children to school. She intends to use her profits for her family's betterment and well-being.

loans.use: to buy additional items like beverages, packs of biscuits, and detergents.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a food cart.

loans.name: Tweyambe Mutukula Women Group

texts.en:
Joyce is a member of the above group, where each member guarantees the others in accessing a loan.  She was glad to share with us her profile.

She is a 31-year-old engaged woman with two children living in Bundibugyo, Uganda.  For ten years she has been selling clothes.  She started the business after dropping out of school because of an unwanted pregnancy and her parents' refusal to send her back after giving birth. Her main hardship is inadequate capital to meet the various demands of her customers.  

Her personal goals are educating her children and building a permanent house for the family, as they are currently under a mud-wattled dwelling. 

The purpose of the loan is to buy new clothes to sell ahead of the Christmas season.   She intends to expand her business into new market areas and also diversify her business to include farming.

loans.use: to buy new clothes for her business.

loans.name: Justine

texts.fr: Agée a 39 ans, Justine est mariée et mère de trois enfants dont deux sont à charge. L'aîné et le benjamin ont respectivement de 22 ans à 5 ans. Spécialisée dans la vente des sacs de maïs depuis quelques années, elle s'approvisionne dans l'un des marchés du Bénin et de l'extérieur. Soucieuse d'accroître son capital et de satisfaire la demande de ses clients, elle a sollicité et a obtenu un micro crédit à Finadev en vue de maximiser son intérêt et de participer à la scolarisation de ses enfants.
texts.en: At 39 years of age, Justine is married with three children, two of whom are her dependents. The eldest and youngest are 22 and five years old, respectively. Justine has been specializing in the sale of sacks of corn for several years. She purchases her supplies at one of the markets in Benin, among others. Seeking to increase her capital and to meet the demand of her customers, Justine has sought and obtained a micro loan from Finadev. With this loan, she hopes to maximize her income as well as to further the education of her children.

loans.use: to purchase twelve sacks of corn for resale.

loans.name: Lilian

texts.en:
Lilian is a resident of Litein in South Rift, part of Kenya, where she lives with her family of three children, all of whom are of school-going ages. She has been in the business of farming for fourteen years and currently runs her own farm, which produces tea and milk, with one farmhand. She operates a retail shop as well.

Lilian has requested a loan of 60,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to buy a milk cooler. She says this will help in preserving her milk produce and help mitigate the challenge of transport, which usually results in huge losses when supplies do not make it in time to the market. Lilian also plans to increase the number of her dairy cows to three.

Lilian is grateful to Juhudi Kilimo for the loan services and emphasizes that she will use a major part of her income to educate her children.

loans.use: To buy a milk cooler.

loans.name: Domingo

texts.en:
Domingo's main priority in life is to increase his profits so that he can send his two children on to higher levels of education and have a stable source of income.

Domingo is happily married to a vegetable vendor. The couple works together to achieve their goals in life. Domingo has operated his livestock business for four years. Now, he is raising six fattening pigs. Domingo has also managed his corn and rice field for four years. He is really grateful for the blessings he has received from our Almighty God; because of the gifts and skills given to him, he is able to cover all his household's expenses. At this time, he would like to ask for another loan of PHP 25,000, which will allow him to buy necessary vaccines, vitamins, and hog feed to ensure the proper growth of his pigs. Domingo hopes to get this loan so that he can make his dream possible.

loans.use: to buy necessary vaccines, vitamins, and hog feed for his pigs.

loans.name: William

texts.en:
William's business involvement is in the agricultural sector, particularly raising corn crops and hogs. He has been running his livestock business for two years and has had his corn field for five years. He is currently raising four fattening pigs.

William would like to empower his agricultural business, but he does not have enough capital for his livestock business. So, he requested a loan of PHP 25,000, which he will use to buy hog feed, vitamins, and vaccine to maintain the proper growth of his hogs. He hopes that his hogs will gain weight so that he can sell them at a better price. William knows that his success relies on his hard work and the wise management of his businesses.

loans.use: to buy hog feed, vitamins, and vaccine for his livestock business

loans.name: Marissa

texts.en:
Marissa works hard in order to earn a living. She stands as both father and mother to her two children because her husband is working abroad.

Marissa is thankful because she is able to manage her time wisely. She has operated her general store for more than 16 years. Marissa's desire is to expand her store and be able to educate her two children. To make her dreams come true, she is requesting a loan of PHP 10,000, which will allow her to buy volumes of groceries. She believes that the amount requested will make her business continue to grow. She hopes to obtain this amount in order to provide her family a better standard of living and be able to gain enough income for her family's needs.

loans.use: to buy groceries for her general store business

loans.name: Orepa

texts.en:
Orepa is 35 years old and single, with no children. She makes and sells elei printed material to earn a living, and she has been doing this for three  years. 

Orepa has requested a loan to buy more materials. She plans to use her profits to buy more furniture. She joined SPBD in 2010 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: To buy paint brushes, treads, and a new sewing machine.

loans.name: Sikukuu

texts.en:
Sikukuu, 33, is a divorced woman with three children. She lives in the town of Msambweni, Kenya. She has a business at home selling clothes for women, men and children, selling door-to-door. She’s been in business for one year. 
She’s currently asking for a 20,000 KES loan, her first loan from Yehu, to stock up on new merchandise like clothes for women, men and children to be able to increase sales and earn more profits. Her goal is that the business grows and be an asset for her children.

loans.use: buy bales of clothes for sale

loans.name: Fatmata

texts.en:
Greetings from Sierra Leone! This is 48-year-old Fatmata from Waterloo eastern area in Freetown. She is married and has three children between the ages of 9 years and 20 years. Two of her children attend school. Famata did not go to school, her parent taught her business, and her husband is a driver but his income is not enough to support the home, so she decided to start her business to generate income. 

Fatmata runs a food market within a busy market area. She sells palm oil, gari and pepper. She has been running this business for 28 years. She works at the business from 5:30 a.m. until 7:00 p.m., seven days per week. Her business is the only income she has. Fatmata says that the main challenge to her business is the poor road network to the village where she buys goods.

Fatmata has requested a loan in order to buy more food like palm oil, gari and pepper. The extra income from this loan will allow her to educate her children and improve her standard of living. In the future, she plans to build a shop structure on her own and increase her business. She thanks you for your support!

video.title: Kiva Borrower Fatmata from Sierra Leone

loans.use: to buy more food like palm oil, gari and pepper.

loans.name: Gladys Akoua

texts.fr: Agée de 34 ans, Gladys Akoua est mariée et mère d'un enfant scolarisé. Elle vend des divers depuis quelques années et s'approvisionne dans l'un des marchés du Bénin. En vue d'augmenter son fonds de roulement et de couvrir les attentes de ses clients, elle a sollicité et a bénéficié d'un concours financier auprès de Finadev. Ce concours lui permettra de maximiser son profit et de contribuer à la scolarisation de ses enfants.
texts.en: At 34 years old, Gladys Akoua is married and has one child who is enrolled in school. She has been selling various sundries for several years. She purchases her supplies at one of the markets in Benin. In order to increase her working capital and to meet the demands of her customer base, Gladys Akoua has sought and obtained financial assistance from Finadev. This assistance will allow her to maximize her income and to contribute to the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy ten cartons of assorted types of soap, five bottles of cooking oil, ten cartons of milk, one sack of rice, and two cans of kerosene for resale.

loans.name: Elida Isabel

texts.es: Elida  tiene  19 años de edad, soltera  viven en Sololá, graduada de profesión maestra de educación primaria, quien actualmente labora en una escuela de su comunidad en la jornada matutina actividad que viene realizando desde hace un año, una mujer joven trabajadora que desea superarse económicamente  con su familia, quien ahora tiene el deseo de emprender su propio negocio,  cuenta ya con el espacio para la apertura de una tienda de abarrotes ubicado en las principales calles de su comunidad, viendo así  una  demanda de personas que transitan por la ubicación de una escuela cercana, esto hará que tenga buenos ingresos ,  ella solicita un crédito de Q 6,000.00 quetzales para la compra de mercadería y poder aperturar esta tienda,  sus mayores sueños  es que para un futuro no muy lejano con los ingresos y las ganancias de este negocio seguir ampliando el mismo,  así también poder iniciar sus  estudios universitarios.
texts.en:
Elida, age 19, is single and lives in Sololá.  She graduated from her elementary education studies, and she currently works in her community school during the morning shift.  She has been doing this for one year.

She is a hard-working young woman who wants to improve herself and her family financially.  She now wishes to undertake her own business.  She now has the space to open a grocery store on the main streets of her community.  She sees a demand by people who pass by the location of a nearby school.  This would give her have good income.

She is requesting a loan for 6,000 quetzles to buy merchandise and to be able to open this store.

Her greatest dream for the near future is to use the income and the profits from this business to continue expanding it.  She also dreams of being able to start her university studies.

loans.use: to buy merchandise to open a grocery store.

loans.name: Tohir

texts.ru: Человек с огромным сердцем доброты и прекрасной душой, который живет среди высоких Таджикских гор, нуждается вашей поддержки, так как последние время у него проблемы с финансами. Его зовут  Тохир. Ему 24  лет, женат и на воспитании имеет 1 ребенка. Более 2 года он занимается скотоводством. У него 3 коровы. Он продает молоко своим соседям и соседи очень довольны от полученного натурального молочного продукта. Еще он продает скот, за которым он присматривался в течение нескольких месяцев. На рынке у него много клиентов. Он хочет развивать свой бизнес, но не имеет достаточного средства для этого. Он запрашивает займ на сумму  5000 сомони для покупки 2 коровы, чтобы развевать бизнес. Он ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en:
A man with a huge heart of kindness and a beautiful soul, who lives among the high Tajik mountains, needs your help due to recent financial problems. His name is Tohir, he is married and raising a child. For over 2 years, he has been engaged in animal husbandry. Tohir keeps 3 cows and sells their milk to his neighbours, who are very glad to have access to a natural dairy product. Additionally, Tohir sells cattle after taking care of it for several months and has many customers at the market.

Tohir would like to develop his business but does not have sufficient funds. He is requesting a loan of 5000 somoni to purchase 2 cows and expand his operation. He is counting on your kindness.

loans.use: to buy 2 cows

loans.name: Razack

texts.fr: Agé de 33 ans, Razack est marié et père d'un enfant scolarisé dans une école de la place. Spécialisé dans la vente du maïs, du riz, de la farine de blé et des cartons de sucre depuis quelques années, il s'approvisionne dans l'un des marchés de la sous région. Dans le but de renforcer son pouvoir d'achat et de satisfaire la forte demande de ses clients qui augmente sans cesse, il a sollicité et a obtenu un micro crédit auprès de Finadev. Ce crédit lui permettra de payer la scolarité de ses enfants et de supporter les charges de la famille.
texts.en: Razack, 33 years old, is married and has one child attending the local school. For some years, Razack has been specializing in selling corn, rice, wheat flour and boxes of sugar. He stocks up at one of the markets in his region. In order to bolster his purchasing power and be able to meet high demand, which keeps growing, he has requested and obtained a microloan from Finadev. This loan will allow him to pay the school fees for his [child] and to cover family expenses.

loans.use: to buy three bags of corn, two bags of wheat flour, one bag of rice and five boxes of sugar.

loans.name: Nohemi

texts.es: Nohemí señora  de 31 años de edad, madre soltera, con una hija de 8 años estudiante del nivel primario, vive en Suchitepequez, mujer trabajadora la cual se dedica a la venta de abarrotes en su casa  y venta de alimentos preparados que entrega a en el lugar de su residencia para poder salir a delante con su hija, tiene 15 años de hacer este negocio que iniciaron con sus padres, ella quiere mejorar su tienda por que cuenta con muy pocos productos, de esta manera solicita un préstamo  de Q 7,000.00 quetzales para comprar mas productos y mejorar su tienda de abarrotes esto ayudara que ella tenga mas demanda con sus clientes y mejore sus ingresos como madre soltera, sueña que en un futuro seguir dándole los estudios académicos a su hija ya que trabaja sola pero no es ningún obstáculo para superarse.
texts.en:
Nohemí, age 31, is a single mother.   She has an eight year old daughter who goes to elementary school.  She lives in Suchitepequez.  

She is a hard-working woman who sells groceries at her house.  She also sells prepared food at her house.  She does this in order to be able to get ahead with her daughter.  She has been doing this business activity, which she started with her parents, for 15 years.  

She wants to improve her store because she has very few products.  Therefore she is requesting a loan for 7,000 quetzales to buy more products and improve her grocery store.  This will help her to have more customer demand, and it will improve her income.  

As a single mother, she dreams of continuing to give her daughter an academic education in the future.  She works alone, but this is not an obstacle to success.

loans.use: to buy products to expand her grocery store.

loans.name: Silvia Ynes

texts.es:
La señora Silvia es socia del banco comunal “Mujeres Galácticas”. Distrito Coronal Portillo, Departamento De Ucayali, tiene 43 años de edad, soltera, cinco hijos, solo dos de sus hijos  están a su cargo.
Se dedica a la venta de productos de primera necesidad, cuenta con un puesto muy bien surtido con productos de primera para poder atender a su clientela que acude al mercado todo los días.
Con su nuevo préstamo de S/.  3,000.00 nuevos soles comprara: 3 sacos de arroz, 2 sacos de azúcar, 2 cajas de aceite,  y también comprara andamios para el segundo puesto que está implementando y que próximamente estará inaugurando.  
Su negocio está yendo muy bien porque trabaja para poder mantener a sus hijos que todavía están estudiando porque es la única que vela por ellos, gracias a Manuela por darle la oportunidad de crecer como persona que quiere surgir en la vida por el bien de toda su familia.
texts.en:
Silvia is a member of the “Mujeres Galácticas” Communal Bank located in the Coronal Portillo district in the Ucayali department.  She is 43 years old.  She is single, and has five children. Only two of the children are in her care, however.

She sells staple items and her stand is well-stocked with basic essentials so that she is able to serve the customers that come to the market every day.  
With her new loan of S/. 3,000.00 nuevos soles, she will purchase three bags of rice, two bags of sugar, two boxes of oil, and also scaffolding for the second stand that she is setting up and will be opening soon.

Her business is going well and she works to support her children.  They are still in school and she is their sole guardian.  She thanks Manuela for giving her the opportunity to grow as a person that wants to move up in life for the good of her entire family.

loans.use: to purchase rice, sugar, oil, and scaffolding.

loans.name: Katura

texts.en: Katura is a 35-year-old married man living in Kyenjojo-Uganda. He deals in agricultural produce sales and has been in business for five years. He started by growing crops on inherited land where he saved and invested in produce. He has a challenge of inadequate capital to meet the high demand. His personal goal is building a permanent house for his residence while his business goal is expanding business into new market areas. Katura wants a loan to buy produce such as maize and beans to sell.

loans.use: to buy produce such as maize and beans to sell.

loans.name: Altantsetseg

texts.en: Altantsetseg, 51, works as a cook in the cafeteria in Ulaanbaatar, the capital of Mongolia. She has had the job for two years and usually she has a high workload. She lives with her family in her house in the ger district. Mongolian traditional yurts and poor housing are in this boundary district of the city. Lately, her house has worsened with age. Since she bought it, there have not been any major repairs or renovation. Her house loses heat through its thin walls and windows. In the winter, her children usually get sick due to the chilly house. She uses the coal-fired furnace to heat her home inside and it creates too much smoke inside and outside of the house. Therefore, she is eager to make repairs and improve wall insulation with bricks and other building materials. The loan she is asking for will be used to buy the building materials and pay for hired workers to repair her house.

loans.use: to buy building materials and hire workers for her house repair.

loans.name: Verena

texts.en:
Verena is 28 years old. She is married to a farmer. She has been a maize farmer for ten years. She plans to use the Kiva loan to support labor costs and buy fertilizer during maize production. She needs to buy fertilizer in order to increase her production. With profits from her farming, she wishes to invest in her business so that in the future she can acquire machines like tractors that will enhance her farming capacity.

The photo was taken recently at a previous maize farming plantation. Verena was very happy and excited that the previous season was very helpful for both her family needs and business. 

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to buy more fertilizer and pay for support labor costs for maize production.

loans.name: Jhon Jonathan

texts.es:
Jhon es un hombre de 23 años, es soltero, vive en la ciudad de Chincha con sus padres y hermanos, él es una persona muy amable, trabajador y entusiasta, que tiene un gran deseo de superación; gracias a su esfuerzo y al apoyo de sus padres, Jhon se encuentra estudiando la carrera profesional de Administración de Empresas, en sus ratos libres le gusta jugar futbol con sus amigos y vecinos, y en algunas ocasiones cocina un riquísimo Arroz con Pollo para compartir con su familia.
Con mucho empeño y entusiasmo, desde hace cinco años Jhon trabaja como obrero de construcción, todos los días desde tempranas horas inicia su labor, él puede trabajar un aproximado de 10 horas y cree que le va bien por su experiencia, dedicación y por el trato amable que brinda a sus clientes.
Jhon se encuentra muy agradecido con los prestatarios Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá cubrir sus gastos de pago de matrícula y mensualidad de sus estudios; de esta manera Jhon podrá seguir cursando sus estudios profesionales, así él seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para convertirse en un buen profesional y tener su negocio propio.
texts.en: Jhon is a 23-year-old single man who lives in the city of Chincha with his parents and brothers.  He is a very kind, hard-working and enthusiastic person who has a great desire to improve.  Thanks to his effort and the support of his parents, Jhon is studying business administration.  In his free time he likes to play soccer with his friends and neighbors, and sometimes to cook a delicious dish of chicken with rice to share with his family.  With great determination and enthusiasm, Jhon has worked for five years as a construction laborer.  Every day he starts work very early and he can work for up to 10 hours.  He believes that he does well at this because of his experience, his dedication and the kindness with which he treats his customers.  Jhon is very grateful to Kiva lenders, because due to their help he will be able to cover the costs of paying the registration fee and the monthly payments for his studies.  In this way Jhon will be able to continue with his professional studies, and will continue working and striving to become a good professional and to have his own business.

loans.use: to pay the registration fee and monthly payments for his studies.

loans.name: Shehnaz

texts.en:
