To make her business a viable source of income, Marijane is now applying for a 20,000 PHP loan from ASKI to buy more shirts, pants, shorts and blouses to sell. With hard work and the help of her loan, she hopes to achieve economic stability someday.

loans.use: to buy more shirts, pants, shorts and blouses to sell.

loans.name: Kimberly

texts.es: Kimberly es una joven con 21 años de edad, soltera y madre de un niño. Es una mujer trabajadora,con deseos de superación y de salir adelante junto con su bebé. Cuenta con el apoyo de su madre para el cuido de su hijo en horas laborales. Ella se dedica al comercio sin descuidar a su familia. Solicita financiamiento por primera vez a la Fundación para reforzar su negocio, debido a que cuenta con el apoyo en la parte física de la tienda de su compañero. Ella desea obtener mayores ingresos en su negocio para poder terminar su carrera universitaria, la cual es su meta; asi mejorar la calidad de vida. El préstamo se invertirá en comprar ropa de niño y bisutería.
texts.en: Kimberly, 21, is a young, single woman and mother of a little boy.  She’s a hardworking woman who very much wants to improve and move forward with her baby.  Her mother helps her out caring for her baby during working hours.  She works in commerce without neglecting her family.  She’s asking the Fundación for her first loan to strengthen her business because her life companion helps her with the physical aspect of the store.  She wants to earn higher income in her store so that she can complete her university career which is her goal thus improving her quality of life.  She will use the loan to buy children’s clothes and costume jewelry.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for the store.

loans.name: Anatalia

texts.es:
Anatalia, tiene 56 años, vive con su esposo, realizan juntos la siembra de granos básicos para poder apoyar a sus hijos en la alimentación, venden parte de la cosecha que le permite tener el ingreso de efectivo, vive en su propia casa y desde hace 10 años trabajan juntos ya tiene una experiencia grande dentro del desarrollo de las labores agrícolas.

Ella solicita un préstamo para comprarse seis sacos de abono, un depósito de herbicidas y también pagará la mano de obra, que son algunos mozos que le colaboran en su trabajo, espera a través de este financiamiento poder realizar una buena inversión, sacar una buena cosecha que le ayude a generar mejores utilidades.

Su aspiración es trabajar para mejorar económicamente su condición familiar, también poder generar el sustento a través de la cosecha de maíz para su familia.
texts.en:
Anatalia, 56, lives with her husband.  They work together growing basic grains to help feed their children.  They sell part of the harvest thus earning cash.  She lives in her own house and they’ve worked together for the last ten years so she has quite a bit of experience doing agricultural tasks.

She’s requesting a loan to buy six sacks of manure, a container of herbicide and also to pay labor costs for some day laborers who will help do the work.  She hopes through this financing to be able to make a good investment and product a good harvest that will lead to higher profits.  Her goal is to work to improve her family’s economic conditions as well as to provide sustenance for her family by means of the corn harvest.

loans.use: to buy six sacks of manure, herbicide and to pay labor costs.

loans.name: Norah Z.

texts.en:
Norah, 46, is married and lives in Kakata with her three children aged between six and nineteen. Only one of the children is attending school.

For the past fifteen years Norah has sold plastic dishware such as dishes, plates, glasses and spoons. In the beginning she started out with a little money from her husband. She made money selling and used these profits to buy more goods to sell.

Norah is applying for a 22,000 LRD loan from BRAC Liberia to buy more plastic dishware to increase her sales. Her plan for the future is to become a big businesswoman.

loans.use: to buy more plastic dishware to sell.

loans.name: William

texts.en:
William is a 46-year-old married man with six children, living in Kyenjojo, Uganda. 

He is into cattle trade as his business, and he has spent four years at it.  He started from crop farming, where he saved and accumulated capital for the cattle business. William has a challenge of inadequate capital to buy cattle to meet the increasing demand.

William intends to use the loan to purchase cattle to sell.  He has personal goals of educating children, building a permanent home, and buying a car to ease transport, while his business goal is diversifying business to include buying produce and buying land to grow crops.

loans.use: to purchase cattle to sell.

loans.name: Fadi

texts.en:
Fadi, who appears in the picture, is a 21-year-old single young man. He is a worker in addition to his work in agriculture with the family, but in both jobs he gets a low income which is not enough to cover all the needs.

Fadi is requesting a 1,000 USD loan from FATEN to help him cover the cost of purchasing new living room furniture in order to improve living conditions in his house. Taking this loan will offer to Fadi and his family comfortable furniture so they can enjoy living in their house.

loans.use: to purchase new living room furniture.

loans.name: Dionisia

texts.es:
La Sra. Dionisia tiene 59 años es viuda, tiene 5 hijos, 4 mujeres y un varón ya todos mayores que son independientes y la ayudan en lo que pueden.
Dionisia se dedica a la venta de muebles en general hace más de 20 años, cuenta con clientela formada gracias a la buena calidad de sus productos y la excelente ubicación con que cuenta, gracias a su trabajo pudo criar a sus hijos y darle lo que necesitan para poder ser personas de bien.
Pretende utilizar el crédito para la compra muebles en general como son roperos, juego de comedores, sillones y otros para poder seguir trabajando y ganándose el sustento.
texts.en: Dionisia, 59, is a widow; she has five children, four girls and one boy who are all independent adults now and help her out with whatever they can.  Dionisia has been selling furniture in general for more than 20 years.  She has a well-established clientele thanks to the good quality of her products and the excellent location she has.  Thanks to her work she was able to raise her children and give them what was needed for them to become upstanding citizens.  She intends to use the loan to buy furniture in general like armoires, dining room sets, easy chairs and others to continue working and earning her livelihood.

loans.use: to buy furniture like armoires, dining room sets, easy chairs and others to sell.

loans.name: Teodora

texts.es: Teodora tiene 66 años, y un se dedica a una actividad comercial, en la que promociona mercancía mediante guías especializadas de productos, desde hace cinco años vendiendo   labiales y accesorios femeninos principalmente; en su familia, su hija también desempeña la misma actividad pero en líneas diferentes a las de Teodora. Aunque ella cuenta con el apoyo económico de todos sus hijos, sostiene que trabajar la mantiene activa y saludable y eso la hace soñar y tener muchas metas empresariales. Con el capital producido por su negocio, ha logrado remodelar la pequeña vivienda y sueña con terminarla totalmente. En la actualidad está aplicando a un primer financiamiento con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, el cual  invertirá   en la compra de mercancía, que ha llegado en su catalogo con descuentos especiales y ella quiere impactar en esta buena época comercial a su clientela en la línea de cosméticos y perfumería.  Mientras construye sus sueños de prosperidad, en su negocio maneja unos  Indicadores Financieras con un Margen de utilidad promedio de  34%  y una Rotación de Inventario de 7 días, razones desde las cuales, proyectamos su exitosa inversión.
texts.en: Teodora is 66 years old. She works at her business, which is selling merchndies via special product catalogs. For five years, she has been selling mainly lipsticks and women's accesories. In her family, her daughter also works in the same activity, but with different lines than Teodora's. Although she has the financial support of all of her children, she maintains that working keeps her active and healthy and this makes her dream and have a lot of business goals. With the capital produced from her business, she has been able to remodel her little house, and her dream is to compeltely finish it. Now she is applying for her first loan from the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. She will invest in buying merchandise which has arrived in her catalog with special discounts. She wants to have an impact in this high commercial season on her customers with the cosmetics and perfume lines. While she build her prosperity dreams, in her business she manages financial indicators with an average profit margen of  34%  and an inventory rotation of 7 days. Because of this, we predict a succesful investment.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics and perfume

loans.name: Ruby

texts.en:
Ruby is 54 years old, married, and has three children, all of whom are already employed. She earns a living by running a store where she offers feeds, rice, and AVON products. 

She has been in this line of work for almost ten years and has been her companion in sending her children in school. She also thanks her husband for helping her manage her store. 

She is applying for a loan for PHP 20,000 to buy a variety of rice, a variety of feeds, and AVON products that were requested by her customers. She hopes that her loan will allow her to increase her sales and provide her family with a better life.

loans.use: to buy a variety of rice, a variety of feeds, and AVON products that were requested by her customers.

loans.name: Mujeres Activistas Group

texts.es:
El Comité Mujeres Activistas es  de la ciudad de Mariano Roque Alonso, el grupo lleva este nombre, ya que las todas las mujeres que lo forman son muy activas y trabajadoras. Ellas se han unido con el fin de ayudarse y ayudar a sus familias.
Una de estas mujeres es Angelica, quien forma parte de este grupo, y quien nos comenta que se dedica a la costura. Su crédito lo quiere invertir en la compra de telas por cantidad para poder cumplir con pedidos que tiene. Agradece por esta oportunidad, ya que le permitirá poder seguir ayudando a su familia y superar de esa forma la pobreza.
texts.en:
The "Mujeres Activistas" Communal Bank is in the city of Mariano Roque Alonso. The group carries this name because all of the members are very active and hardworking women. They have united with the goal of helping themselves and their families.

One of the members is Angelica. She notes that she is a seamstress. She wants to use her loan to buy fabrics in quantity so that she can fill the orders she has. She is grateful for this opportunity because it will enable her to continue helping her family and to overcome poverty.

loans.use: to purchase fabrics.

loans.name: Mirna Lissette

texts.es:
Mirna, tiene 19 años, vive con su esposo y una niña de tres años de edad, trabaja en la crianza de cerdos y de pollos, ya que con esta ocupación ayuda a su esposo con algunos ingresos para el hogar, lleva ya dos años en esta actividad iniciando la al lado de su esposo como una ocupación para ambos.

Actualmente necesita comprarse concentrado y pulimento para cerdos y pollos, esto le ayudara para que el préstamo pueda invertirlo en estas necesidades para su granja el crédito será un gran aporte para fortalecer la alimentación de los animales de la granja y para que ella pueda tener a la mano lo necesario.

Su Objetivo es de mejorar su situación económica, ir creciendo con la granja en ya que éstos le dará una mejor condición frente a las obligaciones de su hogar y una mejor vida para su hija.
texts.en:
Mirna, 19, lives with her husband and three-year-old daughter.  She works raising pigs and chickens and helps her husband cover household expenses this way.  She’s been in business two years having started alongside her husband as a business for both of them.

She needs to buy feed for the pigs and the chickens.  This will help her invest the loan in these needs in her farm; the loan will be a large help in strengthening her farm animals’ nutrition and so that she will have everything she needs on hand.  Her goal is to improve her economic situation, to gradually grow with the farm so that it will yield them better conditions in the face of household obligations and provide a better life for her daughter.

loans.use: to buy feed for chickens and pigs.

loans.name: Jose Lorenzo

texts.es:
José, vive con su esposa, se dedican al destazo y venta de carne de cerdo, este negocio comenzó hace dos años distribuyendo la carne tres veces por semana al mercado, su esposa realiza también ventas del mismo destazo pero de forma ambulante no en los puestos de venta sino en casas familiares.

El solicita un préstamo para realizar la compra de cerdos pequeños y que éstos le darán la posibilidad de incorporarLos y poder destazar y vender la carne, con este crédito tendrán los recursos económicos que actualmente no posee y tendrá también la compra de los cerdos.

Dentro de sus aspiraciones a futuro está con este préstamo poder realizar una buena compra de la especie y al mismo tiempo continuar en la venta y distribución de la carne, a futuro comprarse un vehículo en el cual pueda transportar más fácilmente la venta.
texts.en:
José lives with his wife.  They make their living butchering pigs and selling the meat.  They started their business two years ago by bringing the meat to market three times a week.  José's wife also sells the butchered meat, but she does so door-to-door, not from a sales stall. 

José is requesting the loan to purchase small pigs, which will allow him to raise them to later butcher and sell the meat.  With this loan, José and his wife will have the financial resource that they are currently lacking and they will be able to purchase the pigs. 

Amongst his future plans for the loan, José will get a good price for the pigs and at the same time continue selling and distributing the meat.  He also wants to purchase a vehicle, which would make it easier for him to transport sold meat.

loans.use: to purchase pigs to butcher.

loans.name: Alex Jose

texts.es:
Alex es un joven de 20 años, es soltero, vive con sus padres y hermanos en la ciudad de Ica, en el distrito de Santiago, él es una persona muy amable, trabajador y entusiasta, que tiene un gran deseo de superación; gracias a su esfuerzo y al apoyo de sus padres, Alex se encuentra estudiando la carrera profesional de Ingeniería Mecánica, en sus ratos libres le gusta navegar por internet y en algunas ocasiones cocina un riquísimo Arroz con Pato para compartir con su familia.
Con mucho empeño, dedicación y gracias al apoyo de su familia, Alex puso en marcha su pequeño negocio de entretenimiento, el cuenta con un pequeño billar en cual pone a disposición de sus clientes, adicionalmente vende bebidas, todos los días desde tempranas horas inicia su labor, él puede trabajar un aproximado de 12 horas diarias y cree que le va bien por su dedicación y por el trato amable que brinda a sus clientes.
Alex se encuentra muy agradecido con los prestatarios Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar la compra de mercadería para su negocio, tales como golosinas, piqueos, bebidas (gaseosas, agua mineral, vinos, etc.); de esta manera Alex tendrá su negocio mejor abasteció, así él seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para convertirse en un buen profesional y junto con su familia desea salir adelante.
texts.en:
Alex is a young man of 20.  He is single, lives with his parents and siblings in the city of Ica in the district of Santiago.  His is a very agreeable, hardworking and enthusiastic person who has a great desire to get ahead.  Thanks to his work and the help of his parents, Alex is studying to be a mechanical engineer.  In his free time, he likes to surf the internet and sometimes cook a delicious duck and rice to share with his family.

With much determination, dedication and thanks to the help of his family, Alex started a small entertainment business.  He has a small pool table for his customers and he sells drinks.  Every day he starts work early.  He can work up to 12 hours a day and believes that it is going well because of his dedication and because he treats his customers well.

Alex is very grateful to the Kiva lenders, since thanks to their help he will be able to buy merchandise for his business such as candies, snacks, and drinks (sodas, mineral water, wines, etc.).  In this way Alex will have a better stocked business.  He will continue to work and make every effort to become a good professional and together with his family he wants to get ahead.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for his business such as candies, snacks, and drinks.

loans.name: Silvio Jose

texts.es:
Silvio, vive con su esposa, tiene cuatro hijos menores de edad quienes están en la escuela, él se dedica a la siembra de granos básicos y a la ganadería, tiene toda una vida dedicándose a estas actividades ya que lo aprendió al lado de su padre desde que era muy joven.

Solicita un crédito, pues está iniciando la siembra de maíz para lo que necesita también tener a la mano el abono, la semilla y la preparación de la tierra, este crédito ayudará a realizar una buena compra para poder tener un proceso agrícola adecuado que le asegure una buena cosecha.

Su objetivo con el préstamo es poder cultivar dos manzanas de tierra y con los materiales aplicados poder aumentar la producción de maíz, en su familia quiere trabajar por verlos con todo lo necesario y con una vida más confortable.
texts.en:
Silvio lives with his wife; he has four minor children attending school.  He works growing basic grains and raising cattle.  He’s spent his entire life in these activities since he learned them while very young from his father.

He requests a loan because he’s starting a new corn planting cycle and needs to have manure and seed on hand and to prepare the soil.  This loan will help him make a good purchase in order to have a proper agricultural process that will insure a good harvest.

His objective with the loan is to be able to cultivate two manzanas [Central American unit of land measurement] of land and with the applied products increase corn production.  He wants to work so that his family will have everything needed and a more comfortable life.

loans.use: to buy manure, seeds and to prepare the soil.

loans.name: George

texts.en:
George is 36 years old, married, and a father of three school-going children. He has been earning a monthly income of KES 11,500 from the milk supply business for the past four years. 

This will be his second loan from KADET LTD for KES. 40,000, which he intends to use to buy more milk for his supply. He will use the anticipated profit to purchase a dairy cow so as to increase the milk production.

His future hopes and dreams are to have a stable business and happy family.

loans.use: to buy more milk for his supply.

loans.name: Madelyn

texts.en:
Madelyn is 42 years old, married, and blessed with two children who are now taking a college and high school education. Madelyn is selling “ukay-ukay” (used clothing) in their public market as a source of income. Her husband is a farmer and her partner in making their living better. With her determination to achieve her dream, which is providing the best living for her children, Madelyn keeps on her journey in life by selling used clothes.

She just loves her children so much, so she doesn’t want them to suffer. Madelyn’s wish is for continued growth of her business to gain higher income and invest in an additional business as a source of income. 

She is requesting a loan of PHP 15,000 to buy clothes, curtains, shoes, and bags. She hopes to manage her business well and to be able to have a better living.

loans.use: to buy clothes, curtains, shoes, and bags.

loans.name: Banco Mujer Sahara Group

texts.es:
Doña María  es la tesorera de Banco Mujer Sahara, un grupo con mucha trayectoria en Fundación Mujer.  Ella tiene 66 años,  es casada  y tiene 4 hijos, todos mayores de edad y ya ninguno vive con ella. Para ella su edad no es ningún impedimento para seguir activa, trabajando y produciendo junto a su esposo, se dedican al comercio y tienen una pulpería y bazar. 
Ellas han recibido varios créditos, todos han sido pagados muy puntualmente, y se invirtieron en sus microempresas siendo de gran ayuda para hacerlas crecer.
Los planes de esta señora es ahorrar y asegurarse una vejez más tranquila, y también ayudar a sus nietos. 
Junto a Doña María están 7 socias más que van a invertir en actividades comerciales.
texts.en:
María is the treasurer of the Mujer Sahara bank, a group that has worked a lot with Fundación Mujer. She is 66 years old, married and has 4 children. All of them are grown and none of them live with her. For her, her age is no impedidment to staying active, working and producing with her husband. They are merchants and and they have a grocery and variety store. 

The women have received various loans. All of them have been paid off on time and were invested in their microbusinesses. They were a big help in making them grow. 

This woman's plans are to save and ensure a more peaceful old age, as well as help her grandchildren. With María are 7 more members who are going to invest in commercial activities.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for her store such as groceries and cleaning items.

loans.name: Miguel Angel

texts.es:
Miguel tiene 31 años de edad, vive al lado de su esposa quien es su mano derecha y juntos tiene un pequeño de 1 mes de nacido quien es el mejor regalo que Dio le ha podido dar, nos comenta Miguel, ya que se ha convertido en el motor para seguir adelante y luchan por darle una vida digna y sobre todo con mucho amor. Cuando dispone de un tiempo libre le gusta mucho jugar juegos de mesa junto con su esposa y en ocasiones algunos amigos de su barrio. El logro Estudiar la carrera de Ingeniería Electrónica, con la ayuda de sus padres, a pesar de su condición humilde.

Día a día Miguel trabaja en su pequeño negocio de servicio de pintado de autos, el labora alrededor de 9 horas al dia y puede atender hasta 3 clientes diariamente, con e fruto de su trabajo el puede solventar los gastos de su hogar y por ello se esfuerza mucho por hacerlo bien; el cree que le va bien en su negocio por sus ganas de salir adelante y porque tiene un motivo para salir adelante el cual es su hijo.

Miguel está muy agradecido con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado el podrá comprar una compresora de mayor capacidad y materiales como pintura, laca, lija, masilla, entre otros; de esta manera el podrá tener los materiales y herramientas necesarias para poder realizar su trabajo y sobre todo seguir luchando para poder hacer realidad su más grande sueño:” Darle una buena educación a su hijo y tener su local propio”.
texts.en:
Miguel, 31, lives with his wife who is his right hand; they have a one-month old little boy who is the greatest gift God could have given him and Miguel relates that he’s become the greatest motivator to continue moving forward and striving to give him a dignified life that’s full of love.  When he has free time available he likes to play board games with his wife and sometimes with friends from the neighborhood.  He managed to study electrical engineering with help from his parents despite their humble condition.

Miguel works day to day in his small auto paint shop.  He works around 9 hours daily and can take care of up to 3 customers per day.  He’s able to cover household expenses with the fruits of his labor and this is why he strives to do it well.  He believes that he does well at work because of his drive to get ahead and because he has a reason to get ahead: his son.

Miguel is very grateful to Kiva lenders because thanks to the help they’ve given him he will be able to buy a larger capacity compressor and materials like paint, lacquer, sandpaper and putty, among others in order to have the necessary materials and tools to do his work and continue striving to make his greatest dream a reality: to provide his son with a good education and to have a shop of his own.

loans.use: to buy a compressor, paint, lacquer, sandpaper, putty, etc.

loans.name: Intan Group

texts.en:
Group “Intan”  began to form in October 19, 2009, and has been running 2 months short of 3 years. The group is located in a small town in Indonesia, specifically in the town of Cilacap. The group consists of 18 people, who have a variety of businesses like, selling clothes and shoes, selling snacks, soybean cake production, food stalls open to business, raising goats for sale. They support each other and complement each other. If one member is ill, they will raise funds to help offset the cost of treatment for the sick member. They will visit the sick person to hand over the funds to help. They have become a “Community“. 

The group is led by a woman named Menik, she has three children who are still in school. Menik has a business selling clothes, bags, shoes and bed cover. With this loan, Menik hopes to build her own store and add a lot of models of clothes and new bags for sale to the public. These loans can also be expected to increase the business and earnings of each of the Intan group. In the picture, Menik raise her hand.

loans.use: to build her own store and add a lot of models of clothes and new bags

loans.name: Leticia

texts.en: Leticia is 35 years old and lives in Buchanan. She is married and has three children aged 3 to 17 who are in school and live at home. She did not attend school. For the past ten years she has been selling oil, onions, soap, pepper, and biscuits. She started this business with money that she borrowed from her friends. One problem she is facing is that she does not have enough commodities to sell. She is requesting a loan to purchase oil, onions, soap, pepper and biscuits for her business. She enjoys her business because it helps with her family finances. Her plan is to build a house and become a big businesswoman.

loans.use: to purchase oil, onions, soap, pepper and biscuits for her business.

loans.name: Jesee

texts.en:
Jesee is a farmer in Murang’a, where he has practiced farming for twelve successive years. He is running his farm with two farmhands and is currently producing cabbages, tomatoes, flowers, and tea for the local market. He gets additional income from retailing horticultural products, which he sources from his farm as well as from other farmers in the area.

Jesee has made a request for 35,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to buy farm inputs for his horticultural farming business. He will particularly buy seeds and fertilizers. Jesee hopes to improve his horticultural business and supply external markets. He says the income will help him expand his farming acreage by buying more land.

Jesee says the main challenge in the farming business, especially horticultural markets, is the saturation of such markets. He adds this is his main reason for focusing on improving the business to meet external markets.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Luis Gabriel

texts.es:
Luis es un joven emprendedor que tiene 19 años, ha cursado algunos niveles superiores, pero sin terminar su carrera por falta de recursos económicos. Es soltero y vive en Nanegalito, una parroquia del cantón Los Bancos de la Provincia de Pichincha, una de las más grandes en la República del Ecuador. Este cantón se encuentra a pocos kilómetros de la ciudad de Quito, y tiene diversidad de bosques, además sus barrios están poblados con gente amable y costumbres propias de esta ciudad en donde también se encuentran establecidas varias microempresas administradas por los emprendedores que luchan por hacer realidad sus sueños cada día. Otras de las actividades sobresalientes son la agricultura y la ganadería, produciendo abundantes cultivos que luego son comercializados para distribuirse hacia muchas provincias. También posee varios atractivos turísticos como cascadas, ríos, senderos, balnearios en donde el turista es atraído por los deportes de aventura que se venden allí con seguridad garantizada. 
Luis hace un año estableció en el pueblo un centro de alquiler de computadoras en el cual trabaja 9 horas diarias y siente que es muy productivo puesto que la tecnología se ha convertido en una necesidad a la que no todos los hogares en el lugar tienen acceso. Luis quiere invertir en su negocio comprando más computadoras y adecuando mejor su local y generar más ingresos con los que pueda continuar sus estudios y aplicar los conocimientos en su microempresa, por lo que solicitó un préstamo a Fundación Alternativa con quienes está muy agradecido por el apoyo y asesoría brindados para el alcance de sus objetivos.
texts.en:
Luis, 19, is a young entrepreneur who has taken some higher education courses but has been unable to complete his studies because of the lack of economic resources.  He’s single and lives in Nanegalito, a parish in Los Bancos Canton in Pichincha Province one of Ecuador’s largest.  This canton is located a few kilometers from the city of Quito.  It has a variety of forests and its neighborhoods are populated with kind people with customs that are typical of this city.  There are also several micro businesses established here by entrepreneurs who strive daily to make their dreams realty.  Other outstanding activities are agriculture and animal husbandry producing abundant crops that are sold in many provinces.  It also has many tourist attractions like waterfalls, rivers, paths and aquatic resorts where tourists are attracted by the extreme sports safely practiced there.

Luis set up a computer leasing business a year ago in town where he works nine hours daily.  He feels that it’s very productive because technology has become a need that not all homes have access to.  Luis wants to invest in his business purchasing more computers and better furnishing his locale to generate higher income and be able to continue with his studies and apply all his knowledge to his micro business.  This is why he requested a loan from Fundación Alternativa and he’s very grateful to them for the support and counseling provided to reach his goals.

loans.use: to buy computers and to do some physical improvements to his business to provide better customer comfort.

loans.name: Fortaleza Group

texts.es:
El comite Fortaleza se destaca por la unidad y el deseo de progresar como grupo. Cada una de ellas es un ejemplo a seguir por el trabajo y la lucha que dan día a día por salir adelante, ya que tienen un gran espíritu de superación.
Liduvina es la presidenta, y comenta que gracias al grupo esta saliendo y ve que a sus amigas también les esa siendo de mucha ayuda. Ella vende prendas, y cuenta que tiene muy buena clientela, y que está cargada siempre de pedidos.
Solicita el préstamo para la compra de pantalones, jeans, camisas y demás prendas para poder surtirse y cumplir con pedidos que tiene.
texts.en:
The Fortaleza committee stands for unity and the wish to progress as a group. Each of them is an example of carrying on with the work and struggle that they have day to day to get ahead as they have a great desire to excel.

Liduvina is the president and says that thanks to the group she is emerging and she sees that this is also helping her friends a lot. She sells garments, and says she has a very good clientele and that she is always filled with orders.

She is requesting this loan to buy pants, jeans, shirts and other garments to be able to supply and fulfill the orders she has.

loans.use: to buy garments to sell such as pants, jeans, shirts and other garments.

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en: Patrick is 30 years old and married. He and his wife are blessed with three school-going children. He has been earning a monthly income of KES 5,800 from his carpentry  business for the past four years. He is requesting a loan of KES 60,000, with which he intends to buy more stock of timber and other equipment, such as a saw, for use in furniture making. This will be his third loan with KADET LTD. He will use the anticipated profit to expand his business. His future hopes and dreams are to have a stable business and happy family.

loans.use: to buy more stock of timber and other equipment, such as a saw, for use in furniture making.

loans.name: Abdumalik

texts.en:
Abdumalik is an entrepreneurial person who is married and has two children. He has been busy with animal husbandry for more than 16 years. Little by little, with the passing of the time and years, he has perfected his knowledge. Thanks to the animals’ good condition, he has managed to win a large quantity of customers for his business. He sells his animals in the local market and has many customers. 

Abdumalik is looking for a loan to buy young cattle. In this way he will be able to offer his customers good animals and continue to make financial progress, providing his household with good earnings. 

Moreover, in this way he will be able to offer his children access to a better quality education, and he will have a financial stability that will allow him to progress. He is asking for a loan of 550 USD to buy young cattle for developing his business further. Each month he will make his payments on time. He awaits your support.

loans.use: to buy young  cattle.

loans.name: Produciendo Esperanza Group

texts.es:
Este Banco Comunal se llama “Produciendo Esperanzas” está conformado por 17 emprendedoras, quienes se dedican a diferentes rubros, entre los cuales se encuentran; Artesanas, Venta  de empanadas, chocolatería, cremas, venta de miel, venta de mermeladas, servicios entre otros. Todas ellas pertenecientes a la ciudad de  Temuco.
Myriam delegada del grupo del Banco Comunal, quien en la foto se encuentra de pie en la  última fila ocupando el quinto lugar de izquierda a derecha, viste chaqueta de color negra, su cabello es crespo de color castaño oscuro y lo usa suelto.
Ella se dedica al rubro de ventas de mermelada, desde hace 5 meses. Comenta que trabaja en la producción de mermeladas el día miércoles, y los días lunes, martes, jueves y viernes se dedica a su huerto que lo ubica en su casa, trabaja a veces los fines de semana según sea la solicitud de su elaboracion de mermeladas. Trabaja  en un liceo para la preparación de las mermeladas, su horario de trabajo lo distribuye de acuerdo a su disponibilidad. 
La mercadería e insumos que va necesitando  los compra en ferreterías, ya que ocupa alambres para las frutas, y también compra en supermercados, a bajo costo, por lo tanto conveniente económicamente.
Con el crédito comprará alambres y estacas para arreglar las frutas para la preparación de sus mermeladas.
Una de las metas de Myriam es surgir con su rubro, llegar a tener una buena producción de mermeladas y más clientela.
Myriam vive junto a su madre, sobrina de 24 años de edad, y su hija de 17 años quien se encuentra estudiando. Sus sueños a nivel familiar es tener su casa propia, para darle un buen pasar a su hija.
Ella está muy contenta y agradecida de la oportunidad que le ha brindado Fondo Esperanza para invertir en su negocio. Además se siente muy cómoda con  el grupo que participa, ya que son unidas, existe respeto y confianza. Respecto a las capacitaciones impartidas en las reuniones, ha aprendido administrar su negocio de mejor manera.
Temuco es la capital de la región de la Araucanía. La ciudad se ubica a 670 kilómetros al sur de Santiago (capital de Chile). En sus alrededores se ubican una serie de balnearios lacustres (Pucón, Villarrica) y una flora y fauna nativa muy llamativas, concentrada en parques naturales cercanos. Cabe destacar que en esta región habita el 50% de los mapuches, pueblo indígena, existente en nuestro país.
texts.en:
This communal bank is called “Produciendo Esperanzas” (Producing Hopes) and it has 17 entrepreneurs who are in a variety of lines of work like crafts, turnover sales, chocolate shop, cream sales, honey sales, marmalade sales and services, among others.  All of them are from the city of Temuco.

Myriam is group delegate and in the photo appears standing in the last row, fifth from left to right wearing a black jacket.  Her hair is curly, dark brown and she wears it loose.  She’s been selling marmalade for five months.  She comments that she works making marmalade Wednesdays.  On Mondays, Tuesdays, Thursdays and Fridays she works in her orchard located at home; sometimes she also works weekends depending on demand for marmalade.  She prepares the marmalade at a school and her work schedule is according to her availability.  

She buys the supplies and ingredients she needs in hardware stores because she needs wire for the fruit; she also buys at supermarkets at low cost which is advantageous economically.  She will use the loan to buy wire and stakes to prepare the fruit for marmalade production.  One of Myriam’s goals is to surge forward in her line of work and to attain a good level of marmalade production and more customers.  Myriam lives with her mother, 24-year-old niece and 17-year-old daughter who is attending school.  Her dream at the family level is to have a house of her own and to give her daughter good wellbeing.

She is very happy and grateful for the opportunity Fondo Esperanza has given her to invest in her business.  She also feels very comfortable in the group she participates in because they are united; there is respect and trust among them.  With respect to the training provided at the meetings, she’s learned how to manage her business better.

Temuco is the capital of the Araucanía region.  The city is located 670 kilometers south of Santiago (Capital of Chile).  There are several lakeside resorts nearby (Pucón, Villarrica) and very eye-catching flora and fauna concentrated in nearby natural parks.  It’s worth noting that 50% of the Mapuche indigenous population existing in the country lives in this region.

loans.use: to buy stakes and wire.

loans.name: Marcia Jessenia

texts.es:
Marcia empezó vendiendo mercadería desde hace 2 años, es madre soltera con muchas aspiraciones en la vida y muchos animos de continuar con sus ventas. Cada día para mejorar sus ingresos y darle un mejor futuro a su hija se levanta muy temprano para vender ropa y otras mercaderas, mientras que su hija estudia en la escuela fiscal. 

Actualmente su trabajo lo hace sola, vendiendo ropa trabaja de lunes a sábado, tiene cliente fijos, por tal tiene un ingreso estable. Con el préstamo va a comprar ropa. Su aspiraciones en el futuro es comprar al mayor y por menor para distribuirlo a clientes.
texts.en: Marcia started selling merchandise two years ago.  She’s a single mother with many hopes in life and determined to continue selling.  To improve her income and give her daughter a better future she rises very early every day to sell clothes and other merchandise while her daughter attends public school.   She currently works alone selling clothes from Monday to Saturday.  She has regular customers so her income is stable.  She will use the loan to buy clothes.  Her goal for the future is to buy at wholesale and retail to resell to customers.

loans.use: to buy clothes.

loans.name: Irelyn

texts.en: Irelyn has operated a sari-sari, or convenience store, in Talibon, Bohol, Philippines for some time. She is also engaged in seaweed farming. Her husband works as a fisherman. Irelyn needs more funds for her business. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP to buy more stock, such as canned goods, snack food and other items, to sell in her store and materials for seaweed farming. In the future, Irelyn wants to expand her business so that it will generate more revenue.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell in her store and materials for seaweed farming

loans.name: Rashida's Group

texts.en:
Rashida is a 32-year-old, hard-working married woman who is living in Punjab, Pakistan with her husband, 2 daughters and a son. Her elder daughter is in 7th grade, while the younger one is in the 4th grade. Her husband is a laborer, and his income is not enough to fulfill his family's basic needs. By sewing clothing, she helps her husband meet the household expenses. Her biggest dream is to provide a quality education for her daughters and to establish her business by opening a new tailoring shop in the future.

Rashida is a member of an eight-person lending group. She has requested a loan from Kiva partner BRAC Pakistan, to purchase a new sewing machine as well as a few sewing materials to further improve her business. She has been operating her business very efficiently and honestly for the past seven years. 

She is living in a rented house so her biggest aim of life is to build her own house so she and her family can have a happy and healthy life. 

Note: In the picture, Rashida is holding a passbook in her hand.

loans.use: To purchase a new sewing machine and sewing materials.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in business and  expand the opeartion of funeral services

loans.name: Luis Eduardo

texts.es:
Luis, tiene 25 años de edad, vive con sus padres, realizan la cosecha de granos básicos para mantener así su hogar, lleva cuatro años trabajando en lo propio, esta actividad la aprendió a través de su padre ya que han sido agricultores desde hace mucho tiempo.

Luis está iniciando sus labores agrícolas para una nueva siembra, esto le ha llevado a solicitar un nuevo préstamo para la compra de ocho sacos de abono y herbicidas, esto le permitirá a él tener todo lo necesario a la mano para aplicarlos al cultivo y así poder expandir su producción agrícola.

Manifiesta que su situación económica es bastante estable pero que a través de los préstamos espera ir mejorando cada vez más la calidad de vida para toda su familia.
texts.en:
Luis, 25, lives with his parents.  They grow basic grains to support the home.  He’s been working on his own for four years.  He learned this activity from his father who has worked in agriculture for a long time.  

Luis is starting a new planting cycle and is requesting a loan to buy 8 sacks of manure and herbicide in order to have everything he needs on hand to apply to the crops thus expanding crop yields. He states that his economic situation is quite stable but he hopes by means of the loans to improve his entire family’s quality of life more each time.

loans.use: to buy 8 sacks of manure and herbicide.

loans.name: Jose Heriberto

texts.es:
José, tiene 21 años de edad, está soltero y trabaja en el cultivo de maíz para obtener ingresos y poder ayudar a su madre con los gastos, tiene tres años de trabajar y esta actividad la aprendió por iniciativa propia ya que se creció solamente con su madre y tenía que encontrar la manera de ayudarla económicamente.

El está realizando la siembra y solicita un préstamo para comprarse cuatro sacos de abono y poderlos aplicar al cultivo, este material es muy necesario para los agricultores ya que les ayuda a mejorar la producción y a poder asegurar una buena cosecha.

José, quiere trabajar para poder tener la facilidad económica en su hogar y aportar a su madre lo necesario, mejorando cada vez más su vida.
texts.en:
José, 21, is single and works growing corn to earn income and help his mother with expenses.  He’s been working in this activity for three years having learned in on his own initiative since he grew up with his mother only and had to find a way to help her out economically.

He’s starting a planting cycle and is requesting a loan to buy four sacks of manure to apply to the crop.  This material is very necessary for farmers because it helps them improve production and assure a good harvest.  José wants to work in order to have economic wherewithal at home and to provide his mother with what’s needed improving their life more every day.

loans.use: to buy four sacks of manure.

loans.name: Syombua

texts.en:
Syombua, 38, is married with four children. She has been earning a monthly income of 8000 KES from selling fruits and vegetables for the past 12 years.

This will be her first loan of 20000 KES from KADET LTD. She intends to use the loan to purchase more stock of onions, tomatoes and cabbage to sell.

She will use the anticipated profit to broaden the market scope of the business. She hopes to have a stable business and a happy family in the future.

loans.use: to buy more stock of onions, tomatoes and cabbage to sell.

loans.name: Bayarmaa

texts.en:
Bayarmaa is 33 years old and operates a retail business in the shopping center of Ulaanbaatar, the capital of Mongolia. She has been running her business for at least a year. She lives with her family in the ger district, in the boundary of the city, where there are Mongolian nomadic yurts and houses. 

Bayarmaa is requesting a loan to finish building her family home. She plans to insulate the walls, which would enable her to reduce the usage of the coal-burning furnace and to stay warmer at home. She is also planning to insulate the roof, due to the heat loss.

With this loan she will pay for building materials such as foam, stone wool and cement for the insulation of her family home.

loans.use: to pay for building materials such as foam, stone wool and cement for the insulation of her family home.

loans.name: Amrastan

texts.en:
Amrastan is from a small village of the Marneuli district. He is 43 years old and lives with his wife and two children. He works in a 800 sq. m. greenhouse where tomatoes, cucumbers, onions and cauliflower are grown. Amrastan does all of the relevant seasonal work to ensure a good harvest, which is sold locally. He works hard to earn some savings and expand his agricultural business.

Amrastan requested a loan to purchase onion seeds. He will sow onions in his greenhouse, and with proper seasonal work he will be able to get a good harvest to sell at a good price. 

The loan will help him to provide financially for his needs. This will increase his income, and Amrastan will reinvest in his agricultural business to expand and make it more profitable. With the increased profit Amrastan will improve his living conditions. He awaits your support.

loans.use: to purchase onion seeds.

loans.name: Ramadhan

texts.en:
Ramadhan is a 63-year-old married man. He has four children, with ages ranging from 5 years to 17 years. He describes himself to be a polite man.

He operates a retail store where he sells items such as sugar, salt, cooking oil, and flour. He has been involved in this business for three years. His business is located in a residential area, and his primary customers are local residents.  He describes his biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds for improving the business. 

He will use the KES 5,800 loan to buy a solar lantern to use in his business premises. His business goal is to improve his business within five years. He hopes that in the future, he will have had expanded his business.  He has taken three loans with SMEP DTM and managed to repay them succesfully.

loans.use: to buy a solar lantern for his business.

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.es:
La señora Lourdes, es de la Ciudad de Santaní, es soltera, vive con su mama, es dueña de una despensa y también se dedica a la venta de bebidas en Gral. en su propia casa.
 Es un persona muy trabajadora, responsable y muy honesta, según cuenta empezó vendiendo helados, hielo haciendo servicios de carga de celulares, su sueño era siempre tener una despensa y ventas de bebidas en Gral., ahora ya cuenta con su propia despensa gracias a su trabajo y esfuerzo.
La Sra. Lourdes solicita el crédito para ampliar una parte de su salón para cargar más productos, y así satisfacer las necesidades de sus clientes  y aumentar sus ventas diarias y así poder seguir ayudando a su familia.
texts.en: Lourdes is from the city of Santaní; she’s single living with her mother.  She owns a grocery store and also sells beverages in general at home.  She’s a very hardworking, very honest woman.  She relates that when she started out she sold ice-cream and ice and also mobile phone time cards.  Her dream had always been to have a store and to sell beverages in general and now thanks to her work and effort she has her own store.  Lourdes is requesting the loan to expand part of her living room in order to stock more products, meet customer demand and increase daily sales to thus continue helping her family.

loans.use: to enlarge her store.

loans.name: Juan De Dios

texts.es: Juan de Dios es un hombre de 56 años de edad que se describe a si mismo como muy organizado, prueba de ello es que desde que se retiró de su almacén donde trabajó siguió cotizando en un sistema de seguridad social, para obtener su pensión y ya logró el tiempo de cotización para adquirir su pensión, ahora solo espera cumplir 60 años. Juan de Dios  trabajó varios años como vendedor de un almacén de ropa; después de retirarse decidió iniciar su propio negocio aprovechando la experiencia adquirida y la amistad que tenía con los proveedores, para emprender su propia aventura de negocios como aun lo hace  en su propia residencia, donde está ubicado su punto comercial. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará cortinas, manteles, toallas, sábanas, jeans, sweater, almohadas, abanicos y licuadoras. Sus sueños es alquilar un local en un mediano plazo, para separar el negocio de su residencia, mientras esto ocurre maneja en sus indicadores financieros ventas mensuales que le proporcionan un  margen de utilidad promedios de  40%, y una  rotación de inventario de 60 días, índices que son usuales en este tipo de negocios.
texts.en: Juan de Dios is a 56 year old man who describes himself as very organized.  Proof of this is that after he retired from the store where he worked, he continued making contributions to the social security system to obtain his pension and he has already completed the contribution period required to qualify to receive his pension.  Now, he only has to wait until he is 60 years old.  Juan de Dios worked for several years as a salesman at a clothing store.  After retiring, he decided to start his own business.  He took advantage of the experience he had gained and the relationship that he had with the suppliers in order to undertake his business venture.  He still works from his home, which is his place of business.  Currently, he is applying for a Kiva loan, his first loan through the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo.  He will purchase curtains, tablecloths, towels, sheets, jeans, sweaters, pillows, fans, and blenders.  His dream is to find a business location with a medium-term rent in order to separate the business from his residence.  During this time, he’ll monitor his monthly sales financial indicators, which provide a 40% average profit margin and a 60 day inventory turnover, indexes that are customary in this type of business.

loans.use: to purchase curtains, tablecloths, towels, sheets, jeans, sweaters, pillows, fans, and blenders.

loans.name: Ephantus

texts.en:
Ephentus is a farmer in central Kenya, where he lives with his family of two children. His farm produce currently includes maize, beans, peas, and milk for the local market.

Ephentus has requested a loan of KES 30,000 from Juhudi Kilimo to buy a water tank for his farm. He hopes to boost his farming income once he maintains a constant water supply in his farm. He plans to buy more acres of land and expand his farming business significantly.

He says the high cost of pesticides and fluctuation of rains remain major challenges in his farming business.

loans.use: To buy a water tank for his farm.

loans.name: Diana Carolina

texts.es:
Diana, se dedica a la venta de ropa, tiene 23 años de edad, vive con su esposo,la mercadería que ofrece es venta de ropa para niños y para damas, tiene una experiencia de tres años en el comercio y la aprendió a través de su madre quien se dedica a lo mismo.

Ella está solicitando préstamo para comprar un surtido de ropa para niños como blusas, trajecitos, ropa interior, calcetines, también comprará ropa para dama como blusas y faldas, este préstamo ayudará a incrementar los inventarios del negocio y que ella pueda ofrecer una mejor calidad a los clientes.

Dentro de sus objetivos está crecer en el negocio a través de la ayuda de estos préstamos y poder crecer en el mercado para ofrecer una mejor calidad de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Diana sells clothing. She's 23 years old and lives with her husband. The merchandise she sells is children's and women's clothing. She has three years' worth of experience in retail and she learned the business from her mother, who's in the same line of work.
She requests a loan in order to purchase an assortment of children's clothes such as blouses, outfits, underwear and socks. She'll also purchase women's clothes such as blouses and skirts. This loan will help her stock up her business so that she can offer better quality merchandise to her customers.
Among her goals is to expand her business with the help of these loans, and also to grow in the market so she can improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase blouses, outfits, underwear, and socks.

loans.name: Ibayaye

texts.en: Ibayaye lives in Compound #3. She is 20 years old and she did not go school. She is living with her boyfriend and they have three children between 1 and 8; two are attending school and they all live at home. For the past 9 years, she has been operating a salon in the local market. She started this business with the help of her boyfriend. She is requesting a loan to purchase artificial hair and hair products for her business. She plans to send her children to school until they complete their schooling.

loans.use: to purchase artificial hair and hair products for her business.

loans.name: El Renacer De Rahue Group

texts.es:
Este Banco Comunal se llama “Renacer de Rahue” está  conformado por  22 emprendedores quienes se dedican a diferentes rubros, entre los cuales se encuentran; venta de ropa usada y nueva, venta de mermeladas en conserva, repostería, venta de empanadas, venta de carbón, venta de frutas y ensaladas, costuras, ropa para mascotas, peluquería, soldador, servicios entre otros. Todos ellos pertenecientes a la ciudad de Osorno.
Raquel presidenta del grupo del Banco Comunal, quien en la foto se encuentra de pie en segunda fila, ocupando el quinto lugar de izquierda a derecha, viste chaleco de color negro, su cabello lo usa suelto y largo y es de color castaño oscuro, su mano derecha saluda a la cámara.
Ella se dedica al rubro de venta de ropa, desde hace 3 años. Comenta que trabaja los días martes, sábados y domingos en la feria de 9ºº a 14ºº horas. Su ropa es específicamente para niño, adulto y además venta de bolsos, carteras y zapatos.
La mercadería e insumos que va necesitando los compra en distribuidoras donde se especializan en vender ropa por fardos, a bajo costo, por lo tanto conveniente económicamente.
Con el crédito comprara fardo de ropa, y accesorios como bolsos, carteras y zapatos.
Una de las metas de Raquel es seguir creciendo en su rubro y tener un local específico para atender a su clientela, así generar mayores ingresos para su hogar y darle un buen futuro a su hijo.
Raquel vive junto a su esposo y su hijo de 6 años de edad. Sus sueños a nivel laboral es tener su local propio, y a nivel familiar es darle lo mejor a su hija y un futuro para sus estudios.
Ella está muy contenta y agradecida de la oportunidad brindada por Fondo Esperanza, ya que le permitirá invertir en su negocio. Comenta que las capacitaciones han sido fundamentales para su negocio y también para su desarrollo personal, ya que ha aprendido a organizar y distribuir de mejor menara sus ingresos e inversiones.
Osorno es una ciudad que se ubica en la zona sur de Chile, región de Los Lagos. Es un importante centro agropecuario que se identifica como "La Patria de la Leche y Tierra de la Carne" de Chile. Dentro de su actividad agropecuaria se destaca el cultivo de trigo y avena, la crianza de ganado, para el procesamiento de carnes y lácteos además de la fabricación de equipos agrarios.
Destaca en Osorno el único estadio de fútbol techado de Chile, el Estadio Municipal "Rubén Marcos”.
texts.en:
This communal bank is called “Renacer de Rahue” (Rahue’s Rebirth) and it has 22 entrepreneurs who are in various lines of work among which are used and new clothes sales, marmalade sales, pastry making, turnover sales, charcoal sales, fruit and salad sales, sewing services, clothes for pets, barber shop, welding and services, among others.  All of them are from the city of Osorno.

Raquel is communal bank president and in the photo is standing in the second row, fifth from left to right wearing a black vest; her hair is loose, long and dark brown and she’s waving at the camera with her right hand.

She has been selling clothes for three years.  She comments that she works Tuesdays, Saturdays and Sundays at the street market from 9am until 2pm.  Her clothes are specifically for children and adults; she also sells purses, wallets and shoes.  The merchandise she needs she buys from suppliers specializing in selling clothes by the bundle at low cost which is advantageous economically.  She will use the loan to buy a bundle of clothes and accessories like purses, wallets and shoes.  One of Raquel’s goals is to continue growing in her line of work and to have a specific locale in which to tend to customers thus generating higher household income and to give herchild a better future.

Raquel lives with her husband and six-year-old child.  Her dream at a work level is to have a locale of her own and at the family level to provide a better life for her child and a better future for his studies.  She is very happy and grateful for the opportunity Fondo Esperanza is giving her because she will be able to invest in her business.  She comments that the training sessions have been fundamental for her business and also for her personal development because she’s learned how to organize and better distribute her income and investments.

Osorno is a city located in south Chile in Los Lagos Region.  It’s an important agriculture and livestock raising zone known as “The Country of Milk and Land of Meat” of Chile.  Wheat and oat growing stand out as well as cattle raising for meat and dairy products processing; farm equipment is also manufactured here.  Osorno stands out for having Chile’s only roofed soccer stadium, the Rubén Marcos Municipal Stadium.

loans.use: to buy a bundle of clohtes and accessories like purses, wallets and shoes.

loans.name: Amina

texts.en:
Amina is a 46-year-old divorced woman, who has been working as a tailor since 1992 to earn her own living. She is a hard worker who keeps improving her business to please her customers as much as she can. Most of Amina's customers are relatives and neighbors.

Amina is applying for a loan from Kiva's partner Al Majmoua in order to pay for goods she bought for her business and to help her daughter with her wedding preparations. This will be Amina's eleventh loan with Al Majmoua and she has a good standing repayment history. She hopes to buy a more professional sewing machine in the future that will make her work faster and easier.

loans.use: To pay for goods she bought for her business

loans.name: Mery's Group

texts.en:
Mery is 32 years old, a hard working and independent woman. She is living in Punjab, Pakistan, with her husband and a son, who is studying in third class. Her husband is a security guard and his income is not enough to meet the household expenses. 

For 15 years, Mery has been running a beauty salon, and she wants to purchase some more cosmetic products and chairs for her beauty salon. For that reason,  Mery is a member of an eight-person lending group that has requested for a loan from Kiva partner BRAC Pakistan.

On getting a profit, first of all she will repay the loan amount to Kiva and than she wants to build a new room in the salon, as the space in the salon is too much congested.
 
She hopes that her business grows more and she is very much thankful to both Brac and Kiva.

Note: In the picture, Mery is carrying a passbook in her hand.

loans.use: to purchase cosmetics and a new chair for her beauty salon.

loans.name: Christita

texts.en:
This is Christita, 48 years old and a resident of Manila, Philippines. She is a mother to her children and manages her household while operating her business, a food stall. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her family's everyday expenses.

Christita sells native cakes and pastries, which she mostly makes from sticky rice, in her community. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of 300 Philippine pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

To help her continue operating her business, she is requesting a loan of 50,000 PHP. She will use the loan to buy more raw ingredients and products for her business. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.

Christita dreams of being able to give her children a good life through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and draws strength and inspiration from the Word of God.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for raw ingredients and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Hang's Group

texts.en:
Hang was born in 1973. She has three children. Her youngest one is two years old, the middle one is in second grade and the eldest is a soldier. She and her husband have a store to sell beer and supply Internet service. The total earnings of her family are about 5,000,000 VND per month. 

She has participated in SEDA's credit program since 2011. In the last cycle she borrowed 5,152,000 VND and repaid the loan on time. In this loan cycle, she would like to borrow 7,392,000 VND to sell beer and supply Internet service in her internet store. She hopes her business makes enough money to pay for her children’s education fees.
 
Cuc is 30 years old. She has two children. She makes false eyelashes for a living. She wants to borrow 7,392,000 VND to make false eyelashes and sell them.

Ha is 39 years old. She has two children. She raises pigs and makes rice milling for a living. She wants to borrow 7,392,000 VND to buy more pigs to raise.

Hang is 36 years old. She has two children. She sells cooked pork food in the market for a living. For raising her family's income, she wants to borrow 7,392,000 VND to buy chicken breeds to raise.

Hue is 53 years old. She has three children. She raises pigs for a living. She wants to borrow 5,152,000 VND to buy more pigs to raise.

loans.use: to sell beer and supply Internet service in her Internet store.

loans.name: Azizbika

texts.en: Azizbika, 57 years old, is married and raising five children. For the past 31 years, she has been raising animals and selling milk products to supplement her family's income. Thanks to her hard work, Azizbika now has 3 milk cows with calves. She plans to increase the number of animals with the goal of further developing her business. Azizbika has applied to VF Azercredit and Partners for a loan of 1,600 AZN to buy construction materials for building a house for her son.

loans.use: To buy construction materials for building a house for her son.

loans.name: Thy

texts.en: Thy is 36 years old and a rural villager from Sa Ang district of Kandal province, Cambodia. He has only a two-year-old son who needs his support. To provide for their daily cost of living, he grows paddy rice on one hectare of farmland as the core business and supplements his income via planting cassava and mango. He has engaged in this business for several years. Thy has been with VisionFund, Kiva's partner, for the past three loan cycles. He successfully has used his loan in managing his cash-crop planting business and to better support his household. Now, he is seeking a loan of 1,200 USD to buy more cassava for planting. He hopes to receive more yields from his crop so as to improve his standard lifestyle.

loans.use: To buy more cassava for planting

loans.name: Kea

texts.en: Kea is 56 years old and a resident of Sa Ang district of Kandal province. She has six children. One son is still dependent on her, as he is still in school. To generate a daily income for her family's basic needs, she runs a small grocery stall at home. Her husband grows a mango tree for fruits for sales to gain additional income. It has been 21 years already that she has been engaged in this business. This is her fifth loan cycle with Kiva's partner VisionFund. She has paid back the past loans with success. They have helped her to keep up a good pace for her business, as well as better living conditions for her family. Now, she is applying for a new loan of 1,200 USD to buy a decent motorbike to support her business. She hopes that she can reduce her travelling time to market and use that spare time to pay more attention to her children.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is a resident of Nkubu in Meru, Central Kenya. For the past 5 years, he has been farming, with bananas and milk being his main products for the local market. Peter also does masonry for additional income. He is married and has one child, aged three.

Peter has requested a loan of 30,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to buy poultry. He hopes to improve his family's living standards with the additional income. Peter says the reliability of Juhudi Kilimo made him choose it for the farming loan request. He notes the challenges of poor infrastructure, pests and diseases.

loans.use: To buy poultry

loans.name: Phils

texts.en: Phils is taking out another loan of KES 50,000 to expand her existing business. She is a very hardworking woman who always finds new opportunities to move forward. The previous loan was of much help to her business. Phils plans to purchase shampoo, a dryer and other products to continue offering services to her increasing number of customers.

loans.use: to purchase shampoo, a dryer and other products.

loans.name: Hotamboy

texts.ru: Хотамбой  трудолюбивый человек. Ему 39 лет. Он женат и  имеет троих детей. Дети еще нетрудоспособные, старшему 16 лет, а младшему 10 лет. Он начал  заниматься скотоводством и земледелием с детства. В основном он выращивает пшеницу, картофель, и другие сельхоз продукты. В настоящее время он выращивает 3 голов КРС и 25 голов МРС. Уже более 15 -и лет он занимает этим бизнесом. В ведении бизнеса ему помогает его жена. Он запрашивает займ на сумму 2000 долларов США для покупки скота. На полученный доход от реализации скота он намерен расширить свой бизнес. Он ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en:
Hotamboy is a very hard working man. He's thirty-nine years old, married and he has two children, 16 and 10 years old. He's worked as a farmer since his childhood. Right now, he grows wheat, potatoes and other crops while maintaining a herd that consists of 3 heads of large-horned cattle and 25 heads of small-horned cattle. He's run this business with his wife for the past fifteen years. 
Hotamboy is asking for a loan of 2,000 dollars in order to purchase some more cattle. He wants to expand his business using the profits from the loan. He thanks you for your kindness.

loans.use: To buy cattle.

loans.name: Shahida

texts.en:
Ms. Shahida is a 37-year-old active, married woman. She has effectively been doing a business of embroidery at her home for the last five years. Her collection is very famous in her town. She has gotten a lot of appreciation from her community members. She makes enough to lead a decent life. Her husband is employed in a small general store, and one of her sons works in a repairing shop of cars. However, their income is very unpredictable and not enough to cover everyday expenditures. 

She is a loving mother of six children; three of them are school-going while two stay at home. She is in charge of providing her family with good food, health and education. She has slowly but surely improved her business by taking loans from the Kashf Foundation. Now she requested a loan of Rs. 15,000 Pakistan rupees to buy stock of threads and pearls in different colors to meet the increasing demand for her embroidery designs. She hopes to have more profits and hence, better support her family. She desires to spend a part of earnings on two of her daughters' education.

loans.use: To buy stock of threads and pearls in different colors.

loans.name: Mustafa

texts.en:
Mustafa is married. His wife and three children help him to maintain his business. Their children are aged 15 to 22. Mustafa always tries to earn money and provide a better life for his children. 

He began his own business dealing in animal husbandry 25 years ago. He sells milk products and meat at bazaar. Today he has requested a loan in the amount of AZN 500 to pay his eldest child's education fees.

loans.use: To pay his eldest child's education fee.

loans.name: Bisaida

texts.ru: Бисаида очень целеустремленная женщина.  Ей 45 лет, она замужем и на воспитании имеет 1 ребенка. Более 7 лет она занимается скотоводством. У нее 2  коровы и  2 барана. Она продает скот, за которым он присматривалась в течение нескольких месяцев. На рынке у нее много клиентов. Ее сын помогает ей в ведении бизнеса. Бисаида хочет развивать свой бизнес, но не имеет достаточного средства для этого. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 1000 сомони для покупки скота, чтобы развевать бизнес. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en:
Bisaida is a very dedicated woman. She's forty-five years old, married and has one son. For the past seven years she's run an animal raising business. She owns two cows and two bulls. She has many buyers on the market and usually sells cattle to them after taking care of it for several months. Her son assists her in her work. 
Bisaida doesn't possess enough capital to successfully expand her business, so she's asking for a loan of 1000 somoni in order to purchase some more cattle. She thanks you for your kindness.

loans.use: To buy cattle.

loans.name: Benito

texts.es:
El Sr. Benito es de la ciudad e Pilar,  es dueño de una pequeña empresa de servicios, está en el ramo hace más de 10 años realiza reparaciones, construcciones de sillas, mesas, carrocería para camiones, etc.
Es una persona muy trabajadora, que se esfuerza por ayudar a su esposa y su familia, y es gracias a su trabajo que están saliendo adelante. Su meta es seguir creciendo y así ayudar a su familia.
Solicita el crédito para la compra de productos, como ser maderas, metales y demás para poder seguir trabajando y haciendo los productos para sus clientes.
texts.en:
Benito is from the city of Pilar. He is the owner of a small service company. He has been in that field for more than ten years. He does repairs, builds chairs and tables, does autobody work for trucks, etc.

Benito is a very hardworking person who strives to help his wife and his family; it is thanks to his work that they are getting ahead. His goal is to keep growing, thereby helping his family.

He is requesting the loan for the purchase of materials, like lumber, metal, and other supplies so that he can keep working and making products for his customers.

loans.use: to buy metal and wood.

loans.name: Erastus

texts.en:
Erastus has been an active farmer in his rural home in Nkubu, central Kenya, where he lives with his wife and four children. He has ten active years in farming and currently produces maize, beans, peas, and milk for the local market.

Erastus has made a loan request of KES 50,000 through Juhudi Kilimo to buy a water tank and irrigation pipes. He says availability of water will help him expand his farming acreage and improve his income to meet his family's basic needs, especially educating his children.

He says rampant fluctuation in rainfall quantity remains the major challenge in farming. He is advocating that Juhudi Kilimo introduce emergency loan services.

loans.use: To buy a water tank and water pipes

loans.name: Kifah

texts.en: Kifah is a 44-year-old married woman from Marka, Amman, Jordan. She has a son and has requested a 500 JOD loan to pay for his education. In the future, Kifah wants to improve her family's situation.

loans.use: to pay for her son's education

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en: Josephine, 33 years old, lives in Compound #3. She is married and her husband is a driver. They have two children, aged  4 and 13, both in school and living at home. For the past 10 years, Josephine has been selling rice by the cup in the local market. She is requesting a loan to purchase bags of rice for her business. Josephine likes her business because it helps her to feed her children and send them to school. Her plan is to build a house for her children.

loans.use: to purchase bags of rice

loans.name: Javier Gonzalo

texts.es: El Sr. Javier tiene 46 años casado tiene tres hijos de las edades de 20, 17 y 12 años,  el se dedica a la venta de productos de primera necesidad en su tienda de venta de condimentos y especias para sazonar las comidas,  su tienda se encuentra ubicado en la zona del Tejar,  este préstamo es su decima secuencia dentro de la institución, El  Sr.  Javier utilizara  este préstamo para la compra de una moledora industrial para moler comino y ajíes   su razón para solicitar este préstamo es necesidad de surtir su negocio, el va a utilizar los beneficios en seguir comprando productos. Su deseo por su negocio es que su tienda sea más grande y más surtida y así de esta manera incrementas su clientela y por ende sus ganancias.
texts.en:
Sr. Javier is 46 years old, married, and has three children (ages 20, 17, and 12). He sells basic necessity products and also has a shop where he sells condiments and spices for seasoning food. His shop is located in the District of El Tejar.

This is his 10th loan with Emprender. Sr. Javier will use the funds to buy an industrial grinder for processing cumin and chile peppers. His reason for requesting this loan is because he needs to restock his business. Javier will utilize these benefits so that he can continue buying products. His wish for his business is to have larger and better-stocked store so that he can increase his clientele and his earnings.

loans.use: to buy an industrial grinder for making spices.

loans.name: Zaal

texts.en:
Zaal is from Abasha district in West Georgia. He is 35 years old, single and lives with his parents. His parents are provided with retirement pensions. 

Zaal runs an animal husbandry business.  He has 5 pigs, 11 milk cows and 11 calves.  His mother milks the cows and produces cheese products. The family sells on average 200-220 kg of cheese per year.  Zaal also has 3-hectare piece agricultural land where maize is grown. He does all the relevant seasonal work to insure a good harvest. The harvested production is sold at the local market. 

Zaal is very hard-working person with a great desire to get ahead.  He requested a loan to repair his house.  His existing house is old and damaged. He will purchase building materials and renovate the house. Then, the living conditions of the family will be improved and they will be able to spend their evenings after a hard working day in a more comfortable environment. Zaal hopes for your help and kindness.

loans.use: to repair his house

loans.name: Goretti

texts.en: Goretti lives in Kampala, Uganda.  She is a single mother with four children and two of them  are in school.  She also cares for grandchildren in her home.  Goretti is running a canteen. She works six days a week.  It has been ten years since she started her business. She has requested for a loan of Shs 600,000 from MCDT SACCO to buy crates of sodas and boxes of Safi & sweets. The challenges she has in her business are seasonality and thieves.  Her goals and aspirations are to expand her business by investing in second-hand clothes and  outside catering services.  She is renting a house for her home.  She has access to electricity and piped water.  Her greatest monthly expenses are for school fees and rent.

loans.use: buy sodas and sweets to sell

loans.name: Hanna

texts.en: Hanna lives in Compound #3.  She is 27 of age, single and has five children between the  ages of 1 and 8, three are in school and all of them live at home.  For the  past ten years, she been operating a cook shop (restaurant), where she sells cold water, soft drinks, and delicious Liberian food.  She is requesting a loan to purchase soft drinks, cold water, food stock  (rice, pepper, onion, oil, charcoal, and Vita) for her restaurant. She likes the buying in her business.  Her plan is to build her house and educate her children.

loans.use: buy food and drinks for her restaurant

loans.name: Alaa

texts.en:
Due to cultural reasons, Alaa prefers that her photo is not on the Internet.   Thus, the above photo is of her husband. 

Alaa is a 23-year-old married woman who has 1 family member from Al Russeifeh, Jordan. She is requesting a loan of 500 JD to pay for her home improvements.  She would like to buy electronics and some of household items.  In the future, she would like to increase her income.

Since Alaa is under 30 years old, her loan is considered a youth loan.

loans.use: pay for her home improvements

loans.name: Twimusyane United Group

texts.en: Joseph is a 31-year-old married man with six children aged between 14 and 6, living in Kagadi, Uganda.  He owns a piggery business and supplements his income with farming to be able to meet his family needs.  He is detrmined to change his life and those of his dependents for the better by sending his children to school and building a permanent house, as they are currently living under a mud-wattled house.  He is a member of the above mentioned group, where each member guarantees the others to access a loan.  Joseph's business plan is to own at least 400 pigs since their reproductive rate is high, and that is why he is requesting for this loan.

loans.use: buy pigs for his business

loans.name: Trivena S

texts.en: Trivena, 47, lives in Kakata.  She is a widow with three children, aged from 18 to 28.  All of her children are independent.  With the initial capital given to her by her children, she started in her business. She sells used clothes in the market.  She has been selling men trousers, ladies blouses, and ladies skirts for the past four years.   She makes a profit when she sells.   With the profit, she buys more goods and improves her life.  Trivena is requesting a loan to purchase more used clothes for her business. Her plan for the future is to become a big business woman.

loans.use: buy used clothes to resell

loans.name: Vugar

texts.en:
Vugar is 30 years old, married, and lives with his wife and little son. He has been working for five years in the transportation business. He has a taxi and provides service to his customers in the district where he lives. 

Vugar is asking for a loan of 700 AZN.  With the help of this loan he will buy the necessary construction materials to repair his house. In the future, his dream is to buy a new car that he can use for transport.
