Mamie is 29 years old and lives in Compound #3. She did not go to school. She is married and has three children between one and 14 years old. They live at home and two attend school. Her husband is a businessman. For the past eight years, she has been selling charcoal in her community. She says she likes how fast her business goes, but the problem she faces is the rainy season. 

She is requesting a loan to purchase charcoal for her business. Her plan is to build her warehouse and educate her children.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal for her business.

loans.name: Thiet

texts.en:
Thiet is requesting a new loan to buy sewing tools, sewing equipment and materials. Thiet's previous loan enabled her to expand her business and earn a higher income to support her family. 

She hopes that another loan will assist her to increase the size of her business, attract new customers and increase her sales. She also hopes that through the loan she can increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: To buy sewing tools, sewing equipment and materials.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy fertilisers and support labor costs for his maize production.

loans.name: Tim

texts.en: Tim would like to take another loan to buy materials to make better-quality bathing scrubs to sell from her shop. Tim's previous loan enabled her to increase her sales and earn a higher income to support her family. She hopes that another loan will assist her in increasing the size of her business, attracting new customers and increasing sales. She also hopes that through the loan she can increase her income and improve her family's living standards.

loans.use: To buy materials to make better-quality bathing scrubs.

loans.name: Nhung

texts.en: Nhung is requesting a new loan to buy a range of new products such as food and beverages to restock her general store. This purchase will help her to better meet the needs of her customers. Her previous loan enabled her to improve her business and offer her customers a greater variety of products. She hopes that her new loan will assist her in increasing the size of her store and her sales. It will also help her to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: To purchase a range of different products such as snack foods and beverages to stock her store.

loans.name: Huong

texts.en: Huong is requesting a new loan to buy a range of new products such as food and beverages to restock her general store. This purchase will help her to better meet the needs of her customers. Her previous loan enabled her to improve her business and offer her customers a greater variety of products. She hopes that her new loan will assist her in increasing the size of her store and her sales. It will also help her to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase rice, beverages and a range of products to stock her general store.

loans.name: Felix

texts.en:
Felix is 28 years old, married and has two children. He does crop farming to earn a living. He also does bee-keeping for extra income. Since he joined Faulu Kenya, he has been able to improve his business because he has been trained in business management skills.

Felix hopes to practice large-scale farming in five years. He has requested a loan of 40,000 KES to buy fertilizer and seedlings.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and seedlings.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy chicken feed.

loans.name: Oanh

texts.en:
Oanh is requesting a new loan to buy a range of new products, such as food and beverages, to restock her general store. This purchase will help her to better meet the needs of her customers. Her previous loan enabled her to improve her business and offer her customers a greater variety of products.

She hopes that her new loan will assist her to increase the size of her store and increase sales, and will also help her to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a range of new products, such as food and beverages, to restock her general store.

loans.name: Madinah

texts.en:
Madinah is 23 years old and lives in the town of Kayunga in the Mukono region of Uganda. She is single and has one child. For the past three years, Madinah has been working hard to manage her salon, which does hair dressing. 

To help expand her business, Madinah has requested a loan of 700,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more cosmetics like body lotions and hair extensions. It will help Madinah to generate greater profits and support her family with basic needs. Madinah hopes that in the future she will be able to build a commercial house. 

Madinah is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to purchase more cosmetics like body lotions and hair extenstions.

loans.name: Maybel

texts.en:
Maybel, age 22, lives in Kakata. She is single and has a 2-year-old child. She stopped her education in the sixth grade. She would like to give the best of education to her child, but she lacks financial support. 

For the past three years, Maybel has been selling peppers, rice, onions, tomatoes, Vita and palm oil in the market. She is very proud of her business because she feels independent. She makes a profit when she sells her goods. With the profit, she buys goods to increase the business and attend to the needs of her child.  

Maybel is requesting a loan to purchase more rice, onions, peppers, Vita and tomatoes for the business. Her plan is to give her child a higher level of education.

loans.use: to purchase more rice, onions, peppers, Vita and tomatoes for the  business.

loans.name: Rehema

texts.en:
Rehema is an enterprising woman who has been able to manage several businesses, including rental houses and a tailoring business. Now she has established a water-vending and juice-selling business. 

Rehema thanks Yehu and Kiva for the support she is receiving, this being her fourth loan from Yehu and second from Kiva. With the loan, she will be able to renovate rooms for her rental houses. Her dream is to be a well-known businesswoman.

loans.use: to renovate rooms for her rental houses.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy packaging materials like paper bags and cartons.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah lives in Compound #3. She is 49 years old, and did not go to school. She is married with three children between the ages of six and 28. One is living on her own, while the two younger ones are attending school and living at home.

She has been selling dried and fresh fish for five years now. She is requesting a loan to buy more dried and fresh fish for her business. She faced problems during the rainy season and her plan is to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more dried and fresh fish for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more fertilisers and support labor costs of her maize production.

loans.name: Zipporah

texts.en:
Zipporah is 29 years old, married and has four children. She is very talented in crafts and she uses the skill to make hand bags, bangles and necklaces to earn a living. She has been earning a living from this business for four years. She employs three people in the business.

Zipporah hopes to expand the business in the future so as to generate more income. She has requested a loan of 20,000 KES to buy beads, fabric and thread.

loans.use: To buy materials such as beads, fabric and thread.

loans.name: Sara

texts.en:
Sara lives in Kilifi area of Coast province, Kenya. She is married and has five children; two of whom are in school. She owns a green grocer which she has been operating for three years. In this business, Sara sells greens, flour, cooking oil etc. 

Sara learnt about Milango through a friend and joined with an aim of accessing credit to improve the business operations. The challenges she is facing are price fluctuation and inflation, purchasing stock and seasonal weather. 

Sara is applying for a loan of 21,100 Kenya shillings to buy vegetables and tomatoes wholesale. The extra income from the loan will be added to her savings to expand the business. Her plans for the future are to expand to a wholesale grocery and a supplier.

loans.use: To buy vegetables and tomatoes wholesale.

loans.name: Jean

texts.en:
Jean is 38 years old. He is married to a farmer. He has been a maize farmer for 10 years. He will use his Kiva loan to support labor costs and fertilizer purchases during maize production. He needs to buy fertilizer in order to increase his production. With profits from his farming, he wishes to invest in his business, so that in the future he can acquire machines like tractors that will enhance his farming capacity.

The photo, taken recently at another maize farming plantation, shows him very happy and excited that previous season was very helpful for both family needs and business. 

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy fertilisers and support labor costs during maize production.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.es:
Ruth tiene 47 años y tiene 21 años de experiencia en su  negocio de confecciones, su idea de negocio nació cuando aprendió con su tío este oficio hace 21 años;  después de eso trabajó en una recicladora durante 9 años y una vez se quedo sin empleo y con la liquidación, compró tres máquinas y no conforme con ello, decidió  tecnificar su trabajo, para lo cual empezó a estudiar en el Servivcio Nacional de Aprendizaje, escalado y patronaje; En la actualidad sus principales productos son  las bermudas, jeans, ropa deportiva, los cuales  vende a  clientes particulares, vecinos; en su taller se desarrollan todas las operaciones del oficio es decir  corte, costura, acabado, planchado, empacado, vendiéndolo a crédito, y diariamente; sus compras las realiza de contado en almacenes de tela en el centro de la ciudad  de Barranquilla. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer finaciamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el cual comprará telas, hilos, botones, cierres, y accesorios en general, para la confección, así mejorará su negocio con esta inversión, porque logrará cumplir con los pedidos con los cuales fabricará  ropa de damas, caballeros e infantil, porque necesita  mantener existencia de productos  para la temporada de amor y amistad,que se acerca y en la cual impactará a su clientela.  
La inversión de su credikiva, mejorará su respuesta a los pedidos  y aumentará su volumen de ventas; su meta  mas adelante es tener un punto de venta y adquirir un lote propio, para construir su vivienda, pero su desafío  para el logro de su propósito es la falta de capital para invertir.


invertiría su crédito en ropa de dama, caballero y niño, telas hilos, botones, cierres, y accesorios en general para la confección
texts.en:
Ruth is 47 years old and she has 21 years experience in her dressmaking business. The idea for her business was born when she learned this skill with her uncle 21 years ago. After this she worked in a recycling company for 9 years and when she was left unemployed, she used her severance pay to purchase three machines but she wasn’t satisfied with that. She then decided to make her work more technical so she began to study scales and patterns at The National Learning Service. At the moment her main products are Bermuda shorts, jeans and sports clothes which she sells to private customers and neighbors. She carries out all the activities of her trade in her workshop, such as cutting, sewing, finishing, ironing and packing and she sells everyday on credit. She makes her purchases in cash in fabric stores in Barranquilla city center. She is currently applying for a credikiva (her first with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo) with which she will purchase fabric, threads, buttons, zips and general accessories for dressmaking. This investment will help her to improve her business because she will be able to fulfill her orders and manufacture women’s, men’s and children’s clothes. She needs to maintain stock for Love and Friendship day which is upcoming and will impact her customer base. Her credikiva investment will improve her response to orders and increase her sales. Her future goal is to have a sales outlet and to purchase her own lot to build her house but the lack of money to invest in it presents her with a challenge.

She will invest her loan in women’s, men’s and children’s clothes, fabric, thread, buttons, zips and general dressmaking accessories.

loans.use: to purchase women’s, men’s and children’s clothes, fabric, thread, buttons, zips and general dressmaking accessories.

loans.name: Onide Roberto

texts.es:
ONIDE ROBERTO tiene 46 años de edad de estado civil unión libre tiene 6 hijos, vive con la esposa y con los hijos en la ciudad de Ventanas Provincia de los ríos.

Es integrante de la  Ventanilla Bendición de Dios se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto Rancho Grande de la parroquia Puerto Pechiche, se dedican a labores Agrícolas y Pecuarias.

ONIDE ROBERTO se dedica la siembra de maíz y arroz, además se dedica a la crianza de animales. Solicita el crédito para comprar ranger, urea, insecticidas, fertilizantes, abonos orgánicos. 

Con la yuda del crédito podrá comprar lo necesario para trabajar en los cultivos. Las compras las realizará en la ciudad de ventanas. El sueño es poder comprar una finca para tener seguro donde trabajar.

Los desafíos a los que se enfrenta son las plagas cómo el cogollero  y el ratón. En el tiempo libre le gusta jugar pelota.
texts.en:
ONIDE ROBERTO is 46 years old and in a common law marriage. He has 6 children and lives with his wife and children in the city of Ventanas, province of Los Ríos.

He is a member of the Bendición de Dios communal bank. It is located in the community of Rancho Grande of the Puerto Pechiche priah. They work in farming and fishing.

ONIDE ROBERTO grows corn and rice and raises animals. He is asking for the loan to buy herbicides, urea, insecticide, and fertilizers.With the help of the loan, he can buy what he needs to work on the crops. He will make thepurchases in the city of Ventanas. His dream is to be able to buy a farm to have a stable place to work. 

The challenges he faces are pests, such as budworm and mice. In his free time, he likes to play ball.

loans.use: to buy herbicide, urea, insecticides, and fertilizers.

loans.name: Ana

texts.es:
La señora Ana tiene 44 años, es viuda desde hace un tiempo, tiene tres hijos y vive en la ciudad de Encarnación. La señora Ana es comerciante desde hace varios años, tiene un local en el Circuito Comercial de la ciudad de Encarnación en donde comercializa relojes, ropas, bijouteries y otros artículos. Además tiene habitaciones en alquiler en su casa lo que le ayuda con otros ingresos. Gracias a estas actividades ella ha podido salir adelante, mantener su hogar y solventar cualquier gasto imprevisto.
La señora ha solicitado este crédito para la compra de relojes, ropas, bijouteries y otros con lo que podrá surtir su local y de esa forma atraer a más clientes. Agradece por la oportunidad que está recibiendo, pues le será de mucha ayuda.
texts.en:
Ana is 44 years old. She has been a widow for some time. She has three children and lives in the city of  Encarnación. Ana has been a merchant for several years. She has a locale in the commercial area of the city of Encarnación where she sells watches, clothes, jewelry and other items. She also rents out rooms in her house, which brings in more income. Thanks to these activities, she has been able to get ahead, support her home and pay for any unexpected expenses.

She has asked for this loan to by watches, clothes, jewelry and more to stock her locale and in this way attract more customers. She is grateful for this opportunity she is being given, because it will really be helpful to her.

loans.use: to buy watches, jewelry and more.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah is 21 years old and lives in the town of Kayunga in the Mukono region of Uganda. She is single and has 2 children who are both currently in school. For the past 3 years, Sarah has been working hard to manage her small business, which sells dry fish. 

To help expand her business, Sarah has requested a loan of 400,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more fish for resale, and will help Sarah to generate greater profits and pay for her children's school. Sarah hopes that in the future she will be able to build a commercial house. 

Sarah is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy more fish for resale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase shavers and other business equipment.

loans.name: Edgardo

texts.es: Con su anterior credikiva Edgardo compró materias primas e insumos como cuero, capelladas, adornos con los cuales fabricó nuevos diseños de calzados que vendió oportunamente En la actualidad está aplicando a un nuevo credikiva, pues investigó que en la ciudad de Bucaramanga, caracterizada por la calidaden calzados y productos de cuero, estan los mejores proveedores de pedreria y cuero, pero requiere tener mas capital de trabajo para comprar todos los insumos y materiales que requiere para mejorar aun mas su acabado. Esta es justamente la razón por la cual acude a un creidkiva, inversión que resultará exitosa en el marco de que con ella potencializará un mercado menos doméstico, con el que  proyecta  el ncremento de sus ventas , especialmente para el segundo semestre del año, donde usualmente ocurren los picos de incremento.
texts.en: Edgardo used his previous Kiva loan to buy raw materials and supplies such as leather, shoe uppers and decorative materials with which he made new footwear designs that he duly sold.  He is currently applying for a new Kiva loan as he has found the best suppliers of decorative stones and leather in Bucaramanga, a city known for the quality of its footwear and leather products, but needs more working capital in order to be able to buy all the supplies and materials that he needs to further improve the quality of his goods.  This is why he is applying for a Kiva loan.  His investment will be successful as he will be able to use it to boost sales to a wider market.  He plans to increase his sales, especially during the second half of the year which is usually his peak sales period.

loans.use: to buy decorative stones and leather

loans.name: Maria De Lourdes

texts.es:
María  tiene 42 años es soltera no tiene hijos. La familia de María siempre  han incursionado en el negocio de las ventas de comidas. María ha sido dedicada desde muy pequeña para tener sus propias cosas por eso ella comenzo con su propio negocio de venta de comida. 

Comenzando a trabajar con su familia, empezó  ahorrar dinero con la idea de algún día instalar su propio negocio entonces se le presento la oportunidad de tener su negocio ahora ya tiene 2 años que se independizo y le va muy bien en su restaurante. 

El trabajo lo hace sola y el horario es de 9:00 am 11 pm. Con el prestamo quiere comprar pollos y herramientas para cocinar. 
Su Meta de María es tener su restaurante ella desea darle lo mejor a su familia.
texts.en:
María is 42 years old, single, and doesn't have any children.  Her family have always been in the food business.  María has been in this line of work since she was very young.  She started her own food business so that she could have her own things.

María started working with her family and saved money so that she could one day open her own business.  Then, the opportunity to own her own business presented itself.  She has been working for herself for two years and her restaurant is doing very well.

María works alone, from 9.00am to 11.00pm.  She would like to use this loan to buy chickens and cooking utensils.  Her goal is to keep running her restaurant.  She would like to provide her family with the best.

loans.use: to buy chickens and cooking utensils

loans.name: Landouard

texts.en:
Landouard is 48 years old, married, and has eight children. He has been a maize farmer for 20 years. He is requesting a loan, which he will use to support labor costs and to purchase fertilizer during maize production. He needs the fertilizer in order to increase his production. With profits from his farming he plans to invest in his business so that in the future he can acquire farm machinery that will enhance his farming capacity.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and to support labor costs during maize production.

loans.name: Mariano

texts.es: El Sr. Mariano es casado y padre de dos hijos que aun dependen económicamente de el uno de ellos estudia la educación secundaria y el otro la media superior ambos en  escuelas públicas de la localidad, el trabaja como encargado de una carnicería desde hace casi cinco años y con ese trabaja poco a poco ha ido construyendo un patrimonio para él y su familia la casa que ellos habitan ha ido sufriendo deterioros con el tiempo y quiere enjarrar su casa por fuera y pintarla es por ello que solicita el apoyo para la remodelación de su vivienda.
texts.en: Mariano is married and the father of two children who are still financially dependent on him.  One is attending a local public middle school and the other is in high school.  Mariano has been working as a manager in a butcher's shop for five years.  Through his work, he has gradually been building wealth for himself and his family.  The house in which they live has been deteriorating over time and he would like to plaster and paint the outside.  He is requesting support to fix up his house.

loans.use: to plaster and paint his house

loans.name: Hector Manuel

texts.es: El Sr. Héctor es casado y vive en una casa de interés social desde hace 12 años y trabaja como vendedor de periódico en  una avenida principal de la localidad el tiene ya casi nueve años dedicando a esta actividad y siempre se ha preocupado por tener un patrimonio seguro y cálido para cuando él y su esposa lleguen a la vejez; el tiene un sueño y por el cual está solicitando el apoyo: quiere ampliar la sala de su casa quitando la pared de un cuarto y pódelo hacer sala; él se ve en unos 15 años sentado en su sala leyendo el periódico y sus nietos corriendo por ella.
texts.en: Héctor is married and has been living in a government-subsidized house for 12 years.  He works as a newspaper seller in one of the main avenues in his town.  He has been in this job for nearly nine years and has always worked hard to build up a secure nest egg for when he and his wife reach old age.  He has a dream for which he is requesting this loan.  He would like to extend his living room, getting rid of a wall.  Héctor sees himself in 15 years time, sitting in his living room, reading the newspaper, with his grandchildren running around him.

loans.use: to extend his living room

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther, 36, is living together with her friend and three children at Kakata. The children are between the ages of 5 and 18.  

She has a cook shop (restaurant) where she has been selling food for the past five years. She prepares different kinds of dishes every day. She sells six days a week. Her favorite dishes that pull customers to her shop are cassava leaves, fufu and soup. Because of the good service that she renders to her customers, her sales increase every day. 

She is requesting a loan to purchase more ingredients for the cook shop. Her plan for the future is to build a house for her children.

loans.use: to purchase more ingredients for her restaurant.

loans.name: Tatia Daniela

texts.es: Tatia, de 22 años de edad, soltera, estudiante universitaria, habitante de la ciudad de Esteli. Se dedica a alquilar nintendo y juegos de video desde hace tres años. Ella empezó con un televisor y un play station , poco a poco fue agregando más juegos , la mayoría de sus clientes son jóvenes , quienes son los que la retroalimenta acerca de los juegos más recientes y que están de moda. La sala de su casa siempre está llena de jóvenes que muy concentrados llegan a instalarse a jugar y distraerse de forma sana . Ahora dice que necesita  mantenerse actualizada para no perder la calidad de su negocio y es por ello que requiere un préstamo para comprar 2 play station , televisor y un Xbox 360. Pues su meta es lograr obtener ingresos para pagar estudios universitarios y ampliar su negocio de alquiler de nintendo y video juegos.
texts.en: Tatia is 22 years old and single.  She is a university student and lives in the city of Estelí.  She charges people to play Nintendo and other video games.  She has been in this business for three years.  Tatia started out with one television set and one PlayStation and gradually added more and more games.  Most of her customers are young people who provide her with feedback about the latest, popular games.  Her living room is always full of young people engrossed in playing games and entertaining themselves in a healthy way.  Tatia says that she needs to keep up-to-date so that she can keep providing a good-quality service.  For this reason, she needs a loan to buy two PlayStations, a television set and an XBox 360.  Her goal is to make enough income to  pay for her university studies and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy two PlayStations, a television set and an XBox 360

loans.name: Yevgen

texts.ru: Евгений уже брал несколько кредитов в КИВЕ. Со времен последнего он сыграл свадьбу сына, улучшил свои жилищные условия. Евгений просит предостваить ему кредит в сумме 5000 гривен на закупку нового товара - кастрюль, сковородок, ведер, пр. Он хочет увеличить ассортимент и тем самым увеличить прибыль.
texts.en: Yevgen has already taken out several Kiva loans. Since his last loan, he has made home improvements and hosted his son's wedding. Yevgen is now seeking a loan of 5,000 Ukrainian Hryvnia (UAH) to buy new goods for his shop: saucepans, frying pans, buckets, and so on. He wants to widen the range of products he sells, thereby increasing his profit.

loans.use: to buy new inventory: saucepans, frying pans, buckets, and so on

loans.name: Mutiso

texts.en:
Mutiso is 69 years old, married and has three adult children.  

He does farming. He grows sugarcane and pawpaws. He has been farming for over 20 years. He also earns extra income from his barber shop.  

Since he joined Faulu Kenya, he has become more financially stable. This is because he has been trained on financial management.

Mutiso hopes to practice large-scale farming in the future. He has requested 15,000 KES to buy fertilizer.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer.

loans.name: Madeleine

texts.en:
Madeleine, 37, is married to a farmer. She has been a maize farmer for 12 years. She will use her Kiva loan to support labor costs and buy fertilizer during maize production: She needs to buy fertilizer in order to increase her production. With profits from her farming, she wishes to invest in her business so that in the future she can acquire machines like tractors that will enhance her farming capacity.

The photo was taken recently at a previous maize farming plantation. Madeleine was very happy and excited that the previous season was very helpful for both her family needs and her business. 

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizers and support labor costs during maize production.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy spokes, roller bearings, bicycle hubs, etc.

loans.name: Maria Del Socorro

texts.es: María , de 59 años de edad , es dueña de una pulpería la cual tiene en su casa, habita en Estelí. Su experiencia en el mundo del comercio la adquirió hace más de 20 años . Ella vio la necesidad en su comunidad de poner una pulpería donde se vendiera desde productos comestibles hasta productos de limpieza por unidad. Ella junto con su esposo trabajan en la pulpería pues sus dos hijos ya son mayores de edad y viven aparte. Ella solicita el crédito para comprar granos básicos, gaseosas, pan, huevo, leche , aceite, sopas, enlatados. Su meta es lograr mantener surtida pulpería con productos de mayor demanda y que le permitan obtener buenos ingresos.
texts.en:
María, 59, owns a grocery store in her house.  She lives in Estelí.  She got her experience in the business world more than 20 years ago.  She saw the need in her community to set up a retail store to sell everything from food products to cleaning products.  She and her husband work in the store because their children are already adults and live on their own.

She's requesting the loan to buy basic necessities, soda, bread, eggs, milk, oil, soup, and canned goods.

Her goal is to keep her store stocked with products in the highest demand and that will give her good income.

loans.use: to buy basic necessities, soda, bread, eggs, milk, oil, soup, and canned goods

loans.name: Erastus

texts.en:
Erastus is a 33-year-old married man. He has three children with ages ranging from 2 years to 6 years. He describes himself as an aggressive man. 

He operates a motorcycle with which he provides transportation services to customers. He has been involved in this business for six years. His business is located at a potential business area. He describes his biggest business challenge as stiff competition within the area. 

He will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy vegetables and fruits for resale for starting a new business of a grocery store. 

His business goal is to own three more motorcycles for increasing the modes of transportation for customers within five years. He hopes that, in the future, he will build a house for his family with profits generated from the business. This is his first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy vegetables and fruits for starting a new grocery retail business.

loans.name: Boniface

texts.en:
Boniface is a 49-year-old boda boda (motorcycle) operator in Mombasa. He is a married father of five children. He has done this business for the last 15 years. His business is doing great. 

This marks his first borrowing from KADET Ltd. to finance his business. He plans to purchase spare parts to service his motorcycle. 

He will use the anticipated profits to buy an additional motorcycle and use the rest of the profits to repay his loan. He hopes to become successful in his business.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts to service his motorcycle.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is now 58 years old and has three grown children. She is separated from her husband. 

She works hard and strives harder to provides her family needs. As a way of gaining income, she manages her farm lot by planting rice and vegetables for sale. She also owns and manages a variety store in the village to generate additional income. 

Because she is a hardworking mother, most of her children earned degrees and have stable jobs. Despite this, she aims to continue and improve her variety store to earn a higher income and save for their future. 

To improve the business, she is asking for additional capital of PHP 25,000 to buy canned goods, noodles, eggs, snack foods, soaps, candies, beverages and soft drinks to sell. She is hoping that this financial assistance will help her to improve the business and that she will become successful in the future.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, noodles, eggs, snack foods, soaps, candies, beverages and soft drinks to sell.

loans.name: Viateur

texts.en:
Viateur is 36 years old. He is married to a farmer. He has been a maize farmer for 10 years. 

He will use the Kiva loan to support labor costs and buy fertilizer during maize production: He needs to buy fertilizer in order to increase his production. With profits from his farming, he wishes to invest in his business so that in the future he can acquire machines like tractors that will enhance his farming capacity.

The photo was taken recently at a previous maize farming plantation. Viateur was very happy and excited that the previous season was very helpful for both his family needs and his business. 

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizers and pay for labor costs during maize production.

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet is applying for her second loan of KES 10,000 from KADET Ltd. after servicing her previous loan well and in good time. 

She plans to buy weaves, a dryer and cosmetics. She will use the anticipated profit to refinance the business. 

Otherwise, her business is doing well with great improvement. She hopes to be financially stable.

loans.use: To buy a dryer, weaves, and cosmetics

loans.name: Vladimir

texts.ru: Владимир занимается торговлей спортивной одежды. Как обычно он старается иметь большой ассортимент товара, чтобы привлечь покупателя к себе. Владимир хочет закупить осенние спортивные костюмы. Большую часть прибыли планирует вложить в бизнес. Также Владимир помогает своим детям финансово.
texts.en: Vladimir sells sportswear. As usual, he is trying to get a large variety of goods in order to attract customers, and he now wants to buy sportswear for autumn. Vladimir plans to reinvest the majority of the profit generated back into his business, and to help his children out financially.

loans.use: to buy sportswear for autumn

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence is a 36-year-old salon owner in Mombasa. She is the widowed mother of two children, age 14 and 12. She has been running her business for the past five years successfully.

This marks her second loan from KADET Ltd. to finance her business. She plans to purchase new blow driers, hair tongs, hair foods, hair chemicals and hair rollers. She will use the anticipated profits to repay her loan and open another salon. 

She hopes to have a more profitable business.

loans.use: to purchase new blow driers, hair tongs, hair foods, hair chemicals and hair rollers.

loans.name: Alhayah /ahla Group

texts.en:
This group is called Alhayah/Ahla and consists of four members who are all women. All of them are friends from Sana`a, Yemen. The group took a loan of 290,000 YER. 

Laila is the leader of their group. She is 48 years old, married, has four children and lives in Sana`a, Yemen. Her main business is selling ladies' fabrics, incenses and perfumes. She has been in business for ten years. With years of experience to her credit, she now has a good command of her activity. 

She is taking a loan of 80,000 YER from AMB and intends to use her loan to better develop her business by purchasing incense and perfumes to increase her profits. Her profits will allow her to help meet her family’s needs. In the future, she would like to have a big center to sell products such as incense, perfumes and different clothes.

loans.use: to purchase incense and perfumes for her business.

loans.name: Ana Antonia

texts.es:
Ana empezó desde que estaba en el colegio con su negocio ya que siempre de niña le ayudaba a su mama a coser y desde ahí aprendio a confeccionar ropa. Hasta la actualidad que ingreso a un curso para aprender a confeccionar ropa de todo tipo y asi seguir adelante. En la actualidad su trabajo lo hace con ayuda de su mama.

No tiene ninguna dificultad en su pequeño negocio. Tiene muchas aspiraciones por eso quiere el prestamo para comprar telas y una maquina de coser. Unas de sus metas es obtener su propio taller y boutique de moda donde ella se la diseñadora para poder ayudar a su familia los mejores comodidades.
texts.en:
Ana began her business when she was in high school.  When she was a little girl she always helped her mother sew, and from there she learned to make clothing, up to the present when she registered for a course to learn to make all types of clothing so she can move forward.

Currently she does her job with her mother's help.  She has no problems in her small business.

She has a lot of goals, so she wants the loan to buy fabric and a sewing machine.  One of her goals is to get her own shop and fashion boutique and be the designer so she can help her family to have the best comforts.

loans.use: to buy fabric and a sewing machine

loans.name: Nigina

texts.ru: Нигина жительница Гиссарского района. Ей 36 лет. Нигина у себя дома занимается торговлей. Она во дворе открыла ларек, где продает продукты, одежду, парфюмерию и хозяйственные товары. У нее смешанный ассортимент товара. Торговлей Нигина занимается шесть лет. Она берет кредит для увеличения оборота.
texts.en: Nigina lives in the Gissar region. She is 36 years old, and she has been in trade for 6 years. Nigina sells goods from her home where she has opened a kiosk in the yard. She sells a mixed range of products: food items, clothing, perfumes and household goods. Nigana is now seeking a loan in order to increase her turnover.

loans.use: to buy food items and household goods

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy chemical fertilizers

loans.name: Maysara

texts.ru: Майсара проживает в городе Истаравшан. Ей 47 лет. Она замужем. У нее трое детей. Ее муж занимается растениеводством. Сама Майсара занимается животноводством. Она на протяжении 20 лет зарабатывает путем разведения крупнорогатого скота. Майсара в основном разводит крупнорогатый скот у себя дома. Она берет кредит для закупа телят.
texts.en: Maysara lives in Istaravshan. She is 47 years old, married, and has 3 children. Her husband grows crops, and Maysara is involved in animal husbandry. For the last 20 years she has been earning a living by breeding cattle. For the most part, she raises cattle at home. Maysara is now seeking a loan in order to buy calves.

loans.use: to buy calves

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David is 63 years old and married. Together they are blessed with four school-going children. David has been earning a monthly income of 13,000 KES from his farming business for the past 3 years.

He has applied for his second loan of 30,000 KES from KADET LTD, which he intends to use for purchasing farm inputs such as fertilizer, seeds and labor to increase production. He will use the anticipated profit to purchase a dairy cow so as to increase the milk production.

David's future hopes and dreams are to have a stable business and a happy family.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs such as fertilizer, seeds and labor to increase production.

loans.name: Mwanaisha

texts.en: Mwanaisha is a woman of high integrity, a mother of four. Previously, she used to live in a rental house but thanks to her efforts, she now has her own home. Mwanaisha has been operating a vegetable stall for a long time and during this period, she was also able to start a food stall. She is a very hardworking person who very much wants to get ahead. She is currently asking for a loan to purchase ingredients like wheat flour and corn flour, and also to repair tables and chairs in her stall. She hopes to own even more businesses in future.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients like wheat flour, corn flour and also repair tables and chairs in her stall.

loans.name: Lynatte

texts.en:
Lynatte is a 37-year-old food stall owner in Mombasa. She is married. She has been selling food for the past 5 years.

This marks her first business loan from KADET LTD to finance her business. She plans to purchase a variety of food stuffs, new chairs, tables and serving dishes. Lynatte will use the anticipated profits to repay her loan and also in the expansion of her business. She hopes to excel in the business.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of food stuffs, new chairs, tables and serving dishes

loans.name: Danson

texts.en:
Danson is 29 years old and single.  He is a cereals shop owner in Mombasa, which he has been doing for three years. 

Danson is requesting his third loan from KADET LTD, which he will use to purchase more maize, beans, and cow peas to sell to his customers. He will use the anticipated profits to reinvest in his business and repay his loan. He hopes to prosper in business and in life.

loans.use: to purchase maize, beans and cow peas to sell.

loans.name: Abeer/ Haziaz Group

texts.en:
The four members of the Abeer/Haziaz group are mainly married women. All of them live a working class neighborhood in Sana`a, Yemen. Their community is in a rural area surrounded by the fields with the clothes markets. 

The whole group requested a loan for 160,000 YER. Sadiah is 49 years old and the coordinator of her group. She has operated a business selling fabrics and perfumes for one year. She will use her loan to purchase some clothing to sell to women. Saidiah`s most important challenges are to work hard to gain extra income and to better her business structure. She is receiving a loan of 40,000 YER from AMB and, because her loan repayments have all been made punctually, she has been able to expand her business with the reinvestment she makes from each loan.

loans.use: to purchase clothing for her business.

loans.name: Tania Olimpia

texts.es:
Tania, es una joven de 24 años de edad, habitante de la ciudad de Estelí, madre de dos hijos de 3 y 11 años de edad. Ella es dueña de un pequeño salón de belleza, antes se dedicaba a la venta de ropa  usada, luego le ofrecieron trabajo en un salón de belleza, fue ahí donde adquirió experiencia, le surgió la idea de emprender su propio salón de belleza. Hoy en día tiene 1 año de tener su propio salón, el cual atiende todos los días, donde realiza cortes, tinte, vende productos de belleza. Ella se está preparando para los meses en donde tiene bastante movimiento su salón, pues son los meses donde atiende eventos de 15 años, bodas, graduaciones pues la mayoría de sus clientes la solicitan tanto en su salón como a domicilio.
Ella requiere el préstamo para comprar shampo, maquillaje, tintes, cepillos, plancha para cabello, acondicionadores para cabello. Esto le será de mucho beneficio para su negocio pues podrá tener material de trabajo para brindar un mejor servicio a sus clientas pues la mayoría son mujeres. Sus sueños lograr ampliar su salón de belleza, poner un local en el centro de la ciudad y especializarse en técnicas de belleza más modernas.
texts.en:
Tania is a young woman of 24 years of age who lives in the city of Estelí. She is the mother of two children who are 3 and 11 years old. 

She is also the owner of a small beauty salon. Previously, she sold second-hand clothes. Later, she was offered work in a beauty salon where she gained more experience.  She then had the idea to open her own beauty salon.  She has had her own salon for one year now and works there every day. Here, she cuts and dyes hair and sells beauty products. 

Tania is currently preparing for two busy months in which she has a lot of turnover in her salon. This is because these are the months with most Quinceañeras, weddings, and graduations. Many of her clients visit her both in her salon and at home. 

Tania needs this loan to buy shampoo, make-up, dyes, brushes, hair irons, and conditioner. This will benefit her shop a lot because she would have the material to offer better service to her clients which are mostly women. 

Her dreams are to be able to expand her beauty salon, to put a shop in the city center and to specialize in more modern beauty techniques.

loans.use: to purchase shampoo, make-up, dyes, brushes, hair irons, and conditioner.

loans.name: Boniface

texts.en:
Boniface is 43 years old, married and has been a maize farmer for 20 years. He will use the Kiva loan to cover labor costs and to buy fertilizer during maize production: He needs fertilizer to increase his production. With profits from his farming he wishes to invest in his business so that in the future he can acquire machines, like tractors, that will enhance his farming capacity.

In the photo, Boniface posed with dried maize plants. He was very happy to share with us the information about his business and excited that previous season was very productive for both family needs and business. The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and pay for labor during maize production.

loans.name: Mujeres Unidas Group

texts.es:
Mujeres unidas están en el tercer ciclo gracias al trabajo en conjunto de todas ellas. Son mujeres jefas de familia que desean ayudar a sus hijos a tener un mejor estilo de vida al que ellas tuvieron.
Una de las integrantes del grupo es la Sra. Rosalina ella tiene 5hijos  está casada  con el Sr. Heriberto y ella se dedica hace varios años a la venta de ropas. Cuenta la Sra. Rosalina que el crédito que solicita de la Fundación y de kiva  lo utilizará para la compra de prendas de vestir y  vender a sus clientes,  ella se encuentra  muy agradecida ya que gracias a él crédito podrá mejorar sus ingresos y el de su familia.
texts.en:
Mujeres unidas are in their third (lending) cycle thanks to their joint team effort.

They are female family heads who wish to help their children have better living conditions than they had. 

One of the group members is Rosalina who has five children and is married to Heriberto. She has been making a living by selling clothes for many years now. Rosalina says that the loan they are asking for from Fundación and Kica will be used to purchase clothing to sell to their customers. She is very grateful because she will be able to increase her and her family’s income thanks to the loan.

loans.use: to purchase clothing for sale.

loans.name: Tavai Group

texts.es:
Las 10 integrantes del grupo Tavai son de la ciudad de Caacupé, todas cuentan con actividades comerciales variadas, cada una de ellas se esfuerza para el sustento de sus familias.
Francisca vende comestibles, y cuenta que tiene buena clientela que siempre compra de ella sus comidas. Tiene todo tipo de comidas, como ser empanadas, sándwich, croquetas y demás. Su meta es poder tener el día de mañana un local grande donde poder tener los productos para vender.
Solicita esta ayuda para la compra de los insumos que necesita para la elaboración de sus alimentos, como ser carnes, pollo, verduras, condimentos y demás.
texts.en:
The ten member of the Tavai group are from the city of Caacupé. They all pursue their different commercial activities, each one of them striving to support their families. 

Francisca sells food and she says that she has very good customers who always buy their food from her. She has all sorts of food from empanadas to sandwiches, croquettes and more. Her goal is to have a big shop one day where she could sell her products. 

She is asking for support to purchase the necessary ingredients for the production of her food such as meat, chicken, vegetables, spices and others.

loans.use: to purchase meat, chicken, vegetables, spices and others.

loans.name: Robert

texts.en:
Robert is 38 years old and a landlord in Kilifi. He is married to Teresia and they are blessed with four children ages 8, 6, 4 and 3. He has been operating rental houses for the past seven years and he is doing great. 

This is Robert’s second loan from KADET LTD, and he plans to install electricity and paint his newly built rental houses. He will use the anticipated profits to build more houses to rent. 

He hopes to have a happy and prosperous family.

loans.use: to install electricity and paint his newly built rental houses.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.es:
La señora Elizabeth  es habitante de la ciudad de Estelí, de 38 años de edad, de oficio comerciante se dedica  a la costura y atiende una pulpería. Es madre soltera, tiene 3 hijos de 19,10 y 1 año respectivamente. Comenzó vendiendo ropa y zapatos sus primeras venta fue en la  montaña de donde eran la mayoría de sus clientes, ella se iba los días de pago pues la mayoría de su mercadería la vendía al contado, con  las ganancias fue ahorrando y logro comprar su casa sencilla y humilde pero con mucho esfuerzo y sacrificio logro obtener un techo para sus hijos. Después decidió poner una pulpería, sus primeros productos de ventas fueron refrescos, galletas, dulces y después fue agregando más variedad y de esta manera logro establecer su pulpería. 
Ella combina sus labores de madre con los de una mujer emprendedora, su hijo mayor  la ayuda a atender el negocio. Ella requiere el préstamo para comprar granos básicos, aceite, frijoles, azúcar, papel de baño, jabones, detergentes, avena, condimentos, pan, enlatados.
Esta inversión le ayudara a surtir su negocio de más productos que son de mucha necesidad en su comunidad. Sus planes futuros es darles a sus hijos una buena educación y su meta próxima es ampliar su pulpería con más y mejores productos.
texts.en:
Elizabeth lives in the city of Estelí. She is 38 years old and is a shopkeeper by trade. She works as a sewer and attends to a small shop. She is a single mother of three children aged 19, 10 and 1 year respectively. 

She started out selling clothes and shoes and her first sales where in the mountains where the majority of her clients were. She left on paydays because most of the merchandise was sold for cash. With the earnings she saved she was able to buy a basic and humble house. But thanks to the effort and sacrifices she made, she was able to provide a roof over her children’s heads. 

After that, she decided to open a small grocery shop. The shop’s first products were soft drinks, cookies and sweets. Later she added more variety and in this way managed to establish her shop. 

Elizabeth combines her duties as a mother with those of a working woman. Her oldest child helps with looking after the shop. 

She needs this loan to purchase stable grains, oil, beans, sugar, toilet paper, soaps, detergents, oat grains, spices, bread and canned goods. 
This investment will help her to stock up her shop with more products that are very sought after in her community. 

Her planes for the future are to provide a quality education to her children and her next goal is to enlarge her shop with more and better products.

loans.use: to purchase stable grains, oil, beans, sugar, toilet paper, soaps, detergents, oat grains, spices, bread and canned goods.

loans.name: Gladys

texts.es: Gladys de 29 años es casada y vive con su esposo y su dos hijos en una casa de interés social  trabaja desde hace casi diez años  en una maquiladora de la localidad de seis de la mañana a cuatro de la tarde; su esposo es discapacitado y trabaja como empacador en un centro comercial desde hace cinco años. Gladys y su esposo han ido construyendo un patrimonio a base de mucho esfuerzo y sacrificio su casa y solicita el apoyo para levantar la barde de su casa y de esta manera poder brindar a sus hijos un patrimonio seguro.
texts.en:
Gladys, who is 29 years old, is married and lives with her husband and their two children in social housing. 

For almost 10 years now, she has been working in a local assembly plant from six in the morning until four in the afternoon. Her husband is disabled and has been working as a bagger in a shopping center. 

Thanks to their great effort and sacrifices, Gladys and her husband have been able to build a house. They are asking for help to build a fence around their home to provide a safe environment for their children in this way.

loans.use: to build a fence around their house.

loans.name: Jose Leonel

texts.es: El joven Jose , de 23 años de edad, es originario de Esteli , de oficio barbero, tiene un hijos de 2 años de edad. El empezó con este oficio a la edad de 16 años de edad , sus primeros clientes fueron los chicos de su barrio , el solo tenía una silla de plástico la cual ponía en el patio de su casa que es en donde cortaba cabello, con el tiempo fue adquiriendo más experiencia y clientes. Fue ahorrando de poco en poco hasta lograr poner su barbería. Está requiriendo el préstamo para comprar un tocador para su barbería , comprar navajas para afeitar, toallas, cremas de afeitar, talco, aceite para cabello. El se considera una persona que  le gusta salir adelante, desea poner otra barbería  contratar a jóvenes que como el quieran aprender de este negocio . Otro de sus proyectos es vender vehículos usados para conseguir otros ingresos y mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
José, 23, is from Estelí.  He's a barber by trade and has a two-year-old child.  He began in this business at the age of 16.  His first customers were the neighborhood children.  He had only a plastic chair set up on the patio of his house where he cut hair.  In time he acquired more experience and customers.  He saved little by little until he managed to set up his barber shop.

He needs the loan to buy a dressing table for his barber shop, razors, towels, shaving cream, talcum powder, and hair oil.

He's a person who likes to get ahead.  He wants to set up another barber shop to hire young people who, like him, want to learn this business.  Another of his projects is to sell used cars to get additional income and improve his family's quality of life.

loans.use: to buy a dressing table, razors, towels, shaving cream, talcum, and hair oil

loans.name: Kennedy

texts.en:
Kennedy is 34 years old and is a retail shop proprietor in Kisauni, Mombasa. He is married to Sarah and they are blessed with a 9-year-old child. He has been running his shop business for the past three years with great success. 

This is Kennedy’s second business loan from KADET LTD. He plans to purchase more sugar, rice, cooking oil and tea leaves. He will use the anticipated profits to invest back into the business and repay his loan. 

He hopes to have a well-known business.

loans.use: to purchase more sugar, rice, cooking oil and tea leaves.

loans.name: Jean Baptiste

texts.en:
Jean Baptiste is 41 years old, married and has been a maize farmer for 18 years. He will use the Kiva loan to cover labor costs and buy fertilizer during maize production: He needs fertilizer to increase his production. He plans to reinvest profits back into his business so that in the future he can acquire machines, like tractors, that will enhance his farming capacity.

This photo was taken recently during a previous maize harvest. Jean Baptiste was very happy and excited that the previous season was very productive for both family needs and business. The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to buy more fertilizer and cover labor costs during maize production.

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en:
Juliet  is a single mother of four children who all attend school. She has run a business selling charcoal for six years. She has applied for a loan of  1200000 Uganda shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy more bags of charcoal. Besides this charcoal business, she generates additional income from rental rooms. She works seven days a week and she sells wholesale only. Her major business challenges include thieves, transportation and seasonality.  She aspires to see her business grow so that she gets enough profits to buy a delivery van to ease transportation challenges and also to build more rental rooms  She resides in her own house and the family has access to electricity but not to piped water.  
Her monthly expenses includes school fees and feeding the family .

loans.use: to buy more bags of charcoal.

loans.name: Mario

texts.en:
Mario is a responsible father who has great ambition for his family. He aims to improve their status of living and educate his children. He is 48 years old and has three school-age children. He is raising his family in a village where they can plant rice, vegetables and raise livestock for sale. Despite hardships, he has the determination to improve their standard of living. 

He also has a welding shop to provide services and generate income. He aims to make this business profitable so he can educate his children. To improve the business, he is asking for additional capital of P15,000 to buy a welding rod, iron and other materials. He believes that his patience and sacrifices will enable him to make his dream a reality.

loans.use: to buy a welding rod, iron and other materials needed in the welding shop

loans.name: Myrvt Group

texts.en:
This group is called Myrvt, and it consists of four women. They live in Sana`a, Yemen. They took out a loan of 160,000 YER. They all operate different kinds of businesses. 

Zahra is a 61 years old. She is the first woman from the left in the photo. She is married and has four children. She has a grocery store that has customers from her area. 

She is working hard to save money to have a better life. She asked for a loan of 50,000 YER from AMB to buy groceries, goods and some appliances for her business. Her business goal is to expand into new markets.

loans.use: to buy groceries, goods, and some household appliances to sell in her grocery store.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is 38 years old and sells blankets, sweaters and handbags in Mombasa. She is a single mother of two school children. She has been running this business for the last 15 years, and she is doing great. 

This will be Mary's second business loan from KADET LTD to finance her business. She plans to purchase more blankets, sweaters and handbags to sell. She will use the anticipated profits to pay school fees for her children. 

She hopes to succeed and grow her business.

loans.use: to purchase more blankets, sweaters and handbags to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase additional second-hand clothes to sell.

loans.name: Phillomene

texts.en:
Phillomene is 23 years old and married to a farmer. She has been a maize farmer for three years. 

Phillomene is requesting a loan, which she will use to support labor costs and to buy fertilizer during maize production: She needs to buy fertilizer in order to increase her production. With profits from her farming she hopes to acquire farm machinery that will enhance her farming capacity. She was very happy that the previous season was very helpful for both family needs and business. 

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and to support labor cost during maize production.

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en:
Emmanuel is 35 years old and has earned a living as a maize farmer for the last 15 years. His wife is also a farmer. He is requesting a loan from Kiva to buy fertilizer and hire laborers to help out during the busiest parts of the year. This loan will help him increase his profits and eventually acquire machines like tractors to further enhance his farm's output. This photo taken recently at a maize farm where Emmanuel was very happy and excited because his most recent crop allowed him to take better care of his family and invest in his business. 

Agriculture accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and hire workers to help with his maize production.

loans.name: Muia

texts.en:
Muia lives in the Kongowea area of Coast Province, Kenya. He is married and has two children, one of whom attends school. For the past 7 years, Muia has owned a curio shop from where he sells art work, mostly loved by tourists. He also owns a cosmetics shop.

Muia learned about Milango through friends who invited him to the group. He joined the group with the aim of accessing credit to improve his business operations. Muia's main challenges are price fluctuations, inflation, the seasonal business climate (mainly tourists and visitors) and the high cost of purchasing stock. Muia is applying for a loan of 41,850 Kenya shillings (KES) to purchase more stock of curios. The extra income from the loan will be added to his savings to improve his family's living standards.

loans.use: To purchase more stock of curios.

loans.name: Jose Clasio

texts.es:
JOSE CLASIO tiene 40 años de edad de estado civil unión libre tiene tres hijos, vive con la conyugue y los hijos en la ciudad de Ventanas Provincia de los ríos.

Es integrante de la  Ventanilla Bendición de Dios se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto Rancho Grande de la parroquia Puerto Pechiche, se dedican a labores Agrícolas y Pecuarias.

JOSE CLASIO se dedica la siembra de maíz, arroz, además se dedica a la crianza de animales. Solicita el crédito para comprar urea, insecticidas, fertilizantes para  los cultivos. Con la ayuda del crédito podrá comprar insumos, fertilizantes, urea, insecticidas. 

Las compras las realizará en la ciudad de ventanas. El sueño es poder comprar un carro.
Los desafíos a los que se enfrenta son las plagas en los cultivos. En el tiempo libre le gusta ver televisión.
texts.en:
José Clasio, 40, has a common-law marriage and three children.  He lives with his spouse and children in the city of Ventanas, Los Ríos Province.  He's a memeber of Bendición de Dios Communal Bank in the Rancho Grande area of Puerto Pechiche Parish, where they work in agriculture and livestock.

José Clasio works growing corn and rice, and also raises animals.  He's requesting the loan to buy urea, insecticide, and fertilizer for the crops.  With the help of the loan he'll be able to buy the agricultural inputs.

He'll make his purchases in the city of Ventanas.  The challenges he faces are crop pests.

His dream is to buy a car.  In his free time he likes to watch television.

loans.use: to buy urea, insecticide, and fertilizer

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Samuel is a 33-year-old married man. He has two children, ranging from 9 months to 4 years. He describes himself as determined and aggressive. He operates a motorcycle, with which he provides transportation services to customers. He has been involved in this business for one year. His business is located in a potential business area. He describes his biggest challenge as stiff competition within the area. 

He will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy clothes for starting a new retail store. His goal is to improve his business within five years. He hopes that in the future, he will build a permanent house for his family. This is his first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy clothes to stock a new retail store.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.es: Nancy invirtió su crédito anterior en la compra de telas, hilos, encajes y accesorios de modistería y su crédito la benefició porque pudo adquirir materias primas y producir más sin depender de los anticipos de los clientes. Hoy está aplicando a un nuevo credikiva que invertirá en comprar materias primas como telas, hilos, encajes, correderas, botones, inversión que proyecta tener éxito   porque tiene mas de 40 años de experiencia en su negocio, aprovechará la temporada de picos altos en sus ventas y Nancy cuenta con una clientela acreditada. Ella envía el siguiente mensaje a los financiadores de Kiva:   “agradezco toda la ayuda recibida y deseo para ustedes y sus familias mucha salud y prosperidad”
texts.en: Nancy used her previous loan to buy fabric, thread, lace and clothes-making accessories.  Her loan was beneficial because she was able to acquire raw materials and produce more without having to depend on customer advances.  Today, she’s applying for a new Kiva loan to buy raw materials like fabric, thread, lace, zippers and buttons.  She believes the investment will be successful because she has more than 40 years’ experience in her business and she’ll take advantage of a peak sales season; Nancy has a well-established clientele.  She sends the following message to Kiva lenders:  “I thank you for all the help received and I wish much health and prosperity for you and your families.”

loans.use: to buy raw materials like fabric, thread, lace, zippers and buttons.

loans.name: Jaime Luis

texts.es: Jaime, de 33 años de edad, padre de 1 hijo de 3 años de edad, el habita en la ciudad de Estelí , de oficio mecánico . Desde muy joven aprendió este oficio , al cumplir 18 años de edad decidió poner sus propio negocio. Con un primer préstamo comenzó a comprar herramientas y buscar clientela poco a poco fue dando a conocer su propio taller, el cual tiene en el patio de su casa. El desea  ir acondicionando mejor su negocio, contratar  a personas para que su negocio sirva d escuela y trabajo. El está solicitando el crédito para comprar material  de construcción como cemento, arena, bloques para construir un garaje para su taller, pues no tiene condiciones para alojar los carros de los clientes.
texts.en:
Jaime, 33, is the father of a three-year-old child.  He lives in the city of Estelí and is a mechanic.

He learned this trade at a very young age.  When he turned 18 he decided to set up his own business.  With a first loan he began to buy tools and look for customers.  Little by little his shop became known.  His shop is on the patio of his house.

He wants to better equip his business and hire people so his shop serves as a school and a job.  He's requesting the loan to buy construction materials such as cement, sand, and concrete blocks to build a garage for his shop because he doesn't have the space to accommodate his customers' cars.

loans.use: to buy construction materials to build a garage for his shop

loans.name: Leticia

texts.en: Leticia believes that, "Patience and hard work will enable her to survive from poverty." She is 58 years old and the mother of nine adult-age children. They live harmoniously in a village where they plant rice, fruits and vegetables and raise livestock for sale. These are the major sources of their income. Due to financial difficulties, Leticia also buys and sells fruits and vegetables in their village to generate additional income. Her goal is to increase her income so that she can pay for their necessities and save for future emergencies. She wants to acquire more fruits and vegetables to sell but has no capital, and that is why she is applying for a loan for PHP 15,000 to buy eggplants, bitter melons, okra, sweet potatoes, beans, bananas and squash to sell. She is hoping that this loan will allow her to improve her business so it becomes more profitable in the future.

loans.use: to buy eggplants, bitter melons, okra, sweet potatoes, beans, bananas and squash to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Sixto Tomàs

texts.es:
Sixto tiene 58 años, su familia la conforman su cónyuge  un hijo de 25 años de edad y dos hijas de 28 y 32 años; Sixto está dedicado desde hace 22 años a la actividad empresarial, que hoy traduce en un negocio de venta de jugos de naranja, fritos y productos alimenticios de una multinacional,   los cuales ofrece en un punto de venta con gran afluencia de público en el centro de la ciudad; diariamente  exprime naranjas que generan el mas delicioso jugo natural, y sus clientes lo combinan con los productos fritos,  que  Sixto compra elaborados y que se constituyen en una buena merienda. Sus compras las realiza a crédito y de contado y sus ventas se desarrollan  diariamente, a clientes que son principalmente empleados de empresas cercanas y transeúntes,  que reconocen la calidad de sus productos y por eso regresan a comprarle. 
Sixto  ha recibido dos crédito de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, financiamientos que  le han servido para mejorar las condiciones de trabajo y ampliar el inventario y con mayor generación de ingresos, pues los ha invertido en capital de trabajo y en  el arreglo del techo del carro y de una vitrina calentadora, con las que impacta cada vez mas a su clientela. Su meta es fortalecer esta actividad con nuevos  puntos de venta, para lograr finalmente sus meta familiar, que es la de  continuar acondicionando su vivienda.
En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, tercer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual  comprará naranjas y productos alimenticios, fritos como empanadas, papas rellenas quibbes, además de  vasos desechables; inversión con la que  incrementará el inventario, lo que conlleva a un aumento en los volumen de ventas y al éxito de esta inversión.
texts.en:
Sixto is 58 years old, his family is formed by his spouse, a son of 25 years old, and two daughters who are 28 and 32 years old. Sixto has been working in business activities for 22 years. Currently, he has a business that sells orange juice, fried food and foodstuff from a multinational company, providing a point of sale with large crowds in the city center. 

Every day, he squeezes oranges that make the most delicious natural juice. His customers combine it with fried food, which Sixto buys elaborated and which constitutes a great snack. His purchases are made on credit and on cash, and his sales are developed daily mainly to employees of nearby businesses and passers-by, who recognize the quality of his products and so they return to buy.

Sixto has received two loans from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, financings that have served him to improve the working conditions and expand the inventory. He is also generating more income, because he invested in working capital, in fixing the roof of the cart, and the heating cabinet, what impacts his customers. 

His goal is to strengthen this activity with new with new points of sale, in order to finally achieve his family goals, which are to keep renovating his home. He is currently applying to a Kiva loan, the third investment he requests to Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, through which he will buy oranges and foodstuff, fried food such as pasties, stuffed potatoes and kibbes, and also disposable cups. With this investment, he will increase the inventory, leading to an increase in sales and to the success of this investment.

loans.use: to buy oranges and foodstuffs, fried food such as pasties, stuffed potatoes and kibbes, and disposable cups.

loans.name: Pamela

texts.en: Pamela lives in Likoni area of Coast Province, Kenya with her husband and three children. She owns a clothes business which she has been operating for four years. She travels around and sells her clothing in nearby homes. Pamela learned about Milango through friends who invited her to join the group. She did that as a way to access credit to improve her business. Her main challenges are high fuel and transport costs, price fluctuations and inflation and taxes. She is applying for a loan for 43,150 Kenyan shillings to buy additional stock of second-hand clothes and shoes. She will use the extra income she earns from this loan to increase her savings. Her dream is to open clothing businesses in other areas.

loans.use: to buy additional stock of second-hand clothes and shoes.

loans.name: Evelin Neiffy

texts.es: La Sra. Evelin tiene 37 años,  tiene tres hijos que se encuentran en edad escolar,   se dedica  a la   venta de cosméticos por catalogo, ella vende sus productos de manera ambulante, visitando domicilios y oficinas públicas y privadas de la ciudad de La Paz,  donde ofrece sus productos,  este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución, la Sra. Evelin va a utilizar este préstamo para la compra de cosmético y joyas por mayor y que se encuentran en promoción y de esta manera brindar variedad de productos a su clientela e incrementar sus ganancias,  su razón para solicitar este préstamo es seguir mejorando en su  negocio, la Sra. Evelin va a utilizar los beneficios para seguir comprando variedad de productos de belleza, la Sra. Evelin es una persona muy trabajadora se siente feliz por la oportunidad brindada.
texts.en:
Evelin, age 37, has three school age children.  She sells cosmetics by catalog, and she sells her products in an itinerant manner.  She goes to homes and public and private offices in the city of La Paz to sell her products.

This loan is her first cycle with the institution.  Evalin will use this loan to buy cosmetics and jewelry wholesale that are on sale.  This way she will offer a variety of products to her customers and increase her income.  Her reason for requesting this loan is to continue improving her business.  Evelin will use the profits to continue buying a variety of beauty products.  

Evelin is a very hard-working person, and she is happy about the opportunity given to her.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics and jewelry wholesale.

loans.name: Al-Ammad Group

texts.en: This group, called Al-ammad, consists of four members who are all female. They are from Aden, Yemen and they know each other very well. All the group members are considered hardworking people who very much want to get ahead. This group took a loan of 160,000 YER. Salma is a 33-year-old single woman. She lives in Aden, Yemen. She’s happy to be a part of this group. She has been distributing mobile recharge cards and ladies' fabrics. She started the business to earn more profit. She loves her work and aspires to continue. Her portion of this group loan is 50,000 YER from AMB. She will use it to continue buying mobile recharge cards and fabrics that will help her to get more profit from her business.

loans.use: to buy mobile recharge cards and fabrics

loans.name: Umurzok

texts.ru:
Умурзок житель города Истаравшан. Он женат. Ему 51 год. Умурзок отец четверых детей. Жена Умурзока работает в дехканском хозяйстве. 
Умурзок уже четыре года как занимается скотоводством. Он разводит скот у себя дома. Умурзок в основном занимается купле-продажей коров, телят и бычков. Он просит кредит для закупа бычков и коровы.
texts.en: Umurzok is from Istaravshan. He is 51 years old, married, and has 4 children. His wife works in the farming sector. Umurzok has been working in animal husbandry for the last 4 years, and he raises cattle at home. He mainly raises and sells cows, calves and bulls. Umurzok is now seeking a loan for the purchase of bulls and cows.

loans.use: to buy bulls and cows

loans.name: Adelino

texts.en:
Adelino is a hard working father who is raising his family in a rural community. He aims to become successful in life to give his three children a bright future. He is a farmer who owns and manages a rice farming business in their community. Aside from this, he also operates a repair shop in their community to generate additional income. He needs to earn a higher income to satisfy his family needs and support the education of his children. 

He plans to strengthen his business by providing a better service to his customers to satisfy their needs and wants. To improve the business, he is asking for an additional capital of P6,000.00 to buy iron, sprockets, welding rods and other materials needed in the repair shop. He believes that this loan will help him to work out his plan and hoping that he will be successful in the future.

loans.use: to buy iron, sprockets, welding rods and other materials needed in the repair shop

loans.name: Antoinette

texts.fr: Agée de 46 ans, Antoinette est mariée et mère de quatre enfants scolarisés. L'aîné et le benjamin ont respectivement 18 ans et 5 ans.
