Spécialisée dans la vente des boissons locales et des fagots de bois depuis quelques années, elle s'approvisionne dans l'un des marchés du Bénin. Soucieuse d'accroître son capital et de satisfaire la demande de ses clients, elle a sollicité et a obtenu un micro crédit à Finadev en vue de maximiser son intérêt et de participer à la scolarisation de ses enfants.
texts.en: Antoinette, 46 years of age, is married and the mother of four children, all in school. The eldest child is 18 years old, and the youngest five years old. Antoinette has been selling traditional beverages and firewood for some years. She stocks up at one of the markets in Benin.  Wishing to bolster her capital and meeting customer demand she has requested and obtained a microloan from Finadev, so as to maximize her revenues and contribute to her children’s education.

loans.use: to buy 10 50-liter jugs of traditional beverages and 20 bundles of firewood.

loans.name: Ato

texts.en:
Ato is a 33-year-old married woman with 3 children. 


She has a small plantation and grows taro, ta'amu (a root vegetable), and bananas to earn a living. She has been doing this for many years. Ato has requested a loan to pay for nails, timber, and iron roofing.


She has been a member of SPBD since 2011. With her profits, Ato hopes to improve the living condition of her family.

loans.use: to pay for nails, timber, and iron roofing

loans.name: Latif

texts.ru:
Латиф родился в 1970 году. Он проживает в городе Исфара. Латиф очень порядочный и хороший человек. Он живет с женой. У них трое маленьких детей. Латиф у себя дома разводит мелко - рогатый скот в дальнейшем для продажи. Этим видом деятельности он занимается пять лет. На сегодняшний день у него имеется одна корова, которая обеспечивает семью молоком. 
Коме того Латиф предоставляет услугу. Он работает на центральном рынке города. Он арендует столовую, где работает поваром. Латиф хороший повар, он очень вкусно готовит национальные блюда (особенно плов). 
Латиф просит кредит для закупа мелко - рогатого (овец) и крупнорогатого скота (телят и бычков).
texts.en: Latif was born in 1970. He lives in Isfara, and is a decent and good man. He and his wife have 3 children. For the past 5 years, Latif has been raising small livestock at home for later re-sale. Latif currently has a dairy cow that provides milk for his family. In addition to animal husbandry, Latif works in the service sector. He rents a small cafe at the central market in the city where he works as a cook. Latif prepares delicious national dishes, particularly pilaf. Latif is seeking a loan in order to buy sheep, calves and bulls.

loans.use: to buy sheep, calves and bulls

loans.name: Namig

texts.ru: He is an IDP (Internally Displaced Person) from the city of Fuzuli, but currently he and his family live in the greater Baku region. Namig is 27 years old and a single person. He now needs a loan of 1,700 AZN (Azerbaijani New Manat) in order to buy instruments for improve his work. He repair different pump, motors and etc. for 3 years. He loves his work and enjoys spending his time thinking of ways to improve his business.
texts.en: Namig is 27 years old and single. He is an IDP (Internally Displaced Person) from the city of Fuzuli, but he and his family currently live in the greater Baku region. For the past 3 years, Namig has been repairing various pumps, motors, and so on. Namig now needs a loan of 1,700 AZN (Azerbaijani New Manat) in order to buy tools to improve his work. He loves his job and enjoys spending his time thinking of ways to improve his business.

loans.use: tools for his work

loans.name: Jose Neptael

texts.es: Jose tiene 27 años de edad, es soltero, y vive con su madre en el municipio de Sulaco, Yoro. José ha establecido su propio negocio en su casa, de venta de repuestos para motocicletas y reparación de la misma. El negocio lleva tres años de estar funcionando y ha logrado establecer su clientela en su comunidad. Es su primer préstamo que solicita el cual es por 20,000 Lempiras y lo va utilizar para surtir el negocio de repuestos de motocicletas para vender ( llantas, neumáticos, balinera, hules, empaques, parches, focos, vías, bujías, stop, cadenas, etc). y a la vez para brindar el servicio de reparación. El objetivo de incrementar el inventario es para incrementar las ventas y sus ingresos. Su meta es fortalecer más el negocio para ayudar económicamente a su familia y continuar sus estudios.
texts.en:
José is 27 years old, and he lives with his mother in the Sulaco municipality in Yoro.

José has established his own business at his house.  He sells motorcycle replacement parts, and he repairs motorcycles.  He has had the business for three years, and he has managed to establish his clientele in his community.

This is the first loan that he has requested.  He has requested 20,000 lempiras to stock his business with motorcycle replacement parts to sell (tires, ball bearings, rubber accessories, seals, patches, headlights, vias, spark plugs, tail lights, and chains, etc.)  The loan is also to provide repair service.

The objective is to increase his inventory in order to increase sales and his income.  His goal is to further strengthen the business in order to financially help his family and to continue his education.

loans.use: to buy motorcycle replacement parts to sell.

loans.name: Maria Luisa

texts.es: María tiene 39 años y es casada con 1 hijo que tiene  11 años,  ella se dedica a la venta de carne de llama y cordero que se encuentran en mercado muy concurrido de la zona, esta en sexta secuencia de su  préstamo con muestras institución, la Sra. María  va a usar este préstamo para la compra de gradas para su domicilio ya que se encuentra en construcción y le hizo falta este material, la Sra. María es una persona muy emprendedora y trabajadora, se siente feliz y agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado, ya que con el anterior crédito le fue muy bien creció en su actividad y mejoro sus ingresos económicos.
texts.en:
María is 39, married, and has an 11-year-old son. She sells llama and lamb meat in a very busy local market. This is her sixth loan with the institution, and María is going to use this loan to purchase stairs for her home, as it is under construction and she needs this material

Maria is a very enterprising and hard-working person. She feels happy and grateful to the institution for the helped offered. It went very well with the previous loan, as her business grew and she improved her income.

loans.use: To buy stairs for her home.

loans.name: Taefali

texts.en: Taefali, a 47-year-old divorced mother of six, makes and sells taro and fried chicken in her community to earn a living. With two years of experience in this venture, Taefali is requesting a loan to purchase more taro, chicken and other cooking ingredients. She plans to use her profits to help with her children's education and extend her business. Taefali has been a member of SPBD since 2010.

loans.use: to buy chicken legs, taro, cooking oil, onions, and salt.

loans.name: Pao

texts.en:
Pao is a 24-year-old single woman with no children.  She has a small plantation and grows bananas and taro to earn a living. She has been doing this for 5 years. Po has requested a loan to pay for chemicals, a grass sprayer, a knife, timber, cement and iron roofing for her business and home improvement. 

She has been a member of SPBD since 2011. With her profits, Pao hopes to expand and earn more to provide her family needs.

loans.use: buy tools for her business and materials to improve her home

loans.name: Sahar

texts.en:
Sahar is a 42-year-old single female from Marka, Amman in Jordan. She requested a 500 JOD loan to so she can purchase clothes, cosmetics and perfumes to retail.

In the future she would like to make home improvements and buy some furniture.

loans.use: to purchase cosmetics, clothes and perfumes to retail.

loans.name: Felauai

texts.en: Felauai is 56 years old and married with 4 children. She runs a small business selling tomatoes, cucumbers, etc. in her community and has been doing this for 1 year. Felauai has requested a loan to pay for cucumber seeds, cabbage seeds, a grass-sprayer, a rake and a wheelbarrow for her business. She joined SPBD for many years to gain access to capital. With her earnings, Feelauai will continue to serve her community and gain more income to help supplement her family's income.

loans.use: buy seeds and gardening tools

loans.name: Leoo

texts.en: Leoo is a 24-year-old married woman with 4 children.  She has a small plantation and grows bananas, yams, taamu and taro to earn a living. She has been doing this for 8 years. Leoo has requested a loan to pay for her children's education fees and to buy timber, an iron roof, cement, nails, manure, chemicals, a rake, a wheelbarrow and gloves for her business.  She has been a member of SPBD since 2011. With her profits, Leoo hopes to save more and provide for her family needs.

loans.use: to pay her children's education fees and buy supplies and tools for her farm

loans.name: Debora Group

texts.en:
The Debora Trust Bank is made up of 11 enthusiastic women and is found in the small village of Xecaracoj, located in the western highlands of Guatemala. Many residents of Xercaracoj dedicate their careers to commerce (inlcuding selling produce, groceries and hardware); other villagers also make a living in manufacturing traditional clothing and animal husbandry. Xecaracoj is a rural community where many people still speak the native language of K’iche.

The president of the Debora Trust Bank, Elvira is a 33-year-old married woman with two children. When Elvira was very young, her father passed away, leaving her with no other means of support. She and her siblings left school to work for family income.  Having only completed a year of school, Elvira dedicated herself to the art of hand embroidery and animal husbandry to support her family. Today, Elvira runs a small convenience store out of her house.

Each month, when the Debora Trust Bank has a repayment meeting, members also receive non-formal education as part of their participation in the Microcredit Plus program through Friendship Bridge.  Elvira recently attended the advanced training for baking, and wants to incorporate a bakery into her convenience store, specializing in donuts. With a new loan she will buy inventory to enhance her store and all the materials necessary to start baking donuts.  

Elvira dreams of expanding her business through the bakery, which will gain her access to new clientele. She is a very positive woman who now has the self-confidence to grow her business and earn extra income to obtain her goal of keeping her children in school. In addition, she appreciates other training she has received through Friendship Bridge, including lessons on money management, which will help her with business growth.
    
Elvira is one of 11 women who make up the Debora Trust Bank. Each have different life stories, but their common goal is to change their future and the future of their families. They are grateful for the investment that people around the world are making in them.

loans.use: To buy inventory to enhance her store and materials to start baking donuts.

loans.name: Ulalia

texts.en: Ulalia is a 36-year-old married woman with 6 children. She has a small plantation and grows yams, taro, taamu and bananas to earn a living. She has been doing this for many years. Ulalia has requested a loan to pay for taro seeds, taamu seeds, a grass-sprayer, chemicals, a knife and a rake for her business.  She has been a member of SPBD since 2010. With her profits, Ulalia need to expand her business.

loans.use: buy farming supplies and tools

loans.name: Maria

texts.en: Maria is a 24-year-old married woman with 2 children.  She has a small plantation and grows taro and bananas to earn a living. She has been doing this for 5 years. Maria has requested a loan to pay for taro seeds, taamu seeds, a grass-sprayer, manure, chemicals, a wheelbarrow and a rake for her business.  She has been a member of SPBD since 2011. With her profits, Maria hopes to save more money and expand her business.

loans.use: buy farming supplies and tools

loans.name: Faititili

texts.en: Fatitilli is a 60-year-old woman who is married and has 7 children. She runs a business selling food and groceries in her community. She has many years of experience with this business. Faititili has requested a loan to help her children's education and improve her home by buying timber and cement. She plans to use her profits to expand her business and improve her family income. She has been a member of SPBD since 2010.

loans.use: pay for her children education and buy materials to improve her home

loans.name: Uputaua

texts.en: Uputaua is a 31-year-old married woman with 2 children. She has a small plantation and grows taro, taamu, yams, bananas, etc. to earn a living. She has been doing this for 6 years. Uputaua has requested a loan to to pay for a knife, a grass sprayer, chemicals, awheelbarrow and a rake for her business. She has been a member of SPBD since 2010. With her profits, Uputaua hopes to gain more money to help her family income and provide her children with education.

loans.use: buy farming supplies and tools

loans.name: Faasuamalie

texts.en: Faasuamalie is a 20-year-old married woman with 1 child. She runs a business selling soft drinks, flour, sugar, salt, etc. in her community. She has 3 years of experience with this business. Faasuamalie has requested a loan to pay for sugar, salt, flour, snacks, rice, mutton flaps, boxes of chicken, boxes of sausages, and cigarrettes for her business. She plans to use her profits to help supplement her family's income. She has been a member of SPBD since 2012.

loans.use: buy food items to resell

loans.name: Karen

texts.en: Karen is 19 years old and married with 1 child. She has a plantation where she grows taro and bananas that she can sell in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for 1 year. Karen needs a loan to buy more taro and small bananas to grow. She has been a member of SPBD since 2012. Karen will use the profits from her sales to help the business expand.

loans.use: buy more taro and small bananas to grow

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria is 57 years old and married with three children.

Gloria is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. Gloria requested a PHP 24,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and medicines for her pigs.

Gloria has been raising pigs for 25 years now, and has borrowed 16 times in the past from NWTF and more recently, from Kiva to sustain it.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feeds and medicines for her pigs.

loans.name: Elena

texts.en: Elena is a 45-year-old married woman with 3 children. She makes and sells pork buns in her community to earn a living. She has 2 years of experience with this business. Elena needs a loan to purchase a sack of flour, a sack of salt and chicken legs. She plans to use her profits to extend her business. Elena has been a member of SPBD since 2010.

loans.use: buy ingredients to make food for sale

loans.name: Dolores

texts.en:
This is Dolores, 59, a resident of GMA, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Antonio, a driver, and a father to her children. She and her husband manage their own household. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.  

Dolores oversees operations of their tricycle transportation business. They have one tricycle unit that carries up to four passengers to their destination within the community. The tricycle driver then remits a boundary (daily quota) each day to her. In her business, the regular customers are the local community. She earns a minimum of 500 PHP every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a 20,000 PHP loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy spare parts, accessories and also for the maintenance of their motorcycle. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Dolores dreams to be able to give her family a good life through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for the spare parts and maintenance of their tricycle unit.

loans.name: Rencie

texts.en:
This is Rencie, 43, a resident of Manila, Philippines. She is married to Herman, a vendor and a father to her children. She, together with her husband, manages their own household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Rencie operates a buy and sell business. What she basically does is buy textiles from the textile factory, and sells them with a little profit. Her products are carpets, curtains, shower curtains and the like. Customers are attracted to buy due to the low selling prices and the many options she offers. She earns a minimum of 500 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a 50,000 PHP loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy additional stocks of textile items to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Rencie hopes to be able to expand her business in the coming years and dreams to have her own vehicle. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for textiles and other supplies needed in her business.

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
To make an income, Lorna is active in managing her dressmaking business. She has been in this business for more than 10 years and usually earns PHP 150 to 300 daily. She wants to increase her sales in order to save for her five children’s education. She is also aiming to satisfy her customers' requests.

Right now, Lorna is asking for a loan of the amount of PHP 8,000 to buy additional stock of raw materials such as fabric, needles and thread. She hopes that she can get the amount she requested to further develop her business so she can to make high profits.

loans.use: to buy additional stock of raw materials such as fabric, needles and thread.

loans.name: Nena

texts.en:
Nena is 45 years old, married, and blessed with three children. She works very hard to provide for them. She weaves nipa to sell. It is not easy to weave and earn money from this. However, she is patiently doing this work to improve their living situation. 

Now, she is requesting a loan of PHP 6,000 to purchase more nipa. She is hoping that with the help of the amount she gets, she will be able to increase her income.

loans.use: to purchase more nipa (palm fronds).

loans.name: Fe

texts.en:
Fe has been running a hog-fattening business. While operating this business she also looks after her grandchildren and her variety store. It is not easy to take on these tasks, especially because she’s already 60 years of age, but for Fe nothing is difficult if it is related to improving their poor living standards. 

Now, she is requesting a 7,000 PHP loan to buy vitamins and feeds for her hogs. In the future, she aspires to save money to expand her businesses and help with the future education of her grandchildren.

loans.use: to buy vitamins and feeds for her hogs.

loans.name: Luisa

texts.en:
Luisa is 47 years old. She is a very friendly and happy person. She has used her personality in her three years running her buying and selling business. Because of this, she has gained loyal customers. Lots of customers allows her to have higher sales. 

Right now, Luisa is asking for a loan of the amount of PHP 8,000 to buy fish and two styrofoam recipients. She is hoping for a higher income this time.

loans.use: to buy fish and styrofoam recipients.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy canned good, snacks and beverages to sell

loans.name: Rachel

texts.en:
This is Rachel, 37, resident of Manila, Philippines. She is married to Rolando who works abroad, and is a mother to her six children. She manages her household while operating her business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.  

Rachel operates a trading business. What she basically does is buy general merchandise from wholesalers and sell them with a little profit. Her products are men and women’s clothes and other products of the like. Customers are attracted to buy due to the low selling prices and the many options she offers. Her regular customers are her neighbors and people in the local community.  She earns a minimum of 300 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

To help her continue the operations of her business, Rachel is requesting a PHP 50,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy RTW (ready-to-wear) products and merchandise to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Rachel hopes to be able to expand her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: buy clothes to sell

loans.name: Blasius

texts.en:
Blasius (31) is a father of 4 children: Martha (12), Anita (9), Arni (8), John (7). All the children are attending school except Martha, who dropped out from school several months ago. Blasius covers his family necessities by working as a banana seller since 1995. The business is located at a traditional market. He usually spends 14 to 15 hours a day to run the business. 

Blasius has received loans from TLM for three times and has a good repayment record. His involvement in the lending program for 3 cycles has enabled him to improve his business and better meet his family needs. Blasius plans to improve his business by buying 300 clusters of banana. He also needs money to fulfill the educational needs of his three children.  Therefore Blasius is requesting a new loan amounting to IDR 10,000,000 from TLM.

loans.use: buy bananas to sell and pay his children's school fees

loans.name: Veronica Gema

texts.en:
Veronica Gema, 43, runs a sari-sari store in the village of Buguey and she requested a PHP 15,000 loan to buy stocks of groceries such as noodles, shampoo, soap, canned goods and vinegar to sell in her store.

She has been in this business for over 20 years and is thankful for the development of their living conditions. She is able to provide allowances to her three children who are in school, but she is not able to pay their tuition fees. She believes that she will be able to work and earn more as a result of the financial assistance she will get. With her determination and hard work, she will soon get a better standard of living from her business.

loans.use: to buy stocks of groceries such as noodles, shampoo, soap, canned goods and vinegar.

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en:
Rosita, 54, is happy with her business where she sells variety of products to meet each customer’s demands. She has been running her store for three years and she is able to earn about 200 PHP a day. 

She is looking for higher income, which causes her to request an additional capital amount of 14,000 PHP. This will allow her to purchase additional stock such as canned goods, biscuits, sugar and noodles. She knows that obtaining the loan will be of great help to increase her sales. Therefore it will allow her to offer a better living conditions to her children and grandchildren.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock such as canned goods, biscuits, sugar and noodles.

loans.name: Joseline

texts.en:
Joseline is a twenty-year-old single mother living in Kasese, Uganda. After she became pregnant her fiance refused to take responsibility and she realized that the only way to support herself and the forthcoming baby was to have a daily source of income; so she set up a retail shop with her personal savings.

She has been in the business for one year and with the income she has been able to meet medical expenses and rent a house. Her hardship is inadequate capital to meet the high demand. Her personal goal is building a permanent house to live in and her business goal is to diversify the business to include farming. 

Joseline wants money to buy sugar, sodas and beers to sell.

loans.use: to buy sugar, sodas and beers to sell.

loans.name: Margie

texts.en: Margie is 47 years old, married, and has one child who is in school. Margie is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Margie requested a 24,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy medicines and vaccines for her pigs. Margie has been raising pigs for five years now, and has borrowed eight times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business. In the future, Margie would like to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her child to college.

loans.use: to buy medicines and vaccines for her pigs.

loans.name: Maryjane

texts.en:
Mary Jane operates a hog-fattening business as a source of income. With this business, she is able to help her husband in providing for the needs of their family. Since they were blessed with four children, they had to double their effort to support them. From this situation, she needs to increase her income, but she lacks financial support to make her business grow. 

Therefore, she is requesting a loan of PHP 12,000 to purchase additional hogs as well as the feed and vitamins to nourish them. The loan will be of great help in achieving high sales. In this way, she will be empowered to save money for her children's education.

loans.use: to purchase additional hogs as well as feed and vitamins to nourish them.

loans.name: Myra

texts.en:
This is Myra, 32, resident of Manila, Philippines. She is married to Armin, a businessman, and is a mother to her children. She together with her husband manage their own household while operating a business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Myra operates a trading business. What she basically does is buy textiles from a textile factory and sell them with a little profit. Her products are carpets, curtains, shower curtains and the like. Customers are attracted to buy due to the low selling prices and the many options she offers.  She earns a minimum of 500 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

To help her continue the operations of her business, Myra is requesting a PHP 50,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy additional stocks of textile items to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Myra hopes to be able to expand her business in the coming years and dreams to give her children a good and quality education. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: buy textile products to sell

loans.name: Alfredo

texts.en: Alfredo is 40 years old and married with three children. He is a crab coastline and fish net maker. He has gained this ability from his father. Now, Alfredo is requesting a loan of 6,000 PHP to purchase more bamboo to make crab coastlines and nets. In the future, he plans to start his hog-fattening business as an additional source of income. Alfredo just hopes that his requested loan will be approved and be helpful to him.

loans.use: to purchase more bamboo to make crab coastlines and nets

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more tilapia, Nile perch fish, prawns, and sardines

loans.name: Yuneidys

texts.es: Yuneidys tiene 25 años de edad y trabaja en una actividad que es la comercialización de Ropa interior, exterior  y  de calzado mediante guias especializadas o catálogo;así mismo vende maquillaje, útiles de aseo personal y es tambien manicurista; todo esto lo desarrolla para generar ingresos que beneficien a su hogar y apoyen la gestión de su esposo; su idea de negocio nació al estudiar el oficio de manicurista en el Servicio Nacional de Aprendizaje SENA y por eso lo hizo para producir; con su negocio ha logrado ganar reconocimiento en su comunidad y muchos de ellos son sus clientes tambien de las mercancías que vende y que ella le suministra a crédito, mediante su solicitud. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará  productos como calzado, vestuario y  el equipo de uñas; con esta inversión mejorará el negocio, por el incremento que planea en sus ventas, debido a la presentación con sus herramientas y a la respuesta oportuna que dará a su  consumidor  final. Sus compras las realiza de contado, por medio de guias especializadas o catalogos; sus principales clientes son sus vecinos y amigos y las meta mas adelante de Yuneidys, es tener un local donde atender a los compradores  y contar con su casa propia, ya que en la actualidad vive con sus suegros, que la han apoyado.
texts.en:
Yuneidys is 25 years old and works selling underwear, clothing and footwear through catalogs or specialized guides. At the same time she sells make up, personal hygiene products and is also a manicurist. She does all this to generate earnings that benefit her home and support her husband. Her business idea was born when she studied the trade of manicures in the Servicio Nacional de Apredizaje SENA (National Learning Service) and created the business through this. With her business she has been able to gain recognition in her community and many of her clients are her customers for the merchandise that she sells and has supplied through loans.

She is currently requesting the Kiva loan, her first financing with Fundacion Mario Santo Domingo, with which she will buy products including footwear, clothing and nail equipment. With this investment she will improve her business through the increases she expects in sales due to the display with her tools and the timely response she will give to her customers. 

She makes her purchases in cash through specialized guides or catalogs. Her main customers are her clients and friends. Yuneidys' greatest goal is to have a locale where she can attend to her customers and to have her own house. She currently lives with her mother and father in law, who have supported her.

loans.use: to buy equipment for fingernails and products including footwear and clothing.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia is a small entrepreneur who lived in Annafatan with her spouse and four children. She is now 43 years old and has been raising hogs for two years now.  Upon achieving the desired weight, she resells them to butchers for profit. 

Virginia aims to improve her sales, so she is now borrowing a loan of PHP 8,000 to buy hog feed, medicine and vaccines. This will help ensure good nutrition for her hogs so she can sell them at higher price.

In the future, Virginia hopes to keep improving her hog raising business to pay for her children's school fees.

loans.use: buy hog feed, medicine and vaccines

loans.name: Rico

texts.en:
Rico is a farmer and a hog raiser. He raises hogs and resells them to butchers for a profit. He had been doing it for three years in addition to his income from his farming business.  

Rico is 42 years old, married and has three children who are all attending to school. He aims to send them up to college and earn a degree. He is now asking for a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy feed and medicine to sustain his hogs.  This will help nourish the hogs for better growth and he can offer them at a higher price upon disposal. Someday, Rico hopes to keep growing as a successful entrepreneur in order to achieve financial stability.

loans.use: buy hog feed and medicine

loans.name: El Progreso 3 Group

texts.en:
Maria is the coordinator from the group named El Progreso (The Progress) 3. This group is located in El Seybo, Dominican Republic, in a rural community.  Maria lives with her long term partner and three children in a batey located in the north of EL Seybo ("bateyes" are small rural communities built by sugar companies for their field workers). 

Maria operates a small fuel sale stall where she sells gasoline and other fuel to her clients and people who drive down the main street of the community. She operates her business during all day from her small stall on the side of the street just in front of her house.  She sells it by half-bottle, litter, and gallon.  

Maria is requesting a loan to purchase more fuel to increase her inventory. This is her 13th loan and she has been able to bring changes to her family’s life such as providing school supplies, shoes, clothing and tending to other needs. She will uses her business profits to reinvest into her business and to save.  Maria thanks you for your support.

loans.use: buy gasoline to resell

loans.name: Remia

texts.en: This time, for her fourth cycle loan, Remia is borrowing 16,000 PHP to buy more feed and ducks. The fruit vending business that she previously funded through Kiva partner NWTF, continues to provide Remia and her family with income that is improving their quality of life.

loans.use: to buy more ducks and feed.

loans.name: Luzviminda

texts.en: Luzviminda, age 51, is a vendor selling vegetables to the people in her village. She usually gains about PHP 3,000 and it goes for their daily expenses such as meals and school fees.  Luzviminda is married and has four children. She is borrowing PHP 5,000 to buy cabbages, squash, eggplants and tomatoes to sell. In the future, Luzviminda would like to add fish to her merchandise offering for additional income and this would help increase sales and income for the sustenance of her family.

loans.use: buy vegetables to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy stocks for her store

loans.name: Neckson

texts.en: Neckson is a 35-year-old, married man with four children living in Kasese, Uganda. For 8 years he has been running a retail shop. Neckson acquired capital after selling coffee and cotton, a business he still does. His hardships are customers not paying on time, price fluctuations, inflation, high fuel and transportation costs. His personal goals are educating children and buying a car, while his business goal is expanding business into new markets. Neckson wants money to pay school fees for his children.

loans.use: to pay school fees for his children.

loans.name: Maricel

texts.en:
This is Maricel, 36, a resident of Manila, Philippines. She is married to Jesus, and a mother to her six children. She manages her household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.  

Maricel operates a buy and sell business. What she basically does is buy general merchandise from wholesalers, then sells them with a little profit. Her products are men's and women’s clothes and other products of the like. Customers are attracted to buy due to the low selling prices and the many options she offers. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of 300 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a 40,000 PHP loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy RTW products and merchandise items to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Maricel hopes to be able to expand her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for additional stocks of merchandise needed in her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy two large mechanical jacks.

loans.name: Rowena

texts.en: Rowena is married and has 3 children. Rowena is 34 years old and resides in Calabayan, Ozamis City. Rowena owns and operates a business venture, providing hairdressing to local community members to earn a living; she's been in this business for 8 years. Each month, she earns 12,000 PHP doing this type of business. She requested a loan of 13,500 PHP to purchase dresses to sell and expand the services provided. In 2007, Rowena joined GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more dresses to expand the services provided

loans.name: Rehema

texts.en:
Rehema is a 37-year-old food stall owner in Mombasa. She is married and a mother of two school going-children. She has been selling food for the past 4 years.

This marks her second business loan from KADET LTD to finance her business. Rehema plans to purchase a variety of food stuffs, new chairs, tables and serving dishes. She will use the anticipated profits to repay her loan and also in the expansion of her business. She hopes to excel in the business.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of food stuffs, new chairs, tables and serving dishes

loans.name: Sany's Group

texts.en:
Sany, 53, is a farmer living with his wife in a rural village of the Moung Russey district of Battambang province, Cambodia. He has ten children, five of whom are dependent on him. Sany works as a policeman in the village. He also farms rice on one hectare of farmland and grows pineapples to help the family generate extra income. His wife is a housewife who takes care of the children and helps with the farming business. Engaging in this business for twenty years, he earns around 10,000 KHR per day to meet the family’s needs. 

Sany has been a member of VisionFund for one cycle already, and he has successfully used the first loan to support his family. Now he is leading his group of two to seek another loan with VisionFund. As the leader, he will use his portion to buy fertilizer for his pineapples. He hopes this loan will help improve his crop yield in order to increase his income. With the additional income, he intends to fulfill his dream of building a decent house.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for his pineapples

loans.name: Ligia Liliana

texts.es:
LIGIA LILIANA TIENE 23 AÑOS DE EDAD DE ESTADO CIVIL UNIÓN LIBRE TIENE UNA HIJA, VIVE CON EL ESPOSO Y CON LA HIJA EN LA CIUDAD DE VENTANAS PROVINCIA DE LOS RÍOS.

ES INTEGRANTE DE LA  VENTANILLA BENDICIÓN DE DIOS SE ENCUENTRA UBICADA EN EL RECINTO RANCHO GRANDE DE LA PARROQUIA PUERTO PECHICHE, SE DEDICAN A LABORES AGRÍCOLAS Y PECUARIAS.

LIGIA LILIANA SE DEDICA LA SIEMBRA Y CRIANZA DE ANIMALES. SOLICITA EL CRÉDITO PARA COMPRAR UREA,  INSECTICIDAS, FERTILIZANTES, RANGER, LÍQUIDO MATA MALEZA. CON LA AYUDA DEL CRÉDITO PODRÁ COMPRAR LO NECESARIO PARA LOS CULTIVOS. 

LAS COMPRAS LAS REALIZARÁ EN LA CIUDAD DE VENTANAS. EL SUEÑO ES PODER CONSTRUIR UNA CASA Y COMPRAR TERRENO PARA LAS SIEMBRAS.

LOS DESAFÍOS A LOS QUE SE ENFRENTA SON LAS PLAGAS EN LOS CULTIVOS. EN EL TIEMPO LIBRE LE GUSTA REALIZAR LOS QUEHACERES DE LA CASA.
texts.en:
Ligia Liliana, 23, is in a common law relationship and has a daughter.  She lives with her husband and daughter in the city of Ventanas, Los Ríos Province.  She’s a member of the “Bendición de Dios” (God’s Blessing) communal bank located in Recinto Rancho Grande in Puerto Pechinche Parish; they work in agriculture and animal husbandry.

Ligia Liliana works in agriculture and raising animals.  She’s requesting a loan to buy urea, insecticide, fertilizer, Ranger [herbicide], weed killing liquids.  With help from the loan she’ll be able to buy everything needed for the crops.

Her purchases and sales take place in Ventanas and her dream is to be able to build a house and to buy farmland.  The challenge she faces is crop infestations.  In her free time she enjoys doing housework.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies.

loans.name: Marta Isabel

texts.es:
Marta, vive en casa propia junto con su esposo y sus tres hijos, quienes dependen económicamente de ellos, el negocio es una panadería fabricando pan dulce y francés, Ella aprendió junto a su esposo y unos parientes y hoy en día administra el negocio para poder sobrevivir con su familia.

Ella necesita un préstamo para la compra de harina, manteca, levadura, huevos, que son materiales que intervienen directamente en la elaboración del pan, este crédito será una gran fortaleza para qué Marta pueda aumentar su producción y abastecer en un lapso de tiempo su negocio dinamizando así las ventas.

Con el préstamo espera alcanzar lo más pronto un nivel de clientes para estabilizarse, al mismo tiempo quiere desplazarse a otras zonas y tener la solvencia para pagar sus deudas.
texts.en:
Marta lives in her own house with her husband and three children who depend economically on them.  Her business is a bakery; she bakes sweet and French bread.  She learned alongside her husband and some relatives and today she manages the business in order to survive with her family.

She needs a loan to buy flour, shortening, yeast and eggs which are the materials used directly in bread-baking.  This loan will be a great strength so that Marta can increase production and stock her bakery for a length of time allowing her to maximize sales.  She hopes with help from the loan to more quickly acquire a level of customers to stabilize while at the same time she wants to make inroads into other neighborhoods and to have solvency to pay her debts.

loans.use: to buy flour, shortening, yeast and eggs.

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en:
Lucia is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a clothing business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 18,000 through NWTF to buy more items like blouses, pants, caps, and other miscellaneous items for her clothing business.

Lucia has been in this business for 20 years. Lucia earns more income from selling jewelry.

Lucia has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts and with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: To buy more items like blouses, pants, caps, and other miscellaneous items

loans.name: Angela

texts.es: Angela tiene 37 años de edad, es madre soltera, tiene un hijo, vive con una hermana y su hijo en el municipio de Morazan, Yoro. Ella se gana la vida vendiendo mercadería como ropa intima, ropa para niños y sandalias. Su negocio lleva 3 años y lo realiza de manera ambulante y por encargos. Ha sido cliente de ODEF en cinco ciclos con el actual, el cual es por 25,000 Lempiras y lo invertirá en la compra de mercadería que le han pedido los clientes como ser:  ropa intima, ropa de niño y sandalias para damas y niños. Su meta es seguir creciendo en el negocio, llegar a tener más clientes y poderle dar lo necesario a su hijo (vivienda, salud y educación).
texts.en: Angela, 37, is a single mother; she has a son.  She lives with a sister and her son in the town of Morazán, Yoro.  She earns her living selling merchandise like underwear, children’s clothes and sandals.  She’s been in business three years and sells from place to place and on order.  She’s been an ODEF client for five cycles counting the present one which is for 25,000 Lempiras that she will use to buy merchandise like underwear, children’s clothes and sandals for woman and children she has pending orders for.  Her goal is to continue growing in her business, to acquire more customers and to give her son everything he needs (housing, health and education).

loans.use: to buy underwear, sandals and children's clothes to sell.

loans.name: Marivel

texts.en:
Marivel  is from the village of Estaka. She is 35 years old and married. 

To make a living, Marivel owns and operates a business venture in the clothing business. Marivel has been engaged in her business for over four years and earns approximately 4,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) a month for these activities. 

In 2009, Marivel joined PMPC. Marivel is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional stock of used clothing. This will be the eighth loan taken out by Marivel from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the business and general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: To purchase additional stocks of used clothing.

loans.name: Fruithful Group

texts.en:
Arlyn is 38 years old and lives in Tukuran, ZDS in the Philippines.  She is married with four children.

Arlyn has a general store.  She has had this business for six years, and is requesting a loan of 30,000 PHP to purchase more stock for her general store, including dry goods, beverages and canned goods.

Arlyn has been a member of PMPC for four years.  In the future, Arlyn hopes to have a big sari-sari (general) store.

loans.use: to purchase goods to sell in her general store.

location.town: Pagadian-Upper Bayao Tukuran Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Hannah

texts.en:
Hannah is from Lower Dicayas, Dipolog City. She is 41 years old, married and has two adult-aged children. 
Hannah owns and operates a business, making and selling food, primarily snacks and other delicacies, in the local community. Hannah is just starting this business. 
In 2008, Hannah joined PMPC to gain access to financial services in order to improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.
Hannah is requesting a new loan of 50,000 PHP which will be used to purchase raw ingredients for her snack vending business. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's general living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients for her snack vending business

location.town: Dipolog - Dicayas, Dipolog City, Zamboanga del Nor

loans.name: Perlita

texts.en:
Perlita is married and has three children. Perlita works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 17,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy additional inventory for her business.

Perlita has borrowed and paid six loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 10 years and also earns an income from raising livestock.

Perlita aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional inventory for her store

loans.name: Omar Enrique

texts.es: Omar invirtió su crédito anterior en la compra de medicamentos, perfumería, cosméticos de tocador, su Credikiva lo beneficio en el crecimiento de su negocio en cuanto a que le permitió tener un inventario, más variedad de productos y con ello se incrementó su venta;En la actualidad está aplicando a un nuevo credikiva que lo invertiría en mercancías, drogas farmacéuticas, medicinales, odontológicas, perfumería y productos de tocador, esta inversión tendrá éxito,  porque es basada en un producto de alta demanda y porque su olfato de negocios y experiencia así lo señalan. Su mensaje a los financiadores de Kiva es el siguiente: gracias a kiva he podido sacar adelante mi negocio, incrementando el capital de trabajo y  aumentando las ventas”
texts.en: Omar used his previous loan to buy medicine, perfumery and cosmetics.  His Kiva loan helped his business grow in that it made it possible for him to have inventory on hand and more variety of products and this led to an increase in sales.  He’s currently applying for a new Kiva loan that will be used to buy merchandise, pharmaceuticals, medicine, dental products, perfumery and cosmetics.  This investment will be successful because it’s based on products that have high demand and because his nose for business so indicates.  His message to Kiva lenders is the following: “Thanks to Kiva I’ve been able to move my business forward increasing working capital and sales.”

loans.use: to buy merchandise, pharmaceutical, medicine, dental products, perfume and beauty products.

loans.name: Florencia

texts.en:
Florencia is 43 years old and lives in Lumad Pagadian City. She is married, with one child.

She has a general store.  She has had this business for six years. She requested a loan amounting to PHP 50,000 to purchase  more stocks for her general store such as toothpaste, shampoo and beverages.

She has been a member of PMPC for almost one year. In the future, she hopes to have her own general store in her town.

loans.use: To purchase more stocks for her general store such as toothpaste, shampoo and beverages

loans.name: Journy

texts.en:
Journy is single and 'member of the third gender community. Journy is 30 years old and lives in Tapican, Liloy, Zamboanga del Norte.

Journy owns a general store to earn a living and has had this business for one year. Each month, he earns 5,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) doing this type of work. He has requested a loan of 10,000 PHP to purchase more stock for his general store, such as shampoo and toothpaste.

Journy has been a member of PMPC for two years. In the future, Journy hopes to expand his business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock for her general store, such as shampoo and toothpaste.

loans.name: Mirian Liseth

texts.es:
Mirian, vive en su casa junto a sus padres y una hermana, administra un salón de belleza, dicho negocio está instalado en el mercado desde hace cuatro años, ella lo aprendió como una alternativa para poder mantener el ingreso económico y solventar sus necesidades propias.

Está solicitando un préstamo para comprarse materiales para los tratamientos para el cabello, cremas, champú, cosméticos, ya que esto permitirá mejorar su inventario y poder lograr conquistar nuevos clientes.

Su aspiración a futuro es crecer en el negocio, instalar un salón de belleza óptimo, con unas condiciones adecuadas con la tecnología necesaria ya que asi dará a su clientela el servicio según los gustos y necesidades.
texts.en: Mirian lives in her house with her parents and a sister.  She manages a beauty salon, a business that’s been located in a market for four years.  She learned it as an alternative to earn income and cover her personal expenses.  She’s requesting a loan to buy materials needed for hair care: creams, shampoo and cosmetics since this will make it possible for her to improve her inventory and be able to win over new customers.  Her hope for the future is to grow in business and to set up a full-service beauty salon with the necessary conditions and technology so that she can provide customers with personalized service designed to meet their needs.

loans.use: to buy creams, shampoo and cosmetics.

loans.name: Marcial

texts.es:
El señor Marcial de oficio agricultor, originario de Jinotega al norte de Estelí, se dedica a la siembra de hortalizas y granos básicos, su experiencia la adquirió desde muy joven. Para el los créditos obtenidos le han sido de mucho beneficio para su negocio, le han ayudado a sacar una muy buena producción en sus cultivos y sobre todo llegan en el momento cuando más lo necesita.
Él está solicitando un crédito para comprar abono, fertilizantes, gasolina para motor de riego, pagar mano de obra para sembrar 1 manzana de tomates. Espera sacar una excelente producción y calidad al igual que las anteriores, vender todos sus cultivos, pagar el crédito y lograr comprar su propio terreno de siembra para dejar de alquilar la tierra.
texts.en:
Marcial works in agriculture; he’s from Jinotega north of Estelí.  He grows greens and basic grains.  He started gaining experience while still very young.  For him, the loans he’s gotten have been of great benefit for his business in that they have helped him produce good crop yields and above all they arrive when he most needs them to.

He’s asking for a loan to buy manure, fertilizer and gasoline for his irrigation pump and to pay labor costs to plant one manzana [Central American unit of land measurement] of tomatoes.  He hopes to produce an excellent, high quality harvest like his previous ones and to sell all his production to repay the loan and to buy his own land so that he can stop leasing land.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies and to pay labor costs.

loans.name: Andres Eduardo

texts.es:
ANDRES EDUARDO tiene 20 años de edad es soltero no tiene hijos, vive con la mamá en la ciudad de ventanas provincia de los ríos.

Es integrante de la  Ventanilla Bendición de Dios se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto Rancho Grande de la parroquia Puerto Pechiche, se dedican a labores Agrícolas y Pecuarias.

ANDRES EDUARDO se dedica la siembra de maíz y arroz. Solicita el crédito para comprar ranger, urea, insecticidas, fertilizantes, abonos orgánicos.

Con la yuda del crédito podrá lo necesario para trabajar en los cultivos. Las compras las realizará en la ciudad de ventanas. El sueño es poder comprar un terreno.

Los desafíos a los que se enfrenta son las plagas cómo el cogollero  y el ratón. En el tiempo libre le gusta jugar pelota.
texts.en:
Andres Eduardo is 20 years old. He is single and has no children but lives with his mother in the city of Ventanas in the province of Los Rios. 

He is a member of the Ventanilla Bendicion de Dios that is located in the Rancho Grande Recinto in the Puerto Pechiche parish, which is dedicated to agriculture and livestock work. 

Andres Eduardo works planting corn and rice. He is requesting the loan to buy round-up, urea, insecticides, fertilizers and organic manure. 

With the help of the credit he will be able to do what is necessary to work with his crops. He will make his purchases in the city of Ventanas. His dream is to be able to buy his own land. The challenges that he faces are the plagues like mice and worms. In his free time he likes to play ball.

loans.use: to buy round up, urea, insecticides, fertilizers and organic manure.

loans.name: Luis Martín

texts.es:
Luis  es un señor de 48 años de edad, vecino de una comunidad rural de Costa Rica situada 45 kilómetros al sur de San José llamada San Cristóbal. San Cristóbal es una zona ligeramente montañosa donde se desarrollan actividades como el comercio, agricultura de hortalizas, café, artesanía, ganadería y otras.

Desde hace varios años que don Luis se dedica entre otras actividades a la siembra y cosecha de café, es un hombre muy trabajador  y emprendedor. Con su trabajo ha ayudado a que la condición de vida de su familia haya mejorado considerablemente, Su proyecto cafetalero necesita de mantenimiento para obtener calidad en el producto durante el proceso de desarrollo, para ello está solicitando un crédito de setecientos mil colones (¢700.000) para comprar insumos agrícolas como plaguicidas, herbicidas, abonos y otros. Con este crédito dará mantenimiento a su cafeto, obtendrá café de buena calidad y económicamente saldrá adelante y mejorará aún más su calidad de vida, como lo ha hecho con otros préstamos que ha obtenido y que según él han sido de gran ayuda y bendición para él y su familia
Don Luis es socio de la Empresa de Crédito Comunal San Cristóbal Norte (SACRIN), una de las 150 organizaciones socias de EDESA en Costa Rica.
texts.en:
Luis is a 48-year-old gentleman who lives in the rural Costa Rican community of San Cristóbal, which is located 45 kilometers to the south of San José. San Cristóbal is a slightly mountainous area that is the home to businesses involved in trade, vegetable farming, coffee, handicrafts, livestock breeding, and other areas.

For several years, Don Luis has been devoted to the planting and harvesting of coffee among his many activities. He is a hardworking and enterprising gentleman. Due to his work, he has helped to improve his family’s living conditions considerably. His coffee farm needs to be maintained throughout the development process in order to obtain a quality product. For this reason, he is requesting a loan of 700,000 CRC in order to buy farming supplies such as pesticides, herbicides, compost, and other items. With this loan, he will be able to maintain his coffee farm, obtain coffee that is of good quality, get ahead financially, and improve his quality of life even more. He was able to achieve similar results with the previous loans he obtained and says that they have been a great help and benefit for himself and his family.

Don Luis is a member of the Communal Credit Enterprise of San Cristóbal Norte (SACRIN), one of the 150 member organizations that make up EDESA in Costa Rica.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies for his coffee farm.

loans.name: Bunsong's Group

texts.en:
Bunsong is 64 years old and married. His family lives in a rural area of the Ek Phnom district of Battambang province, Cambodia. He has two children to take care of. 

The main source of the family’s income is rice farming, in which Bunsong has been involved for 32 years. With the current business he earns approximately 40,000 KHR per day and manages to save 10,000 KHR each day after daily expenses. Drought is the main challenge for his business. 

Bunsong has been with VisionFund for five cycles, while the other group member has been with VisionFund for one cycle. He completely repaid the past loans, which have helped him relieve his family’s burden and improve their life conditions. 

Now leading his group of two to request a loan, Bunsong will use his portion to buy rice seeds for his farmland and spend a part of it on ploughing the field. He hopes to plant his rice fruitfully so as to make a better living in the local village.

loans.use: to buy rice seeds for his farmland.

loans.name: El Progreso 1 Group

texts.en:
Francisca lives near El Seybo, Dominican Republic, in a rural community. She is one of the borrowers from the group named El Progreso (The Progress) 1. She has five children who live with her and their father in a batey located in the north of EL Seybo ("bateyes" are small rural communities built by sugar companies for their field workers). 

Despite her difficulties, Francisca makes the most of her opportunities and she operates a little grocery store where she sells rice, beans, sugar, eggs, canned food and many other similar items. She operates her business during the day from her small business located next to her house.

Francisca is requesting a loan to purchase items to increase her inventory. She has had five previous loans and she has been able to bring changes to her family’s life, such as providing school supplies, shoes, clothing, and tending to other needs.

loans.use: To buy rice, beans, and other goods

loans.name: Vailaasia

texts.en: Vailaasia is 37 years old and married with 5 children. She has a plantation where she grows taro and bananas that she can sell in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for 4 years. Vailaasia needs a loan to purchase new tools as well as a new fence. She has been a member of SPBD since 2009. Vailaasia will use the profits from her sales to help with her family's expenses and her kids' education.

loans.use: to buy shovels, weed killer, gloves, and bush knives for her farm

loans.name: Rosa Maria Del Carmen

texts.es:
Rosa, administra una tienda, vive en casa propia, junto a su esposo quien es empleado de una distribuidora de productos de primera necesidad, ella inició este negocio hace dos años ofreciendo productos hará el hogar y recargas telefónicas.

Está solicitando un préstamo por qué quiere fortalecer el negocio aumentando el inventario, su compra se hará en arroz, azúcar, gaseosas, papel higiénico, embutidos, estos son algunos de los productos en los que deba invertir  aumentando así sus niveles en los inventarios, logrará adquirir mejores ofertas de compra de mayoreo y considera que dentro de sus riesgos están los productos perecederos que en algunas ocasiones se vencen.

Dentro de sus objetivos a corto plazo está tener una tienda muy competitiva, surtirla de todos los productos para el hogar de los clientes, poder aportar ingreso a su familia.
texts.en: Rosa manages a grocery store.  She lives in her own house with her husband who works for a basic staples supplier.  She started her business two years ago selling household items and mobile phone airtime cards.  She’s requesting a loan because she wants to strengthen the business by increasing the inventory.  She will buy rice, sugar, soft-drinks, toilet paper and canned goods which are some of the products she must invest in to increasing her inventory.  By purchasing at wholesale she’ll get better prices.  Some of the risk she has to face is that perishable items sometimes pass their sell-by dates.  Among her short-term goals are to have a very competitive store that’s stocked with all the household products for her customers and to be able to contribute to family income.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, soft-drinks, toilet paper, canned goods.

loans.name: Gerardo Ivan

texts.es: GERARDO TIENE 29 AÑOS DE EDAD, TRABAJA COMO OBRERO EN UNA EMPRESA DE LA CIUDAD. ADEMAS DE SU EMPLEO GERARDO ESTA ASOCIADO CON UN AMIGO Y ENTRE LOS DOS RENTAN EQUIPO DE SONIDO Y REALIZAN MEZCLAS MUSICALES PARA FIESTAS Y EVENTOS SOCIALES. ESTA ACTIVIDAD LA REALIZAN CADA FIN DE SEMANA Y DE AHI GERARDO OBTIENE UN INGRESO EXTRA. ACTUALMENTE EL TIENE EL DESEO DE PODER COMPRAR SU PROPIO EQUIPO DE SONIDO PARA PODER TRABAJAR POR SU PROPIA CUENTA Y ASI OBTENER UN MEJOR INGRESO. DEBIDO A ESTO EL SOLICITA EL PRESTAMO PARA LLEVAR ACABO LA COMPRA DEL EQUIPO QUE NECESITA.
texts.en:
Gerardo is 29 years old and works as a laborer in a company in the city. In addition to his job, Gerardo is associated with a friend and between the two they rent a sound system to make music mixes for parties and social events. They do this activity every weekend, from where Gerardo gets an extra income. 

He currently has the desire to buy his own sound system to work by himself and therefore get a better income. Because of this, he is requesting a loan to be able to buy the sound system he needs.

loans.use: to buy a sound system.

loans.name: Melchora Senovia

texts.es:
Senovia tiene 30 años y es madre soltera, tiene un hijo de niño de 11 años. Senovia como no tenia trabajo  empezó  estudiar corte y confección ya que ella necesitaba estudiar algo a corto plazo para tener ingresos. 
Ya que ella tiene que mantener a su hijo y cubrir sus gastos, busco la oportunidad de trabajar en lo que ella había estudiado, empezó ahorrar hasta lograr tener un capital considerable para instalar su propio negocio que es un Taller de confección de ropa.

En la actualidad su trabajo lo hace con una amiga quien le ayuda desde que decidió independizarse. Tiene muchas aspiracion con su negocio por eso quiere comprar con el prestamo telas y tijeras. Su meta es hacer su negocio más grande y hacer trabajo para alguna institución por contrato .
texts.en:
Senovia is thirty years old and she is a single mother. She has an eleven-year-old son. Since she didn't have a job, Senovia started learning dressmaking because she needed to study something short-term in order to have an income. 

Since she has to support her son and cover their expenses, she looked for an opportunity to work in her field. She started saving up until she managed to have enough capital to set up her own business, which is a dressmaking workshop. 

She is currently working with a friend who has helped her ever since she decided to become independent. She has many aspirations for her her business, which is why she wants to purchase fabric and scissors with this loan. Her goal is to expand her business and get a contract to do work for a company.

loans.use: to buy fabric and scissors.

loans.name: Renovacion Las Aguilas 1 & 3 Group

texts.en:
Nieve is one of the members of the Renovacion las Aguilas (Las Aguilas renovation) group 1 & 3, named in honor of the baseball team in their city. The group includes 10 micro-business people who sell clothes, natural products, shoes, food, etc. This group is located in Santiago, the second largest city in the country. 

Nieve's family includes herself and her four children, only one of whom lives with her. She is very excited to receive her 8th loan with Esperanza Internacional after having duly paid back her previous loan and taken steps to grow her business. She has had her business for six years. She started it when she took her first loan.

Nieve plans to invest her new loan in her business. She sells new clothes and miscellaneous products, and she will use this loan to buy clothes such as pants, blouses, skirts, shirts and underwear as well as shoes and cosmetics. She will use her business profits to expand her business and also to save to rebuild her house. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy clothes.

loans.name: Elsa

texts.es: Elsa tiene 51 años y vive al sur occidente e la ciudad con su esposo y tienen dos hojso en las edades de 6 y 10 años. En su comunidad Elsa se dedica a comercializar productos, los cuales distribuye entre sus clientes mediante encargos y a crédito. Sus principales compradores son los vecinos del sector profesores de los colegios del barrio y referídos, quienes constantemente solicitan mercancías como sabanas y ropa femenina, masculina en estilos casuales; Su idea de negocio nació cuando su hermana se lo propuso hace 4 años y desde esa época no se ha detenido. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer finaciamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará sábanas, jeans, suéter de caballeros y blusas para damas;  con esta inversión mejorará su negocio en surtido y las ventas aumentarán porque lo hace en una época de gran movimiento comercial como lo es el segundo semestre del año, donde usualm,ente las ventas de los productos que vende se incrementan. Su meta a corto plazo es aumentar el surtido y comprar una casa y para ello se prepara dia a dia trabajando con el fin de lograr su sueño de prosperidad.,
texts.en:
Elsa, 51, lives in the southwest part of the city with her husband; they have two children who are 6 and 10 years old.  Elsa sells merchandise in her community among her customers to order and on credit.  Her main buyers are neighbors in the area who are teachers in local schools and referred customers who constantly request merchandise like sheets and casual clothes for women and men.  The idea for this business arose when her sister suggested it to her four years ago and she hasn’t stopped since then.

She is currently applying for a Kiva loan, her first financing with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo through which she’ll buy sheets, jeans, men’s sweaters and women’s blouses.  She will improve her inventory with this loan and sales will increase because she’s doing this at a time such as the year’s second semester when commercial activity increases; sales of the products she sells usually increase at this time.  Her short-term goal is to increase her inventory and to buy a house and to do so she prepares each day by working hard aiming at reaching her dream of prosperity.

loans.use: to buy sheets, jeans, men's sweaters and women's blouses.

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es:
Reciban ustedes un cordial saludo:
En esta oportunidad conocerán a nuestra socia Carmen una mujer de 58 años de edad casada con 06 hijos independientes. Hace más de 20 años que Carmen se dedica a la venta de golosinas, gelatinas y pan con pollo en un parque, también los ofrece en eventos que realiza su localidad. Se siente orgullosa pues con su trabajo a podido apoyar a sus hijos con sus estudios y mejorar su vivienda. El crédito solicitado lo utilizara para la compra de golosinas y también para algunos medicamentos para su esposo ya que se encuentra delicada de salud. Su mayor deseo es de seguir trabajando positivamente. Agradece a las personas que hicieron posible este crédito.
texts.en:
A cordial greeting to all of you.

On this occasion you will get to know Carmen, a 58-year-old, married woman who has six independent children.  Carmen has been selling sweets, gelatin desserts and bread with chicken in a park for the last 20 years; she also sells them at local community events.  She feels proud because she’s been able to support her children’s education and to do some home improvements thanks to her work.  She will use the requested loan to buy sweets and also some medicine her husband needs; he’s in a delicate state of health.  Her greatest desire is to continue working positively.  She thanks all those who made this loan possible.

loans.use: to buy snacks.

loans.name: Rosa Marina

texts.es:
Rosa, se dedica a la venta de tortillas, su horario este cuatro de la mañana a dos de la tarde tiene varios años destacada en este negocio.
Ella se ve en la necesidad de solicitar un préstamo porque no cuenta con los recursos necesarios para realizar la compra de maíz y de leña, que son los materiales de ayuda para realizar la elaboración de tortillas, el préstamo será un gran aporte ya que compra el maíz por mayor cantidad a un mejor precio.

Su objetivo es pagar en el corto plazo este préstamo, ya que quiere tener ganancias libres, pero al mismo tiempo considera la necesidad para que su negocio funcione poder administrarlos bien, como el que se le proporciono anteriormente.
texts.en:
Rosa sells tortillas. She works from 4 A.M. to 2 P.M. Rosa has been known for being in this business for several years.

She needs to request a loan because she does not have the adequate resources to buy corn and firewood. These supplies are needed for making tortillas. The loan will be a great help because she will be able to buy corn in bulk quantities and obtain a better price.

Rosa’s goal in the short term is to pay off this loan because she wants to have income that is freed up for other expenses. At the same time, she knows that she must manage her business well just as she has done before.

loans.use: to buy corn and firewood.

loans.name: Banco Mujer Sinai Group

texts.es:
Dana es la presidenta de Banco Mujer SINAI, su labor como líder ha sido muy buena, y su grupo tiene una trayectoria de más de 4 años. Con 38 años, es viuda, y madre de 2 hijos con edades de 13 y 4 años, ella es una mujer muy emprendedora, comerciante desde hace muchos años y vende; ropa de mujer, sandalias, bisutería, y el crédito lo quiere invertir en eso.
Su meta es llegar a tener una pequeña tienda en su casa, pero son dejar de vender en forma ambulante como hasta ahora. Sabe que con esfuerzo y responsabilidad, además de la ayuda de los préstamos de Fundación Mujer podrá lograrlo. 
Junto a Dana está Doña Mayela que va a invertir en avicultura.
texts.en:
Dana is the president of Banco Mujer SINAI. Her work as a leader has been very good and her group has a history of more than four years. She is 38 years old, is widow, and mother of two children who are 13 and four years old. She is entrepreneur, merchant for many years and sells women's clothing, sandals, and jewelry. She wants to invest the loan in this.

Her goal is to have a small store at home, but without stop selling on the streets as usual. She knows that with effort and responsibility, as well as with the help from Fundación Mujer's loans, she will achieve it. 

Next to Dana, there's Mayela, who is going to invest in poultry.

loans.use: to buy clothes, sandals and jewelry for sale.

loans.name: Rogelio

texts.es: ROGELIO ES UN HOMBRE DE 40 AÑOS DE EDAD, ESTA CASADO CON IRMA Y TIENEN 2 HIJOS. DESDE HACE 5 AÑOS EL TRABAJA EN UN TALLER DE SOLDADURA. SU ESPOSA ES UNA MUJER QUE SE DEDICA AL HOGAR Y CUIDAR DE LOS HIJOS. ROGELIO Y SU ESPOSA HAN VISTO LA NECESIDAD DE MEJORAR SU VIVIENDA PARA BENEFICIO DE SU FAMILIA, YA QUE ELLOS QUIEREN MANTENER A SU FAMILIA SEGURA Y OFRECERLES UNA VIVIENDA DE CALIDAD. POR ESTA RAZON ELLOS SOLICITAN EL PRESTAMO PARA LLEVAR ACABO LA BARDA TRASERA DE SU CASA CON LO CUAL BUSCAN PODER MANTENER LA PRIVACIDAD DE SU FAMILIA Y DAR MAYOR PROTECCION A SU CASA.
texts.en: Rogelio, 40, is married to Irma and has two children. He has worked in a soldering shop for five years. His wife takes care of their home and the children. Rogelio and his wife recognize the need to make improvements to their home because they want their family to be safe and live in decent conditions. Therefore, he is applying for a loan to build a back wall for the house that will ensure privacy and better protection for his family.

loans.use: to build a back wall for his house.

loans.name: Elkhan

texts.en: Elkhan is 44 years old and married. He has three children; they are all attend school. Elkhan has been raising livestock for the past 21 years, mainly buying and selling cattle at Baku. Additionally, he is engaged in agriculture on his farm. He is requesting a loan of 1,000 AZN to purchase four calves to raise and sell.

loans.use: To purchase four calves to raise and sell.

loans.name: Ananías

texts.es:
Don Ananías tiene 58 años de edad, es un agricultor con muchos años de experiencia, se preocupa porque la cosecha de café que recoge cada año sea de buena calidad y abundante, por eso abona bien la tierra y le proporciona todos los insumos agrícolas necesarios para lograrlo. 
La siembra que está realizando  actualmente necesita de esos insumos por lo que está solicitando un crédito de seiscientos mil colones (¢600.000)para comprar dichos productos como abono, plaguicida, insecticida entre otros.
El vive con su esposa y dos hijos, quienes lo apoyan en esta y cualquier otra labor emprendedora que él realice.
Vive en San Cristóbal que es un pueblo rural perteneciente a la ciudad de San José, ahí la mayoría de personas se dedican a la siembra del café .
texts.en:
Don Ananías, age 58, is a farmer with many years of experience. Every year, he is concerned about obtaining an abundant harvest that is of good quality. For this reason, he makes sure that his land is well-fertilized and that he has all the farming supplies that he needs to accomplish this.

Planting is taking place at the moment, so he is need of supplies. For this reason, he is requesting a loan of 600,000 CRC so that he can buy supplies such as compost, pesticides, herbicides, and other items.

Ananías lives with his wife and two children, who help him with any of the duties that need to be performed. They reside in San Cristóbal, a rural area that is part of the city of San José. Most of the people who live there are coffee farmers.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies.

loans.name: Tsetsegmaa

texts.en:
Mrs. Tsetsegmaa is 39 years old and lives with her husband and three children in an apartment in Suhbaatar district in Ulaanbaatar, Mongolia. Her husband, Davaasuren, is 39 years old. Her older daughter, Enhtushig, is 17 years old; her younger daughter, Zolzaya, is 15 years old; and her son, Battushig, is 7 years old and stays home with his father. They are all secondary school students. 

In 2010, Mrs. Tsetsegmaa, started a door locks sales business on a rented counter. There is a solid demand for her products. Her husband is planning to start his own business because Tsetsegmaa's business income not enough to cover their family needs. He will sell construction materials. Tsetsegmaa wants to help for her husband to start his business. She is a hard-working and honest person, and she needs 4 000 000 MNT to buy stall and construction materials for her husband's business.

loans.use: To buy stall and construction materials to sell for her husband's business

loans.name: Yadira Del Socorro

texts.es: Yadira del Socorro de 43 anos de edad, madre soltera con 4 hijos de 26,25,23,18 anos, el cual solamente la de  18 anos esta bajo su responsabilidad. Yadira es originaria del municipio de chichigalpa,del departamento de Chinandega, lugar que queda en el occidente del país,  esta zona se caracteriza por ser una zona productora de cana de azúcar, de tener gente muy trabajadora  honrada. El negocio de Yadira es la venta de mercadería en general que consisten en vender ropa nueva, cosméticos, adornos, ropa interior. Yadira inicio este negocio desde hace 9 anos, enl cual lo distribuye de forma ambulante y en su domicilio, por  la misma necesidad de mejorar los ingresos y sacar a sus hijos adelante. Ella ya ha trabajado con León 2000 y ha demostrado ser buena paga en tiempo y forma. El objetivo del préstamo es invertir en capital de trabajo para mejorar sus ingresos y brindarles mejores condiciones de vida  a sus hijos. Con el financiamiento comprara: ropa de niños, ropa de adultos, cosméticos como pinturas labiales, rubor, lápiz de ojos, sombra de ojos. En la foto observamos a Yadira con algunos de los productos que ofrece a sus clientes.Yadira agradece la ayuda que los prestamista kiva le brindan a las personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua.
texts.en:
Yadira del Socorro, 43, is a single mother with four children who are 26, 25, 23 and 18 years old; only the 18-year-old is still in her care.  Yadira is from the town of Chichigalpa in Chinandega Department a place located in the west of the country.  This zone is noted for producing sugarcane and for having very honest, hardworking residents.  

Yadira’s business is selling general merchandise like new clothes, cosmetics, decorations and underwear.  Yadira started the business nine years ago.   She sells from place to place and at home because she needs to increase income and move her children forward.

She has collaborated with Fundación León 2000 and has had good, punctual repayment behavior.  This loan’s objective is to invest in working capital to improve her income and provide better living conditions for her children.  She will use the loan to buy children’s clothes, clothes for adults, cosmetics like lipstick, blush, eyeliner and eye shadow.  

In the photo, Yadira appears with some of the products she sells to customers.  Yadira is grateful for the support Kiva lenders provide to people of limited resources and poor countries like Nicaragua.

loans.use: to buy general merchandise like clothes, cosmetics and decorations.

loans.name: Nuria Lizeth

texts.es:
